original: @336b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @336b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: tarka bh'a sh'a /
analyzed: tarka bh'a sh'a /
translated: TarkabhƒÅ·π£ƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rtog ge'i skad /
analyzed: rtog ge'i skad /
translated: The Language of Logic

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.

original: bla ma 'jig rten dbang btud nas //
analyzed: bla ma 'jig rten dbang btud nas //
translated: Having bowed to the guru, the Lord of the World,

original: byis pa yid gzhungs chung ba rnams //
analyzed: byis pa yid gzhungs chung ba rnams //
translated: For the sake of those young people of little intelligence

original: chos kyi grags pa'i lugs mnyan phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi grags pa'i lugs mnyan phyir //
translated: Who wish to listen to the system of Dharmakƒ´rti,

original: rtog ge'i skad ni rab gsal bya //
analyzed: rtog ge'i skad ni rab gsal bya //
translated: I will clarify the language of logic.

original: 'dir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba don du gnyer ba'i skye bo rnams /
analyzed: 'dir rtog pa sngon du gtong ba don du gnyer ba'i skye bo rnams /
translated: Here, those beings who seek to engage in analysis

original: skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang bas dang por tshad ma gtan la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don thams cad 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan tshad ma'i rjes su 'brang bas dang por tshad ma gtan la dbab par bya'o //
translated: should first establish valid cognition, because all the goals of a person are accomplished by following the reason of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngar ma rtogs pa'i spyod yul can no //
analyzed: tshad ma ni yang dag pa'i shes pa sngar ma rtogs pa'i spyod yul can no //
translated: Valid cognition is a correct consciousness that has an object that was not previously realized.

original: 'dis don 'jal bas na tshad ma yin la de nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa ste the tshom dang phyin ci log gi skyon dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis don 'jal bas na tshad ma yin la de nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa ste the tshom dang phyin ci log gi skyon dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is valid cognition because it comprehends an object, and that itself is correct consciousness, because it is free from the faults of doubt and error.

original: slu ba med pa'i shes pa ni 'jig rten na yang dag pa'i shes par brjod la /
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i shes pa ni 'jig rten na yang dag pa'i shes par brjod la /
translated: Nondeceptive consciousness is called ‚Äúvalid knowledge‚Äù even in the world.

original: the tshom dang phyin ci log gi shes pa dag la mi slu ba nyid yod pa yang ma yin te shing skam mam mi yin snyam pa'i shes pa dang / smig rgyu la chu'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: the tshom dang phyin ci log gi shes pa dag la mi slu ba nyid yod pa yang ma yin te shing skam mam mi yin snyam pa'i shes pa dang / smig rgyu la chu'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: And it is not that doubt and mistaken consciousnesses are nondeceptive, because they are like the consciousnesses thinking ‚ÄúIs it a tree or a man?‚Äù and the consciousness of water with respect to a mirage.

original: de'i spyod yul sngar med pa yin pas sngar ma rtogs pa'i spyod yul can no //
analyzed: de'i spyod yul sngar med pa yin pas sngar ma rtogs pa'i spyod yul can no //
translated: It is an object of knowledge that was not previously known, because its object was not previously known.

original: spyod yul ni yul de bum pa la sogs pa yin la //
analyzed: spyod yul ni yul de bum pa la sogs pa yin la //
translated: The object is the object of that, such as a pot.

original: de las skyes pa de'i don thob par rung ba'i shes pa ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa de'i don thob par rung ba'i shes pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: The consciousness that arises from that and is suitable to attain its object is valid knowledge.

original: 'o na gal te shes pa byed pa po dang skyes bu sbyar bar bya ba dang don las su gyur pa gang gi tshe yan thob par mi byed na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te shes pa byed pa po dang skyes bu sbyar bar bya ba dang don las su gyur pa gang gi tshe yan thob par mi byed na /
translated: If consciousness is the agent and the person is the object of the action, and the object is the object of the action, then when it does not cause the attainment of the object,

original: de thob par byed pa po ma yi pa nyid kyi phyir ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa po ma yi pa nyid kyi phyir ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be valid knowledge, because it is not the agent that causes the attainment of that?

original: brjod par bya ste shes pas skyes bu mgrin pa nas bkug pa'i tshul du stobs kyis don la rab tu gzhug par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste shes pas skyes bu mgrin pa nas bkug pa'i tshul du stobs kyis don la rab tu gzhug par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: I will explain this. A person should not be forced to understand an object by the power of the teacher, as if the teacher were pulling the person‚Äôs throat.

original: 'on kyang ji lta bur gyur pa 'di dngos po'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji lta bur gyur pa 'di dngos po'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Rather, the nature of things is just as it is.

original: rnam pa gzhan du @337a * //üîΩni ma yin no zhes pa'i rnam pa 'dis nges pa bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing de gal te des byas na de tsam nyid de'i tshad ma yin pas 'gal ba med la skyes bu ni de la dgos pa'i dbang las 'jug pa nyid de dgos pa
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du @337a * // ni ma yin no zhes pa'i rnam pa 'dis nges pa bskyed par bya ba ma yin zhing de gal te des byas na de tsam nyid de'i tshad ma yin pas 'gal ba med la skyes bu ni de la dgos pa'i dbang las 'jug pa nyid de dgos pa
translated: It is not otherwise.üîΩIn this way, certainty should be generated. If that is produced by that, that alone is the valid knowledge of that person.

original: med na mi 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: med na mi 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: There is no contradiction. The person engages in that by the power of the need. If there is no need, he does not engage.

original: don yang rnal 'byor pa dang sha za la sogs pa nyid kyis bsgribs pa nyid de /
analyzed: don yang rnal 'byor pa dang sha za la sogs pa nyid kyis bsgribs pa nyid de /
translated: Also, the object is obscured by the yogi, the flesh eater, and so on.

original: shes pa la ni ring ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: shes pa la ni ring ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is far for consciousness?

original: 'o na mi slu ba nyid kyis shes pa tshad ma yin la mi slu ba nyid kyang mthong ba'i don thob par byed pa las yin na /
analyzed: 'o na mi slu ba nyid kyis shes pa tshad ma yin la mi slu ba nyid kyang mthong ba'i don thob par byed pa las yin na /
translated: If valid knowledge is nondeceptive consciousness and nondeceptiveness is the attainment of the object seen,

original: gang mthong ba de thob par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang mthong ba de thob par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that one obtains what one sees,

original: skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of momentariness.

original: gang gzugs mthong la reg bya thob par byed na ni de'i phyir gzhan mthong zhig gzhan thob par byed pas rtogs pa ma yin pa 'thob par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gzugs mthong la reg bya thob par byed na ni de'i phyir gzhan mthong zhig gzhan thob par byed pas rtogs pa ma yin pa 'thob par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one sees a visible form and obtains a tangible, then, since one sees one thing and obtains another, one would obtain what is not cognized. How then could it be a valid cognition?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: dngos por na gzhan thob tu zin mod //
analyzed: dngos por na gzhan thob tu zin mod //
translated: Although one obtains another thing,

original: 'on kyang mthong ba kho na bdag gis thob po snyam du gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa las rtogs pa thob par brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba kho na bdag gis thob po snyam du gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa las rtogs pa thob par brjod do //
translated: nevertheless, one thinks, ‚ÄúI obtain what I see,‚Äù and one speaks of obtaining what is cognized, because of the conception of unity.

original: gang smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni don thob par rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni don thob par rung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The consciousness of water, etc., in regard to a mirage, etc., is not a valid cognition, because it is not suitable to obtain the object.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not a valid cognition.

original: 'o na 'di ni thob par byed par rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'di ni thob par byed par rung ba'o //
translated: But this is suitable to obtain.

original: 'di ni ma yin no zhes don bya ba ni thob pa med par nges par nus la shes pa skye ba tsam gyis ma 'khrul ba dang / ma 'khrul ba dag gis bye brag mi rtogs pas de'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin no zhes don bya ba ni thob pa med par nges par nus la shes pa skye ba tsam gyis ma 'khrul ba dang / ma 'khrul ba dag gis bye brag mi rtogs pas de'i phyir //
translated: But this is not so, for it is certain that the object is not obtained, and the mere arising of cognition is not non-erroneous, and non-erroneous cognitions do not distinguish particulars.

original: de ji ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba zhe na /
translated: So how can it be called right knowledge?

original: skyon 'di ni med de shes pa tsam skye ba las 'di dag gi khyad par rtogs par mi nus mod /
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de shes pa tsam skye ba las 'di dag gi khyad par rtogs par mi nus mod /
translated: This fault does not exist, for although their distinction cannot be known from the mere arising of cognition,

original: 'on kyang shes pa'i khyad par skyes pa las te /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa'i khyad par skyes pa las te /
translated: it is from the arising of a special cognition.

original: ji ltar gcig gi khyad par can yin pa de ltar brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig gi khyad par can yin pa de ltar brjod do //
translated: Just as it is distinguished from one, so it is expressed.

original: de ltar yang blo zhan pas ni skyes pa'i dbang las shes pa mi slu ba nyid du rtogs par mi nus mod //
analyzed: de ltar yang blo zhan pas ni skyes pa'i dbang las shes pa mi slu ba nyid du rtogs par mi nus mod //
translated: Thus, a person of little intelligence cannot know non-deceptive cognition from the arising of cognition.

original: 'on kyang sreg pa dang 'tshed pa dang / 'bogs pa dang / khrus dang brtun pa dang / bsku ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa ring po nas nyams su myong ba'i skyes bu mthong bas sam /
analyzed: 'on kyang sreg pa dang 'tshed pa dang / 'bogs pa dang / khrus dang brtun pa dang / bsku ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa ring po nas nyams su myong ba'i skyes bu mthong bas sam /
translated: But seeing a person who has experienced the functioning of fire, such as burning, cooking, scorching, cleansing, drying, and heating from a distance,

original: du ba phyur ba la sogs pa mthong bas nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: du ba phyur ba la sogs pa mthong bas nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: and by seeing smoke, fire is ascertained.

original: blo mi zhan pas ni shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum kho nas rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: blo mi zhan pas ni shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum kho nas rtogs par byed do //
translated: But when the mind is not weak, one understands by a very clear perception.

original: 'on gal te don bya ba thob pas na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid can tshad @337b ma nyid yin pa de'i tshe rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i don thob par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on gal te don bya ba thob pas na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid can tshad @337b ma nyid yin pa de'i tshe rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rtogs pa'i don thob par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But if validity is the characteristic of non-deception in attaining the object, then how can auditory perception be valid, since it does not attain the object that is perceived?

original: ma yin te don gyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ni tshad ma nyid yin la de yang phyir rol gyi don gyi bya ba thob pa med par yang 'ga' zhig tu yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te don gyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa ni tshad ma nyid yin la de yang phyir rol gyi don gyi bya ba thob pa med par yang 'ga' zhig tu yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the validity of a cognition is the attainment of the object‚Äôs own nature, and that is possible even without attaining the external object‚Äôs function.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //
analyzed: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //
translated: A valid cognition is a non-deceptive cognition.

original: don gyi bya ba gnas pa ni //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba gnas pa ni //
translated: The abiding of the object‚Äôs function

original: mi slu zhes so //
analyzed: mi slu zhes so //
translated: is called non-deceptive.

original: sgra ni mnyan pa tsam nyid kyis don dpyad zin pa nyid kyi phyir myang pa kho na der don gyi bya ba gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sgra ni mnyan pa tsam nyid kyis don dpyad zin pa nyid kyi phyir myang pa kho na der don gyi bya ba gnas pa ste /
translated: Because the meaning is analyzed merely by hearing the sound, the function of the meaning is complete just by hearing.

original: dper na nyi ma dang zla ba dang sprin dang ri mo la sogs pa rnams mthong ba kho na don gyi bya ba gnas pa yin pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: dper na nyi ma dang zla ba dang sprin dang ri mo la sogs pa rnams mthong ba kho na don gyi bya ba gnas pa yin pa bzhin no ;
translated: For example, the function of the meaning is complete just by seeing the sun, the moon, clouds, pictures, and so on.

original: / de gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de gsungs pa /
translated: He says that:

original: shes bya'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa kho na de la don gyi bya ba gnas par 'dod do zhes so //
analyzed: shes bya'i rang gi ngo bo rig pa kho na de la don gyi bya ba gnas par 'dod do zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe function of the meaning is complete just by knowing the nature of the object of knowledge.‚Äù

original: dang po ni rtog pa dang ldan pa don bya ba don du gnyer ba nyid kyis chu dang me la sogs pa la don gyi bya ba la the tshom za ba kho nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: dang po ni rtog pa dang ldan pa don bya ba don du gnyer ba nyid kyis chu dang me la sogs pa la don gyi bya ba la the tshom za ba kho nas 'jug ste /
translated: The first is that a person who has doubt and who seeks to perform a function engages in the object of doubt, such as water, fire, and so on.

original: gal te de la 'di lta bu'i the tshom med du chug kyang /
analyzed: gal te de la 'di lta bu'i the tshom med du chug kyang /
translated: Even if he does not have such doubt,

original: 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nevertheless, because there is no valid knowledge that establishes or refutes,

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: as it is said:

original: the tshom 'gyur ba gang gis zlog par byed //
analyzed: the tshom 'gyur ba gang gis zlog par byed //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what is doubt reversed?‚Äù

original: ces so // de'i phyir 'di ni gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: ces so // de'i phyir 'di ni gnas pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, this is the correct position.

original: don gyi bya ba'i tha snyad rtogs pa bar chad med pas shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum skyes pa kho na las don la rab tu 'jug la /
analyzed: don gyi bya ba'i tha snyad rtogs pa bar chad med pas shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum skyes pa kho na las don la rab tu 'jug la /
translated: One engages in the object by means of direct perception alone, which is very clear because it is uninterrupted by the understanding of the conventions of the object's function.

original: blo zhan pas ni de dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa las so zhes so //
analyzed: blo zhan pas ni de dang mthun pa'i rjes su dpag pa las so zhes so //
translated: But the weak-minded do so by means of inference that is in conformity with that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum ni rang nyid kho na las tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum ni rang nyid kho na las tshad ma nyid do //
translated: For this very reason, direct perception is valid cognition by itself alone.

original: kha cig ni gzhan las so //üîΩrnal 'byor pa'i shes pa dang rang rig pa'i shes pa ni rang nyid kho na las tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan las so // rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa dang rang rig pa'i shes pa ni rang nyid kho na las tshad ma nyid do //
translated: Some say it is by another.üîΩThe master says that the consciousness of the yogi and the consciousness of self-awareness are valid cognition by themselves alone.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni nges pa'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir rang nyid kho na las tshad ma'o zhes slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni nges pa'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir rang nyid kho na las tshad ma'o zhes slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
translated: Inference is valid cognition by itself alone because it has the nature of ascertainment.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te gang dang po kho nar yul la 'jug pa'i shes pa la de kho na tshad ma ste de nyid la phyis skyes pa'i shes pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te gang dang po kho nar yul la 'jug pa'i shes pa la de kho na tshad ma ste de nyid la phyis skyes pa'i shes pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: The first cognition that engages the object is valid with regard to that object alone, but other subsequent cognitions are not.

original: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis de'i tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis de'i tshad ma nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not valid with regard to that object, since it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: dper na rtogs pa dang bral bas bum pa mthong nas phyis yul de nyid la 'di bum pa'o zhes lhag par zhen pa rnam pa rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa dran pa'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: dper na rtogs pa dang bral bas bum pa mthong nas phyis yul de nyid la 'di bum pa'o zhes lhag par zhen pa rnam pa rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa dran pa'i ngo bo'am /
translated: For example, after seeing a pot without conceptual thought, one later conceives of that object with conceptual thought, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù in the form of memory.

original: yang na la la sogs pa la du ba mthong nas 'di na @338a * //
analyzed: yang na la la sogs pa la du ba mthong nas 'di na @338a * //
translated: Or, after seeing smoke on a mountain, one infers, ‚ÄúThere is fire there.‚Äù

original: me yod do zhes pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i de ma thag tu slar yang de kho na la 'di na me yod do snyam pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me yod do zhes pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i de ma thag tu slar yang de kho na la 'di na me yod do snyam pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Immediately after the inferential cognition, one again conceives of that object with inferential cognition, thinking, ‚ÄúThere is fire there.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa tshad ma'i zhes brjod pas na shugs las bems po'i rang bzhin dbang po la sogs pa ni yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid bsal lo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa tshad ma'i zhes brjod pas na shugs las bems po'i rang bzhin dbang po la sogs pa ni yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid bsal lo //
translated: Since it is said that ‚Äúright knowledge is valid cognition,‚Äù it is implicitly understood that matter, such as the sense faculties, which are by nature inert, are not valid cognitions because they do not have the function of determining.

original: yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid ni rtogs par byed pa po nyid yin zhing de yang shes pa kho na'i gnyug ma'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid ni rtogs par byed pa po nyid yin zhing de yang shes pa kho na'i gnyug ma'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The function of determining is the function of understanding, and that is the intrinsic nature of consciousness alone.

original: de shes pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur bar 'di ltar 'os zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur bar 'di ltar 'os zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not appropriate for that to become the nature of the sense faculties, etc., which are not of the nature of consciousness.

original: de rnams gnyis te /
analyzed: de rnams gnyis te /
translated: They are of two kinds:

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces pa'o //
translated: Direct perception and inference.

original: dbang po so so bar gyur ba ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: dbang po so so bar gyur ba ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The individual sense faculties are direct perception.

original: aaksha ni dbang po ste mi gdang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus zhes pa'o //
analyzed: aaksha ni dbang po ste mi gdang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus zhes pa'o //
translated: Ak·π£a means sense faculty, and the sense faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: de las skyes pa'i shes pa mngon sum mo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i shes pa mngon sum mo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the consciousness that arises from them is direct perception.

original: 'o na gal te dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin na de'i tshe yid la sogs par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i shes pa gsum po dbang po las ma skyes pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin na de'i tshe yid la sogs par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i shes pa gsum po dbang po las ma skyes pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the consciousness that is based on the sense faculty is not direct perception, then the three types of consciousness that are explained as mental and so on would not be direct perception because they are not generated from the sense faculties.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: This is to be explained.

original: dbang po so sor gyur pa zhes gang brjod pa de ni mngon sum gyi sgra'i bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan du rtogs par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po so sor gyur pa zhes gang brjod pa de ni mngon sum gyi sgra'i bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan du rtogs par byas pa yin la /
translated: The reason that is understood for the term direct perception is that which is stated as ‚Äúthe individual sense faculties.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi sgra'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don mngon du byed pa kho na la grags pa'i dbang las rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sgra'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni don mngon du byed pa kho na la grags pa'i dbang las rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The reason for the term direct perception is to be understood from the perspective of the renown that it is the direct perceiver of objects.

original: 'dam skyes bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dam skyes bzhin no //
translated: It is like a lotus born from mud.

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang rig pa'i ngo bo dang don mngon sum du byed pas na mngon sum gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang rig pa'i ngo bo dang don mngon sum du byed pas na mngon sum gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba grub bo //
translated: Therefore, reflexive awareness and so on are the objects of direct perception because they are the nature of reflexive awareness of consciousness and they are the direct perceivers of objects.

original: 'dis don dpog par byed pas na dpog pa yin la //
analyzed: 'dis don dpog par byed pas na dpog pa yin la //
translated: Inference is that which infers an object.

original: rjes su ni phyis nas kyi don la ste /
analyzed: rjes su ni phyis nas kyi don la ste /
translated: Later is the meaning of ‚Äúafterwards.‚Äù

original: phyis 'jal ba ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: phyis 'jal ba ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Inference is the subsequent cognition of an object that was not previously cognized.

original: rtags bzung ba dang rtags can gyi 'brel ba dran pa dag gis rjes su shes pa gang la la sogs pa'i chos can la lkog gyur gyi dngos po dmigs par byed pa de kho na rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod par bya'o zhes pa grags pa'i dbang las
analyzed: rtags bzung ba dang rtags can gyi 'brel ba dran pa dag gis rjes su shes pa gang la la sogs pa'i chos can la lkog gyur gyi dngos po dmigs par byed pa de kho na rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod par bya'o zhes pa grags pa'i dbang las
translated: The word ‚Äúinference‚Äù should be applied to any subsequent cognition that observes a hidden object, such as the existence of fire on a mountain pass, through the recollection of the relation between the sign and the possessor of the sign.

original: rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the authoritative statements of the AcƒÅryas.

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i tshig gis gcig dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang drug ces log par rtogs pa rnams bsal lo //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i tshig gis gcig dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang drug ces log par rtogs pa rnams bsal lo //
translated: The word ‚Äútwo‚Äù eliminates the misconceptions of one, three, four, five, and six.

original: @338b de ltar ni mngon sum gcig pu kho na tshad ma'o zhes ts'a rb'a ka'o //
analyzed: @338b de ltar ni mngon sum gcig pu kho na tshad ma'o zhes ts'a rb'a ka'o //
translated: Thus, CƒÅrvƒÅka says, ‚ÄúOnly perception is valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgra las byung ba'o //üîΩzhes grangs can pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgra las byung ba'o // zhes grangs can pa'o //
translated: SƒÅ·πÉkhya says, ‚ÄúPerception, inference, and verbal testimony.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgras las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal lo zhes rig pa can pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgras las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal lo zhes rig pa can pa'o //
translated: NaiyƒÅyika says, ‚ÄúPerception, inference, verbal testimony, and analogy.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba'o zhes 'od byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba'o zhes 'od byed pa'o //
translated: The Illuminator says, Direct perception, inference, verbal testimony, analogy, and presumption.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba dang dngos po med pa'o zhes dpyod pa pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang don gyis go ba dang dngos po med pa'o zhes dpyod pa pa'o //
translated: The Investigator says, Direct perception, inference, verbal testimony, analogy, presumption, and non-existence.

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes pa'i tshig gis gnyis nyid du thob pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes pa'i tshig gis gnyis nyid du thob pa la /
translated: The word two indicates that there are only two means of valid knowledge.

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces slar yang brjod pa ni de las rnam pa gzhan du gnyid nyid bsal ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ces slar yang brjod pa ni de las rnam pa gzhan du gnyid nyid bsal ba'i don du ste /
translated: The repetition of direct perception and inference is for the purpose of excluding other types.

original: de ltar ni brda sprod pa na re mngon sum dang sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma gnyis so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni brda sprod pa na re mngon sum dang sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma gnyis so zhes zer ro //
translated: The grammarians say, There are two means of valid knowledge: direct perception and verbal testimony.

original: de la ts'arb'a kas kyang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ts'arb'a kas kyang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that even the CƒÅrvƒÅka must accept that inference is a means of valid knowledge.

original: de ltar ni nges par mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i ched du byed la /
analyzed: de ltar ni nges par mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i ched du byed la /
translated: Thus, the definition of direct perception is definitely for the sake of understanding something else.

original: gzhan gyi blo yang mngon sum ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi blo yang mngon sum ma yin gyi /
translated: But the mind of another is not direct perception.

original: 'o na ci zhe na lus dang ngag gi bya ba'i 'bras bu las rjes su dpag par bya ba ste de'i phyir 'dis 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes dpag nan gyis khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na lus dang ngag gi bya ba'i 'bras bu las rjes su dpag par bya ba ste de'i phyir 'dis 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i rjes dpag nan gyis khas blang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, what is it? It is to be inferred from the effect of the action of body and speech. Therefore, you are forced to accept that inference is born from the sign of effect.

original: 'jig rten pha rol dgag pa'i ched du yang mi dmigs pa na zhes bya ba sgrub par byed par smra ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dgag pa'i ched du yang mi dmigs pa na zhes bya ba sgrub par byed par smra ste /
translated: In order to refute the world beyond, you say that nonobservation is a proof.

original: de'i phyir 'di rang nyid rjes su dpag pas tha snyad byed cing rjes su dpag pa tshad ma min no zhes smra ba ji ltar bsnyon pa ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rang nyid rjes su dpag pas tha snyad byed cing rjes su dpag pa tshad ma min no zhes smra ba ji ltar bsnyon pa ma yin /
translated: Therefore, how can you deny that you yourself use inference and that inference is a valid form of knowledge?

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang phyi rol gyi don la mi slu ba nyid kyis tshad mar 'dod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang phyi rol gyi don la mi slu ba nyid kyis tshad mar 'dod par bya ba yin la /
translated: You should accept that knowledge derived from words is a valid form of knowledge because it is nondeceptive with regard to external objects.

original: mi slu ba nyid kyang 'brel ba med par 'thad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid kyang 'brel ba med par 'thad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: And it is not tenable that nondeceptiveness is related to them,

original: sgra rnams phyi rol gyi don la 'brel ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams phyi rol gyi don la 'brel ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and words are related to external objects.

original: de ltar ni sgra dang don dag la 'brel ba yod na de'i bdag nyid dam de las 'byung bar 'gyur grang na /üîΩde la re zhig de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni sgra dang don dag la 'brel ba yod na de'i bdag nyid dam de las 'byung bar 'gyur grang na / de la re zhig de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: In this way, if words and meanings were related, they would be identical or one would arise from the other.

original: sgra dang don dag shin tu tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag shin tu tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: First, they are not identical because words and meanings appear to be completely different.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni gcig nyid du brjod la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni gcig nyid du brjod la /
translated: Identity is said to be one,

original: tha dad par snang ba na'ang gcig nyid du khas len na ba lang dang rta la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba na'ang gcig nyid du khas len na ba lang dang rta la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if you accept that even though they appear to be different, they are one, then it follows that even cows, horses, and so on would be one.

original: @339a * // de las byung ba yang ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @339a * // de las byung ba yang ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They also do not arise from each other because there is no invariable concomitance.

original: de'i phyir de las byung ba'o zhes smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las byung ba'o zhes smra bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore it cannot be said that they arise from each other.

original: de ltar ni sgra'i bya ba med par yang rang gi rgyu 'jim pa'i gong bu dan /
analyzed: de ltar ni sgra'i bya ba med par yang rang gi rgyu 'jim pa'i gong bu dan /
translated: In the same way, even without the activity of sound, one sees the effect, the pot, etc.,

original: dbyug pa dang / chu dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i skabs las bum pa la sogs pa'i don skye ba mthong zhing sgra yang phyi rol gyi don med par kho nar skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam gyis rkan la sogs pa'i bya ba kho na las skye'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa dang / chu dang / 'khor lo la sogs pa'i skabs las bum pa la sogs pa'i don skye ba mthong zhing sgra yang phyi rol gyi don med par kho nar skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam gyis rkan la sogs pa'i bya ba kho na las skye'o //
translated: arising from its cause, the lump of clay, the stick, the water, the wheel, the hands of the potter, etc. And sound arises only from the mere wish of a person, from the activity of the palate, etc., without any external object.

original: 'on te 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag las gzhan pa kho na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba dngos po sgra dang don dag la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ltar de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag las gzhan pa kho na brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba dngos po sgra dang don dag la yod do zhe na /
translated: But, if the relation of the signified and the signifier, which is different from identity and causality, exists in reality between the word and the object,

original: de lta na 'o na brda mi shes pa'i skyes bus kyang sgra brjod pa las rung tsam kho nas sgron ma la sogs pa las bum pa la sogs pa rtogs pa ltar don nges par rtogs par 'gyur pa zhig na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na brda mi shes pa'i skyes bus kyang sgra brjod pa las rung tsam kho nas sgron ma la sogs pa las bum pa la sogs pa rtogs pa ltar don nges par rtogs par 'gyur pa zhig na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then even a person who does not know the convention would understand the object merely by hearing the sound, just as he understands the pot, etc., from the lamp, etc. But that is not the case.

original: de ltar ni n'a li kee ra'i gling nas mngon par gsar du 'ongs pa'i skyes bu aangi'i sgra thos kyang aangi'i sgra las don nges pa ci yang mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar ni n'a li kee ra'i gling nas mngon par gsar du 'ongs pa'i skyes bu aangi'i sgra thos kyang aangi'i sgra las don nges pa ci yang mi rtogs so //
translated: In the same way, a person who has just arrived from the land of the NƒÅgas cannot understand the meaning of the word ‚Äúelephant,‚Äù even though he hears it.üîΩBut if you say that the word is the cause of the cognition of the object, because the word is related to the object by convention, that is not so.

original: 'on te brda de dan de la ltos nas de dang de dang rtogs par rung ba'i 'di kho na sgra skyes pa zhes brjod do zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te brda de dan de la ltos nas de dang de dang rtogs par rung ba'i 'di kho na sgra skyes pa zhes brjod do zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: For the word is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who has just learned the convention.

original: de ltar 'di tshad ma nyid du gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'di tshad ma nyid du gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who has forgotten the convention.üîΩAnd it is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who understands the meaning from another word.üîΩTherefore, the word is not a cause of the cognition of the object.üîΩBut if you say that the word is the cause of the cognition of the object, because it is related to the object by convention, that is not so.

original: brda thams cad du rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda thams cad du rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the word is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who has just learned the convention.üîΩAnd it is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who has forgotten the convention.üîΩAnd it is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who understands the meaning from another word.üîΩTherefore, the word is not a cause of the cognition of the object.

original: de'i phyir ci brjod par 'dod pa'i don smra ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci brjod par 'dod pa'i don smra ba'am /
translated: But if you say that the word is the cause of the cognition of the object, because it is related to the object by convention, that is not so.üîΩFor the word is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who has just learned the convention.üîΩAnd it is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who has forgotten the convention.

original: 'on te gzhan zhig shes par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'brel ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kho na yod kyang sla ste /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig shes par mi 'gyur ro // 'brel ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kho na yod kyang sla ste /
translated: And it is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a person who understands the meaning from another word.üîΩTherefore, the word is not a cause of the cognition of the object.

original: de lta na yang de yang 'brel ba ci zhig gis de dag gi 'brel ba yin zhes dri bar bya'o //üîΩ'brel ba bzhi pa gzhan gyis so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de yang 'brel ba ci zhig gis de dag gi 'brel ba yin zhes dri bar bya'o // 'brel ba bzhi pa gzhan gyis so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the word is the cause of the cognition of the object, because it is related to the object by convention, that is not so.

original: bzhi pa yang de rnams la 'brel /üîΩgang gis 'brel /
analyzed: bzhi pa yang de rnams la 'brel /üîΩgang gis 'brel /
translated: For the word is not a cause in that way, because it is not a cause in the case of a

original: lnga pa 'ga' zhig gis so zhe na /
analyzed: lnga pa 'ga' zhig gis so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the latter,

original: de yang gang gis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gang gis zhes pa ste /
translated: then by what?

original: thub pa med pa la phyi ma ma grub na snga ma rnams mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: thub pa med pa la phyi ma ma grub na snga ma rnams mi 'grub bo //
translated: If the latter is not established, the former is not established.

original: ci ste 'brel ba med pa kho na sgra dang don dag gi 'brel ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'brel ba med pa kho na sgra dang don dag gi 'brel ba'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the connection of words and meanings is just a connection that does not exist,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang 'brel ba med pa de 'brel bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'brel ba med pa de 'brel bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which does not exist be a connection?

original: bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no //
translated: It is like a pot and a cloth.

original: 'on te 'brel ba'i rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel ba'i rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba kho na ste /
translated: But if you say that the nature of a connection is just like this,

original: gang gi 'brel ba gzhan la ltos pa med pa kho nar pha rol po sbrel bar byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi 'brel ba gzhan la ltos pa med pa kho nar pha rol po sbrel bar byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: that it is a connection that connects another without depending on another connection,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: tshad ma grub pa'i rang bzhin @339b yin na ni /
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa'i rang bzhin @339b yin na ni /
translated: If the nature of a valid cognition is established,

original: lan brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lan brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: then you should not reply.

original: phyi ma rjod par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi ma rjod par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The latter would not be stated,

original: dper na me kho na'i rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: dper na me kho na'i rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba ste /
translated: just as, for example, the nature of fire is just like this,

original: sreg par byed pa nyid ces bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sreg par byed pa nyid ces bya ba yin la /
translated: it is called that which burns.

original: gzhan nam mkha' la sogs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan nam mkha' la sogs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not like other things, such as space.

original: 'brel ba grub na ni tshad ma dam cung zad kyang rtogs pa po rnams kyis ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'brel ba grub na ni tshad ma dam cung zad kyang rtogs pa po rnams kyis ma mthong ngo //
translated: If there were a relation, the knowers would see some slight evidence of a valid cognition, but they do not.

original: sgra'i nus pa'i rang bzhin nyid kho na las sgra rnams nges pa'i don la 'khrul ba med pa nyid do zhes pa 'di brjod par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i nus pa'i rang bzhin nyid kho na las sgra rnams nges pa'i don la 'khrul ba med pa nyid do zhes pa 'di brjod par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be said that the words are infallible with regard to their referent by the power of the nature of the words themselves.

original: de ltar ni gal te bum pa zhes pa'i sgra 'di rang bzhin kho na la lto ba dang / mgrin pa'i rnam pa chu 'dzin par nus pa'i dngos po rjod par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ni gal te bum pa zhes pa'i sgra 'di rang bzhin kho na la lto ba dang / mgrin pa'i rnam pa chu 'dzin par nus pa'i dngos po rjod par byed pa yin na /
translated: If the word pot refers to an entity that has a bulbous shape and is able to hold water by its nature alone,

original: de ji ltar brda gzhan la ltos nas skyes bu'i 'dod pas rta la sogs pa yang rjod par byed /
analyzed: de ji ltar brda gzhan la ltos nas skyes bu'i 'dod pas rta la sogs pa yang rjod par byed /
translated: how is it that it refers to a horse, etc., in dependence on other conventions and the desires of people?

original: s'a la'i sa bon ni rang gi rgyu las myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du skyes pas na brda gzhan la ltos nas bum pa skye dang nus par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: s'a la'i sa bon ni rang gi rgyu las myu gu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du skyes pas na brda gzhan la ltos nas bum pa skye dang nus par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Since a rice seed is produced from its cause with the nature to produce a rice sprout, it does not become able to produce a rice sprout in dependence on other conventions.

original: yid ches pas byas pa'i sgra rnams tshad ma nyid du 'dir brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid ches pas byas pa'i sgra rnams tshad ma nyid du 'dir brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not right to say that the words of a trustworthy person are valid cognition here,

original: yid ces pa nyid kho na nges par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid ces pa nyid kho na nges par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because the very mind cannot be ascertained.

original: de ltar ni yid ches pa nyid ni skyon zad pa nyid du rjod la /
analyzed: de ltar ni yid ches pa nyid ni skyon zad pa nyid du rjod la /
translated: In this way, trustworthiness is said to be the exhaustion of faults.

original: skyon zad pa nyid kyang pha rol po'i sems kyi 'jug pa 'ga' zhig tu brjod cing /
analyzed: skyon zad pa nyid kyang pha rol po'i sems kyi 'jug pa 'ga' zhig tu brjod cing /
translated: The exhaustion of faults is also said to be the engagement of the mind of the other person.

original: pha rol po'i sems kyi 'jug pa rnam kyang mtshon par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol po'i sems kyi 'jug pa rnam kyang mtshon par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And the engagement of the mind of the other person is difficult to ascertain.

original: lus dang ngag gi bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rtags ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'jug tshul ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rtags ni rnam pa gzhan du yang 'jug tshul ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inference of effect, such as the action of body and speech, shows a different way of engagement.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnams kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bu bur byed do zhes pa'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnams kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba lta bu bur byed do zhes pa'i rigs pa las /
translated: Even those with attachment act as if free from attachment.

original: ji ltar yid ches pa nyid nges par byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yid ches pa nyid nges par byed ces pa'o //
translated: How can trustworthiness be ascertained by this reasoning?

original: 'brel ba'i sun phyung bas rig byed kyi sgra rnams tshad ma nyid kyang bsal bas na log par ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i sun phyung bas rig byed kyi sgra rnams tshad ma nyid kyang bsal bas na log par ma brjod do //
translated: Since the refutation of the relation also refutes the validity of the sounds of the Vedas, we are not guilty of false speech.

original: de lta na gang the tshom med pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gang the tshom med pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is it that there are worldly conventions that are free of doubt?

original: de lta de ltar brda byas pa brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang las de ci yang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de lta de ltar brda byas pa brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang las de ci yang nyams pa med do //
translated: In that case, there is no fault, since the expression is made by the power of the desire to express.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: sgra rnams med pa smra ba po'i bsam pa bsal bar byed do zhes so //
analyzed: sgra rnams med pa smra ba po'i bsam pa bsal bar byed do zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe speaker‚Äôs intention is to express the absence of sound.‚Äù

original: rigs pa can pa'i nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma yin pa'i spros pa ni /üîΩgang rtogs pa po ba lang shes shing pa men ma yin pa de la jo bos //
analyzed: rigs pa can pa'i nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma yin pa'i spros pa ni / gang rtogs pa po ba lang shes shing pa men ma yin pa de la jo bos //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas‚Äô assertion that inference is a valid means of knowledge is a mere fantasy.

original: dgon par song la ba men 'o na cig ces bsgo la /üîΩdes kyang ba min gyi sgra'i @340a * //
analyzed: dgon par song la ba men 'o na cig ces bsgo la / des kyang ba min gyi sgra'i @340a * //
translated: The master says to someone who understands a cow but not a camel, ‚ÄúGo to the wilderness and milk the camel.‚Äù

original: brjod bya'i don mi shes pas /üîΩnags na spyod pa'am /
analyzed: brjod bya'i don mi shes pas / nags na spyod pa'am /
translated: That person, not understanding the meaning of the expression ‚Äúcamel,‚Äù

original: gzhan de shes pa'i skyes bu la dris pa /
analyzed: gzhan de shes pa'i skyes bu la dris pa /
translated: asks someone else who knows the meaning of the expression ‚Äúcamel.‚Äù

original: kye spun ba men ji lta bu zhes so //
analyzed: kye spun ba men ji lta bu zhes so //
translated: He asks, ‚ÄúHey, brother, what is a camel?‚Äù

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: ba lang ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba min no zhes so //
analyzed: ba lang ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba min no zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not like a cow.‚Äù

original: de dgon par slebs ba btang ba skyes bu de'i //
analyzed: de dgon par slebs ba btang ba skyes bu de'i //
translated: When he arrived in the wilderness, he remembered the words of that man.

original: bstan pa'i ngag gi don dran pa'i lhan cig byed pa can ba men dang rjes su mthun pa shes pa byed pa po 'di ba men gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o zhes rtogs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin skyes pa tshad ma'o zhe'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i ngag gi don dran pa'i lhan cig byed pa can ba men dang rjes su mthun pa shes pa byed pa po 'di ba men gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o zhes rtogs pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin skyes pa tshad ma'o zhe'o //
translated: The cognition that is concordant with a camel, which is the simultaneous cause of remembering the meaning of the words, is the effect of the words of the man. The cognition is the object of the words of the man. This is the nature of the effect. The arising of this is valid knowledge.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te gang gi phyir tshad ma zhes pa ni yul dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te gang gi phyir tshad ma zhes pa ni yul dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: This is also illogical because valid knowledge is necessarily associated with an object.

original: 'di'i yul yang mkhas pas dpyad par 'gyur kyang mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i yul yang mkhas pas dpyad par 'gyur kyang mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The object of this [cognition] is not seen by the wise when they investigate.

original: de ltar yang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa de'i yul du brjod na /
analyzed: de ltar yang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa de'i yul du brjod na /
translated: In that case, if the relation called ‚Äúsameness‚Äù is said to be its object,

original: de yang don dam par med do //
analyzed: de yang don dam par med do //
translated: that also does not ultimately exist.

original: de ltar rung ba nyid yin na mi dmigs pas gnod la /
analyzed: de ltar rung ba nyid yin na mi dmigs pas gnod la /
translated: If it were suitable, it would be undermined by nonobservation.

original: blta bar mi rung ba nyid yin na de'i yod pa'i sgrub byed tshad ma ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blta bar mi rung ba nyid yin na de'i yod pa'i sgrub byed tshad ma ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not suitable to be seen, then the valid cognition that proves its existence is not seen.

original: gzhan yang 'brel ba de yang 'brel ba can dag las tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'brel ba de yang 'brel ba can dag las tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa yin /
translated: Moreover, is that relation different from the relata or not different?

original: gal te tha dad na de'i tshe 'brel ba gang gis de dag gi 'brel ba yin zhes brjod par bya ste 'brel ba gzhan rtog na ni thug pa med do //
analyzed: gal te tha dad na de'i tshe 'brel ba gang gis de dag gi 'brel ba yin zhes brjod par bya ste 'brel ba gzhan rtog na ni thug pa med do //
translated: If it is different, then at that time, by what relation are they related? One should say that if another relation is imagined, there is an infinite regress.

original: ci ste tha mi dad na /
analyzed: ci ste tha mi dad na /
translated: But if they are not different,

original: de'i tshe 'brel ba can dag 'ba' zhig kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'brel ba can dag 'ba' zhig kho na ste /
translated: at that time, they are only the relata.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba 'ga' zhig ni med do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba 'ga' zhig ni med do //
translated: There is no relation called ‚Äúsameness.‚Äù

original: 'on te 'di lta bu'i 'brel ba'i blo skyed par byed pa nyid 'brel ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di lta bu'i 'brel ba'i blo skyed par byed pa nyid 'brel ba'o zhe na /
translated: But if the very production of the cognition of a relation such as this is a relation,üîΩthen that is not tenable.

original: de ni ma rigs te gang gi phyir 'di dag 'brel ba'o zhes pa'i blo ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las 'brel zin pa'i dngos po gnyis las kyang yang dag par 'byung ste 'brel ba 'phen pa'i mthun ni med do //
analyzed: de ni ma rigs te gang gi phyir 'di dag 'brel ba'o zhes pa'i blo ni rang gi rgyu'i stobs las 'brel zin pa'i dngos po gnyis las kyang yang dag par 'byung ste 'brel ba 'phen pa'i mthun ni med do //
translated: That is illogical, because the cognition ‚Äúthese are related‚Äù arises from the power of its cause, from two related things, and there is no power to project a relation.

original: de ltar spyod pa las bshad pa'i tshad ma nyid bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa las bshad pa'i tshad ma nyid bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Thus the valid knowledge explained in the NyƒÅyabindu must be refuted.

original: de ltar ni 'dra ba'i khyad par can gyi gong bu'i khyad par can gyi 'dra ba nye bar 'jal ba'i yul du des brjod la /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dra ba'i khyad par can gyi gong bu'i khyad par can gyi 'dra ba nye bar 'jal ba'i yul du des brjod la /
translated: In that way, the difference of a collection that has the difference of similarity is measured by the similarity that is proximate, and it is expressed by that.

original: 'dra ba'i dngos po las gzhan du 'dra ba nyid rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i dngos po las gzhan du 'dra ba nyid rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: Similarity cannot be posited as different from the thing that is similar.

original: tshad ma rtogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma rtogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not be a valid cognition.

original: de ltar ni gal te 'dra ba las gzhan pa'i 'dra ba nyid 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'di snang du rung ba mi dmigs pas nyams pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni gal te 'dra ba las gzhan pa'i 'dra ba nyid 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'di snang du rung ba mi dmigs pas nyams pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, if similarity were different from the thing that is similar, then it would be just like the nonobservation of something suitable to appear.

original: ci ste snang du mi rung ba yin na /
analyzed: ci ste snang du mi rung ba yin na /
translated: But if it is not suitable to appear,

original: de'i tshe de dang 'brel ba'i rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i skabs las kyang de ji @340b ltar grub /üîΩ'dra ba'i rtogs pa ni rang gi rgyu las de ltar skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos pos kyang bya ba 'thad do zhes pas de'i rtogs pa las kyang de grub par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dang 'brel ba'i rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i skabs las kyang de ji @340b ltar grub / 'dra ba'i rtogs pa ni rang gi rgyu las de ltar skyes pa dang 'dra ba'i dngos pos kyang bya ba 'thad do zhes pas de'i rtogs pa las kyang de grub par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, since there is no reason for it to be related to that, how could it be established by inference and so on?üîΩIt is not reasonable for it to be established by the cognition of similarity, because it is tenable that an action is performed by a thing that is similar to what has arisen from its cause.

original: nye bar 'jal ba kho na las 'dra ba nyid grub po zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba kho na las 'dra ba nyid grub po zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you think that similarity is established only by analogy, that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis grub pa'i 'dra ba'i gong bu ga gi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis grub pa'i 'dra ba'i gong bu ga gi /
translated: Because the collection of similarities established by another valid cognition is not the object of analogy.

original: gang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po de nye bar 'jal ba'i yul nyid du rgol ba des brtags te /
analyzed: gang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po de nye bar 'jal ba'i yul nyid du rgol ba des brtags te /
translated: The opponent imagines that the object of analogy is the relationship between the qualifier and the qualified.

original: de'i phyir 'dra ba nyid tsam nye bar 'jal ba las ji ltar grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dra ba nyid tsam nye bar 'jal ba las ji ltar grub ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how could similarity alone be established by analogy?

original: don gyis go ba yang tshad ma la sogs pa nyid du 'thad pa mi yin te /
analyzed: don gyis go ba yang tshad ma la sogs pa nyid du 'thad pa mi yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable that understanding by implication is a valid cognition and so on.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Because it is like this:

original: gang mngon sum la sogs pa las rtogs pa'i don de gang med na 'thad pa ma yin pa'i don de yongs su rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba'o zhes pa don gyis go ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang mngon sum la sogs pa las rtogs pa'i don de gang med na 'thad pa ma yin pa'i don de yongs su rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba'o zhes pa don gyis go ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of suggestion is: the understanding of a meaning that is not directly stated but is understood through the force of what is directly stated.

original: 'dir 'di bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di bsam par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be considered:

original: gang 'di tshad mas mthong ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang 'di tshad mas mthong ba'i don te /
translated: If the meaning that is seen by valid cognition

original: gal te yongs su brtag par bya ba'i lkog tu gyur ba'i don dang lhan cig bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba 'ga' zhig yod na de'i tshe rtog pa 'di rang bzhin gyi rtags las skyes pa'am 'bras bu rtags lasüîΩskyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yongs su brtag par bya ba'i lkog tu gyur ba'i don dang lhan cig bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel ba 'ga' zhig yod na de'i tshe rtog pa 'di rang bzhin gyi rtags las skyes pa'am 'bras bu rtags las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is related to a hidden meaning that is to be inferred by some kind of intrinsic characteristic or derived characteristic, then this inference is either born from a natural sign or born from a sign of effect.

original: don gyis go bar rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: don gyis go bar rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only an inference by suggestion.

original: 'on te 'brel ba med na da ni don gyis go bar tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel ba med na da ni don gyis go bar tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if there is no relation, then suggestion would not be a valid cognition,

original: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir bum pa las snam bu rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir bum pa las snam bu rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because there would be no relation, just like understanding a cloth from a pot.

original: dngos po med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid re zhig ma dmigs te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid re zhig ma dmigs te /
translated: First, the non-observation of an entity‚Äôs own nature is not a non-entity.

original: ci las de tshad ma nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: ci las de tshad ma nyid du 'gyur //
translated: How could that be a valid cognition?

original: de ltar ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnams mi skye ba dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad mar spyod pa pa rnams kyis brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma rnams mi skye ba dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad mar spyod pa pa rnams kyis brjod de /
translated: The practitioners of the CƒÅrvƒÅka school say that the non-arising of valid cognitions such as direct perception is a valid cognition called ‚Äúnon-entity.‚Äù

original: de la mi skye ba 'di ci zhig / ci mi dgag pa'i tshul gyis tshad ma mi skye ba tsam mam /
analyzed: de la mi skye ba 'di ci zhig / ci mi dgag pa'i tshul gyis tshad ma mi skye ba tsam mam /
translated: What is this non-arising? Is it merely the non-arising of valid cognition in the manner of a negation?

original: 'on na te ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dngos po gzhan zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on na te ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dngos po gzhan zhig yin /
translated: Or is it an entity that is a different object in the manner of an implicative negation?

original: dngos po gzhan pa yang bems po'i rang bzhin nam shes pa'i rang bzhin yin /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan pa yang bems po'i rang bzhin nam shes pa'i rang bzhin yin /
translated: If it is a different entity, is it an entity that is of the nature of matter or of the nature of consciousness?

original: shes pa shes pa tsam ma ma shes pa gcig la 'dres pa'i dngos po'i shes pa yin /
analyzed: shes pa shes pa tsam ma ma shes pa gcig la 'dres pa'i dngos po'i shes pa yin /
translated: Is it a consciousness that is a mere consciousness or a consciousness of an entity that is mixed with non-entity?

original: de la re zhig dngos po med par dgag pa'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos po med par dgag pa'i ngo bor rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not logical for it to be an entity that is an implicative negation.

original: de ni nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir ji ltar yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid dam shes pa skyed @341a * //üîΩpar byed pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir ji ltar yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid dam shes pa skyed @341a * // par byed pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Because it is empty of all abilities, how could it be a determiner or a producer of consciousness?

original: de nyid kyi phyir ci zhig gis kyang de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ci zhig gis kyang de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not established by anything at all.

original: mkhas pa'i chogs kyi gtsug gi nor bus gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i chogs kyi gtsug gi nor bus gang gsungs pa /
translated: The RatnƒÅvalƒ´ says:

original: dngos po med pa ni ci zhig gi yang sgrub par byed pa'am sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ci zhig gi yang sgrub par byed pa'am sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: A nonthing is not a cause of establishment or nonestablishment.

original: de'i yang sgrub par byed pa ji ltar yin zhes so //
analyzed: de'i yang sgrub par byed pa ji ltar yin zhes so //
translated: How could it be a cause of establishment?

original: bems po'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bems po'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not an insentient entity.

original: bems bo la yongs su dpyod par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems bo la yongs su dpyod par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an insentient entity does not have the ability to determine.

original: bems po'i ngo bo shing rta la sogs pa ni bum pa yongs su gcod par byed pa 'gar yang mthong ba'am thos pa med do zhes so //
analyzed: bems po'i ngo bo shing rta la sogs pa ni bum pa yongs su gcod par byed pa 'gar yang mthong ba'am thos pa med do zhes so //
translated: An insentient entity such as a chariot is never seen or heard to determine a pot.

original: shes pa tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not mere consciousness.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba ri rab tsam dang 'khor los sgyur ba dang sha za la sogs pa yang shes pa tsam yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i chad ma 'am med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba ri rab tsam dang 'khor los sgyur ba dang sha za la sogs pa yang shes pa tsam yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i chad ma 'am med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it follows that the object is annihilated, that is, rendered nonexistent, because the object is a mere consciousness, and because the object is separated from consciousness by space, time, and nature, just like Mount Meru, a universal monarch, a flesh eater, and so on.

original: 'on te shes pa gcig gis zhar byung ste /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gcig gis zhar byung ste /
translated: But if you say that the object is an extension of consciousness,

original: sa'i gzhi la sogs pa'i dngos po shes pa dngos po med par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i gzhi la sogs pa'i dngos po shes pa dngos po med par brjod do zhe na /
translated: then you are saying that the object, such as the ground, is an extension of consciousness and is nonexistent.

original: de'i tshe mngon sum gyi khyad par kho na dngos po med pa'i ming du byas pa'i phyir 'u cag la mi mthun pa ci yang med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum gyi khyad par kho na dngos po med pa'i ming du byas pa'i phyir 'u cag la mi mthun pa ci yang med do zhes pa'o //
translated: In that case, we have no disagreement at all, because you are simply calling a specific type of direct perception ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gnyis kho na'o zhes pa 'di gnas so //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gnyis kho na'o zhes pa 'di gnas so //
translated: The position that there are only two types of valid knowledge, direct perception and inference, is correct.

original: de la mngon sum rtog bral ma 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum rtog bral ma 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Direct perception is free from conceptuality and is nonerroneous.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dag bsdoms nas sgra dang 'dres pa'i rnam pa'i rtog pa'am nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dag bsdoms nas sgra dang 'dres pa'i rnam pa'i rtog pa'am nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: Conceptual cognition is a combination of the prior and subsequent moments, and it is either a conceptual cognition that is mixed with the term or an internal expression of the aspect.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i 'di bum pa'o zhes pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu'i 'di bum pa'o zhes pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition of a person who has consciousness, who thinks, ‚ÄúThis is a pot.‚Äù

original: byis pa dang lkugs pa dang dud 'gro la sogs pa rnams kyi nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa lhur byed pa'i ngo bo'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa dang lkugs pa dang dud 'gro la sogs pa rnams kyi nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa lhur byed pa'i ngo bo'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the form of internal expression is the cognition of fools, the mute, animals, and so on.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: brjod pa dang 'drer rung bar snang ba'i rtogs pa ni rtogs pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'drer rung bar snang ba'i rtogs pa ni rtogs pa'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition that appears as if mixed with expression is a cognition.‚Äù

original: 'o na byis pa chung du la sogs pa rnams la nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i shes pa yod do zhes gang las nges par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na byis pa chung du la sogs pa rnams la nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i shes pa yod do zhes gang las nges par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, from what is it ascertained that the cognition of small children and so on has the form of internal expression?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa len pa dang 'dor pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bya ba las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa len pa dang 'dor pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they take up what is desired and reject what is not desired due to the activity of conceptual thought.

original: byis ba chung ngu la sogs pas 'dod pa'i don len pa dang mi 'dod pa'i don gtong ba zhes bya ba'i 'di ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: byis ba chung ngu la sogs pas 'dod pa'i don len pa dang mi 'dod pa'i don gtong ba zhes bya ba'i 'di ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is seen that small children and so on take up what is desired and reject what is not desired.

original: byis pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa nyid du gsal bar byas pas @341b bhatta'i sa brjod pa'i mig gi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrubs na /
analyzed: byis pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rtog pa nyid du gsal bar byas pas @341b bhatta'i sa brjod pa'i mig gi shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrubs na /
translated: Since the consciousness of a small child and so on is clearly conceptual, if the eye consciousness described by Bhatta is established as conceptual,

original: yang ci'i phyir rtogs pa dang 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rtogs pa dang 'khrul pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
translated: then why would a consciousness that has the nature of conceptualization and error not be a form of perception?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum zhes thams cad la grags shing /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum zhes thams cad la grags shing /
translated: It is not, because it is well known to everyone that perception is a consciousness that manifests the nature of an entity.

original: rtogs pa dang 'khrul pa dag don gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang 'khrul pa dag don gyi rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Conceptualization and error are not capable of manifesting the nature of an object.

original: de ltar ni don 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni don gyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni don 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni don gyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: The consciousness that apprehends an object is the effect of the object.

original: don yang gzung bya nyid kyi phyir shes pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: don yang gzung bya nyid kyi phyir shes pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: And the object is the cause of the consciousness because it is the object that is apprehended.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /üîΩshes la rnam pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / shes la rnam pa ni /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe cause of the ability to positüîΩaspects in consciousness

original: 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid la //
analyzed: 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu nyid la //
translated: is the object.

original: gzung bar rig pa shes pas rig / ces so //
analyzed: gzung bar rig pa shes pas rig / ces so //
translated: The cognition of the object is known by the awareness of the object.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa ni don med par bag chags tsam kho na las skyes pas ni ji ltar don gyi 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa ni don med par bag chags tsam kho na las skyes pas ni ji ltar don gyi 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: Since the conceptual cognition arises from mere latent impressions without an object, how can it be the effect of an object?

original: don dang lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not necessarily occur simultaneously with or immediately after the object.

original: gang zhig gang med par 'byung ba de de'i 'bras bu ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par 'byung ba de de'i 'bras bu ma yin te ;
translated: That which occurs without something else is not the effect of that,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to absurdity.

original: gal te yang rtogs pa'i shes pa don la nye bar skye na /
analyzed: gal te yang rtogs pa'i shes pa don la nye bar skye na /
translated: Moreover, if the conceptual cognition arises in relation to the object,

original: de'i tshe des kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i don mthong la /
analyzed: de'i tshe des kyang bum pa la sogs pa'i don mthong la /
translated: then it would see the object such as a pot,

original: de'i phyir long bas kyang gzugs mthong bar 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur zhing yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir long bas kyang gzugs mthong bar 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur zhing yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and it would follow that even a blind person would see forms, but that is not the case.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sgra las byung ba'i blo las ni mngon sum bzhin du don snang ba med pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i shes pa la don mngon du byed pa nyid med do zhes so //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i blo las ni mngon sum bzhin du don snang ba med pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i shes pa la don mngon du byed pa nyid med do zhes so //
translated: The conceptual cognition arising from words does not manifest the object to the conceptual cognition, like perception, because the object does not appear.

original: 'dis ni gang pha rol pos brjod pa'i //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang pha rol pos brjod pa'i //
translated: This refutes the following statement of the opponent:

original: sgra yi rjes 'gro las gzhan gang //
analyzed: sgra yi rjes 'gro las gzhan gang //
translated: ‚ÄúApart from the cognition that follows after sound,

original: rtogs te 'jig rten na yod min //üîΩshes pa thams cad sgra dang ni //
analyzed: rtogs te 'jig rten na yod min // shes pa thams cad sgra dang ni //
translated: there is no other cognition that exists in the world.

original: rjes su ldan pa kho nar snang //
analyzed: rjes su ldan pa kho nar snang //
translated: All cognitions are only associated with sound.

original: zhes pa de bsal ba yin no //üîΩde ltar ni /
analyzed: zhes pa de bsal ba yin no // de ltar ni /
translated: This is the refutation.üîΩüîΩ

original: mdun na yod pa'i bum pa brjod bzhin pa na //
analyzed: mdun na yod pa'i bum pa brjod bzhin pa na //
translated: Thus, when a pot that is in front of one is being spoken about,

original: de dang nye ba na yod pa'i sa'i mthil la sogs pa'i shes pa brjod pa dang bral ba nyams su myong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dang nye ba na yod pa'i sa'i mthil la sogs pa'i shes pa brjod pa dang bral ba nyams su myong ba nyid do //
translated: the cognition of the ground, etc., that is present nearby is experienced as being free from speech.

original: de ltar de'i tshe sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de'i tshe sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, at that time, there is no association with sound.

original: rnam par rtog nyid cig car med //
analyzed: rnam par rtog nyid cig car med //
translated: It is also not the case that conceptual cognition is simultaneous.

original: ces pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: ces pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa yang don mngon du byed pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa yang don mngon du byed pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Also, a mistaken cognition does not manifest an object,

original: 'khrul pa'i don bya ba nus pa'i dngos po la phyin ci log par brjod cing /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i don bya ba nus pa'i dngos po la phyin ci log par brjod cing /
translated: because it is said to be mistaken with regard to an entity that is capable of the activity of the object.

original: don bya ba nus pa yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa yin na /
analyzed: don bya ba nus pa yang dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa yin na /
translated: If the ability to perform a function is the nature of a thing, it is ascertained in terms of place, time, and aspect.üîΩ

original: de'i phyin @342a * //
analyzed: de'i phyin @342a * //
translated: Moreover, the capacity to perform a function is the intrinsic reality of a thing, which is ascertained in terms of place, time, and aspect.

original: ci log tu snang ba'i 'khrul pa'i shes pas ji ltar mngon du byed /
analyzed: ci log tu snang ba'i 'khrul pa'i shes pas ji ltar mngon du byed /
translated: How can a mistaken consciousness, which is the opposite of that, manifest it?

original: slob dpon gyis gang gsungs pa /üîΩrab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang grur zhugs pa'i 'khrul pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gang gsungs pa / rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang grur zhugs pa'i 'khrul pa la sogs pas /
translated: The Acarya has said:

original: 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa'i shes pa mngon sum mo zhes so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa'i shes pa mngon sum mo zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúA direct perception is a consciousness that does not generate error, such as the errors of one with an eye disease, of one whirling a fire-brand, or of one in a boat.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni ling tog can la dung dkar po la ser por snang ba'i shes pa dang / mgal me bskor ba la sogs pa la 'khor lo la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa dang / 'gro bzhin pa'i gru la gnas pa'i shing la sogs pa g-yo bar 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'dis ni ling tog can la dung dkar po la ser por snang ba'i shes pa dang / mgal me bskor ba la sogs pa la 'khor lo la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa dang / 'gro bzhin pa'i gru la gnas pa'i shing la sogs pa g-yo bar 'dzin pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: This means that the consciousness of one with cataracts to whom a white conch appears as yellow, the consciousness to whom a fire-brand, etc., appears as a wheel, the consciousness apprehending as moving the trees, etc.,

original: lus kyi gnad mtshon gyis bcom pa'i ga ba 'bar ba la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi gnad mtshon gyis bcom pa'i ga ba 'bar ba la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: of one in a moving boat, and the consciousness to whom a blazing sword, etc., appears due to the vital points of the body being struck by a weapon, are not direct perceptions.

original: 'o na gal te shes pa de mngon sum ma yin na ji ltar de las dngos po thob ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te shes pa de mngon sum ma yin na ji ltar de las dngos po thob ce na /
translated: If this cognition is not direct perception, how can one obtain a real thing from it?

original: de las dngos po thob pa min gyi /
analyzed: de las dngos po thob pa min gyi /
translated: One does not obtain a real thing from it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na shes pa gzhan kho na las so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na shes pa gzhan kho na las so zhes kha cig go //
translated: But from another cognition, some say.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four kinds:
