original: dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid dang rang rig pa'i rnam 'byor ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang / yid dang rang rig pa'i rnam 'byor ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: sense perception, mental perception, self-cognition, and yogic perception.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lang la brten nas skyes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga la dmigs pa ni dbang po ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lang la brten nas skyes shing phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga la dmigs pa ni dbang po ni mngon sum mo //
translated: Sense perception is the cognition born in dependence on the sense faculties such as the eyes, and it has as its object the five external objects such as form.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs kyi yul can no //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs kyi yul can no //
translated: Among them, the visual consciousness has form as its object.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni sgra'i yul can no //üîΩsna'i rnam par shes pa ni dri'i yul can no //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni sgra'i yul can no // sna'i rnam par shes pa ni dri'i yul can no //
translated: The auditory consciousness has sound as its object.üîΩThe olfactory consciousness has smell as its object.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni ro'i yul can no //üîΩlus kyi rnam par shes pa ni reg bya'i yul can no //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni ro'i yul can no //üîΩlus kyi rnam par shes pa ni reg bya'i yul can no //
translated: The gustatory consciousness has taste as its object.üîΩThe tactile consciousness has tactile objects as its object.

original: dbang po'i mngon sum zhes tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i mngon sum zhes tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The reason for the expression ‚Äúsense perception‚Äù is that it is the uncommon cause.

original: dper na rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like ‚Äúdrum sound‚Äù and ‚Äúbarley sprout.‚Äù

original: mngon sum 'di yang gang la rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtog pa skyed par byed pa de nyid la tshad ma ste /
analyzed: mngon sum 'di yang gang la rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtog pa skyed par byed pa de nyid la tshad ma ste /
translated: This perception is a valid cognition only in regard to that which produces a conception that is in accordance with it.

original: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because it is considered to be a conventional valid cognition.

original: rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul lhan cig byed pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa'i yul lhan cig byed pa can gyi dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Mental consciousness is that which is produced by the immediately preceding condition, the sense consciousness that is the immediately preceding similar object-field of its object-field.

original: rang gi sgra ni dbang po'i shes par dgongs shing /
analyzed: rang gi sgra ni dbang po'i shes par dgongs shing /
translated: The word ‚Äúits‚Äù refers to the sense consciousness.

original: rang gi yul ni yul te /
analyzed: rang gi yul ni yul te /
translated: ‚ÄúIts object-field‚Äù is the object-field.

original: phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the external vase, etc.

original: rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa ni rang yul de ma @342b thag pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi de ma thag pa ni rang yul de ma @342b thag pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIts immediately preceding‚Äù is the immediately preceding of its object-field.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul las gzhan bum pa la sogs pa'i skad cig gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul las gzhan bum pa la sogs pa'i skad cig gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second moment of the pot, etc., is different from the object of the sense consciousness.

original: lhan cig byed pa de dang tshogs nas /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa de dang tshogs nas /
translated: Having assembled with that cooperative condition,

original: nye bar len pa dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ming can gyi bskyed pa gang yin pa de yid kyi mngon sum du brjod do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dbang po'i shes pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ming can gyi bskyed pa gang yin pa de yid kyi mngon sum du brjod do //
translated: that which is generated by the immediately preceding condition of the appropriating sense consciousness is called mental direct perception.

original: de'i phyir pha rol pos gang brjod pa'i bzung zin pa'i 'dzin pa nyid dang long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med pa dang / rnam 'byo ba'i shes pa yang nyid gnyis su thal ba dang / tha snyad byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa bsal te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol pos gang brjod pa'i bzung zin pa'i 'dzin pa nyid dang long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med pa dang / rnam 'byo ba'i shes pa yang nyid gnyis su thal ba dang / tha snyad byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do zhes pa bsal te /
translated: Therefore, the faults that the opponent mentioned, such as the apprehension of what has already been apprehended, the nonexistence of the blind and the deaf, etc., the consequence that the consciousness of the yogi would be dual, and the nonexistence of the one who makes conventions, are all refuted.

original: de ltar ni skad cig gnyis pa 'dzin pa'i phyir bzung zin pa 'dzin pa nyid bsal lo //
analyzed: de ltar ni skad cig gnyis pa 'dzin pa'i phyir bzung zin pa 'dzin pa nyid bsal lo //
translated: In this way, the apprehension of what has already been apprehended is refuted because the second moment is apprehended.

original: dbang po'i shes pa las skyes pa yid yin pas long ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i dbang po'i mngon sum nyid med na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa las skyes pa yid yin pas long ba la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i dbang po'i mngon sum nyid med na /
translated: Since the mental faculty is produced from a sense consciousness, if a blind person, for example, does not have a sense direct perception that observes a form, etc.,

original: de las skyes pa'i yid ci zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i yid ci zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: how could a mental direct perception that is produced from that arise?

original: de'i phyir long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa med pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore there is no fault in saying that blind and deaf people do not exist.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis kyang rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa yid kyi mngon sum du thal ba bsal te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis kyang rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa yid kyi mngon sum du thal ba bsal te /
translated: The consequence that the mental direct perception of a yogi is a direct perception that arises from a similar immediately preceding condition is also refuted.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi sgra ni rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa'i nye bar len pa'i shes pa la grags pa la grub la /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi sgra ni rang gi rgyud la 'jug pa'i nye bar len pa'i shes pa la grags pa la grub la /
translated: The term similar immediately preceding condition is well known to refer to the appropriating consciousness that occurs in one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: de'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa la 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud tha dad pa la 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la ltos nas /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the yogi‚Äôs consciousness, which occurs in a different continuum,

original: so so'i skye bo'i sems rnams la de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi tha snyad med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sems rnams la de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi tha snyad med do zhes pa'o //
translated: the convention of immediately preceding condition is not used for the minds of ordinary beings.

original: tha snyad byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyang 'di'i sun 'byin par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad byed pa po ma yin pa nyid kyang 'di'i sun 'byin par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the non-doer of the convention is the refuter of this,

original: dus thung bar byung ba nyid kyis so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mtshon par dka' ba'i phyir dang ; tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thung bar byung ba nyid kyis so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mtshon par dka' ba'i phyir dang ; tha snyad kyi yan lag nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult for ordinary beings to illustrate it due to its short duration, and because it is not accepted as a part of the convention.

original: yid kyi mngon sum ni lung las grags par te /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum ni lung las grags par te /
translated: Mental perception is known from scripture.

original: 'di'i nges par byed pa po chung zad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i nges par byed pa po chung zad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no slight maker of this.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: dge slong dag gnyis kyis gzugs 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: dge slong dag gnyis kyis gzugs 'dzin par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, two things apprehend form:

original: mig dang de dang 'brel pa'i yid kyis so zhes so //
analyzed: mig dang de dang 'brel pa'i yid kyis so zhes so //
translated: the eye and the mind connected with it.‚Äù

original: 'o na tha snyad la nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa bstan pa de la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na tha snyad la nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa bstan pa de la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is not needed for convention, what is the purpose of teaching that?

original: 'di 'dre ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid kyi mngon sum gal te yod na skyon ci yod med do zhes lung rnam par dag pha 'dis bsgrub pa yin no zhes pa dgos pa'o //üîΩsems @343a * //
analyzed: 'di 'dre ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid kyi mngon sum gal te yod na skyon ci yod med do zhes lung rnam par dag pha 'dis bsgrub pa yin no zhes pa dgos pa'o // sems @343a * //
translated: The purpose is to establish that there is no fault by this pure scripture.

original: dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi bdag nyid yang dag par rigs pa'o //
analyzed: dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi bdag nyid yang dag par rigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of all minds and mental factors is correct knowledge.

original: sems ni dngos po tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: sems ni dngos po tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa yin la /
translated: The mind is the consciousness that apprehends mere things.

original: sems las gyur ba'i rnams ni sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems las gyur ba'i rnams ni sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: Mental factors are those that arise from the mind.

original: dngos po'i khyad par gyi ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par gyi ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can /
translated: They are the apprehenders of the nature of the specific attributes of things, characterized by pleasure, pain, equanimity, and so on.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de thams cad kyi bdag nyid gang gis rang gi ngo bos rig par byed pa ste rang rang gi ngo bo bdag nyid kyi ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa nyid kyi phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum rtog pa dang bral zhing
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de thams cad kyi bdag nyid gang gis rang gi ngo bos rig par byed pa ste rang rang gi ngo bo bdag nyid kyi ngo bo mngon sum du byed pa nyid kyi phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum rtog pa dang bral zhing
translated: The nature of all those minds and mental factors is that which makes itself known by its own nature, because each of them makes its own nature manifest.

original: ma 'khrul par brjod do ;
analyzed: ma 'khrul par brjod do ;
translated: I will explain this without error.

original: / de la kha cig na re /üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rang rig pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / de la kha cig na re / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis rang rig pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, some say:

original: bdag nyid la rang gi bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la rang gi bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that mind and mental factors are reflexive awareness because it is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: legs par bslab kyang gar mkhan gyis rang gi phrag pa la zhon par mi nus la /
analyzed: legs par bslab kyang gar mkhan gyis rang gi phrag pa la zhon par mi nus la /
translated: Even if one trains well, a dancer cannot mount his own shoulders.

original: ral gri'i so rno yang bdag nyid mi gcod cing ;
analyzed: ral gri'i so rno yang bdag nyid mi gcod cing ;
translated: Even though a sword is sharp, it cannot cut itself.

original: me'i phung po shin tu 'bar yang bdag nyid bsreg pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: me'i phung po shin tu 'bar yang bdag nyid bsreg pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Even though a mass of fire burns intensely, it does not burn itself.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yang ji ltar bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i dngos po ni las dang byed pa po'i dngos po yin la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yang ji ltar bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i dngos po ni las dang byed pa po'i dngos po yin la /
translated: In the same way, mind and mental factors do not realize themselves because the relationship between the object of cognition and the cognizing mind is the relationship between the object and the agent.

original: las dang byed pa po nyid kyang 'jig rten na tha dad pa kho nar grags te /
analyzed: las dang byed pa po nyid kyang 'jig rten na tha dad pa kho nar grags te /
translated: The object and the agent are known in the world to be distinct.

original: shing dang skud pa 'dzin pa dag bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: shing dang skud pa 'dzin pa dag bzhin no zhe na /
translated: They are like the stick and the person holding the stick.

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: las dang byed pa po'i dngos por rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa shes pa la brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po'i dngos por rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa shes pa la brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that the object of knowledge and the knower are the entities of the object and agent of action.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rnam par gzhag par bya ba dang rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par bya ba dang rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: They are the entities of the object of presentation and the presenter.

original: dper na sgron ma bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa de ltar shes pa yang rang gi rgyu kho na las bems po'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba rang gi rgyu kho na las rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin du skyes pas rig par rnam par gzhag go
analyzed: dper na sgron ma bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa de ltar shes pa yang rang gi rgyu kho na las bems po'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba rang gi rgyu kho na las rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin du skyes pas rig par rnam par gzhag go
translated: For example, just as a lamp illuminates itself, so consciousness is posited as knowing because it arises from its own cause with the nature of clarity, free from the character of an insentient entity.

original: // de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: // de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: rnam shes bems po'i rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of insentient consciousness,

original: log pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: log pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The opposite arises.

original: bems min rang bzhin gang yin pa //üîΩde kho na 'di'i rang rig go //
analyzed: bems min rang bzhin gang yin pa // de kho na 'di'i rang rig go //
translated: That which is not insentient by natureüîΩIs just its reflexive awareness.

original: 'di yi rang gi rig pa ni //
analyzed: 'di yi rang gi rig pa ni //
translated: Its reflexive awareness

original: bya dang byed pa'i dbye bas min //
analyzed: bya dang byed pa'i dbye bas min //
translated: Is not differentiated by the division of object and agent.

original: gcig pa tshad med rang bzhin la //
analyzed: gcig pa tshad med rang bzhin la //
translated: In the nature of the single immeasurable,

original: gsum gyi ngo bo mi 'thad phyir //
analyzed: gsum gyi ngo bo mi 'thad phyir //
translated: Because the entity of the three is not tenable.

original: zhes so // rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The Ornament of the Middle Way also says:

original: las dang @343b byed pa po la sogs //
analyzed: las dang @343b byed pa po la sogs //
translated: The agent and action and so on

original: rtag pa don dam par yod min //üîΩbdag nyid la ni bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: rtag pa don dam par yod min // bdag nyid la ni bdag nyid kyis //
translated: do not ultimately exist as permanent.üîΩIt is definitely said that

original: bdag nyid 'joms zhes nges par brjod //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'joms zhes nges par brjod //
translated: the self is destroyed by the self.

original: ces so // sems dang sems las byung ba rnams shes pa gzhan gyis gsal bar byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ces so // sems dang sems las byung ba rnams shes pa gzhan gyis gsal bar byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for minds and mental factors to be clarified by another consciousness.

original: de ltar ni re zhig dus mnyam par byung ba'i shes pa las gzhan gyi sems las byung ba gsal bar byed do zhes pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni re zhig dus mnyam par byung ba'i shes pa las gzhan gyi sems las byung ba gsal bar byed do zhes pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, it is not tenable to say that a mind and mental factor that arise simultaneously are clarified by another mind.

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi rva dag bzhin no //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi rva dag bzhin no //
translated: This is because they do not have the relationship of being that which is helped and that which helps, like the right and left horns of an ox.

original: dus tha dad par byung ba'i shes pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus tha dad par byung ba'i shes pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that they are clarified by a consciousness that arises at a different time.

original: skad cig pa nyid kyi phyir na gsal bar byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig pa nyid kyi phyir na gsal bar byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, since they are momentary, they do not have the ability to clarify.

original: gzhan yang gal te shes pa rang rig pa ma yin na de'i phyir de'i tshe don shes so zhes pa 'thad par dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te shes pa rang rig pa ma yin na de'i phyir de'i tshe don shes so zhes pa 'thad par dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if consciousness is not reflexive awareness, then it would be impossible to say that an object is cognized at that time.

original: khyad par ma bzung ba'i blo ni khyad par du bya ba la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: khyad par ma bzung ba'i blo ni khyad par du bya ba la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: Because a cognition that does not apprehend a specific object cannot engage in the action of qualifying an object.

original: de ltar ni ;
analyzed: de ltar ni ;
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: don khyad par du bya ba yin la shes pa ni khyad par te /
analyzed: don khyad par du bya ba yin la shes pa ni khyad par te /
translated: The object is what is to be qualified, and consciousness is the qualifier.

original: shes zin pa ni shes pas khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes zin pa ni shes pas khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: The object that has already been cognized is qualified by consciousness.

original: gal te shes pa rang nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te shes pa rang nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: If consciousness itself is not cognized in the aspect of being a cognizer,

original: de'i phyir shes pas khyad par du byas pa'i don ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pas khyad par du byas pa'i don ltar rtogs te /
translated: then it is impossible to cognize an object that is qualified by consciousness.

original: dbyug pa ma bzung bar dbyug pa can 'dzin pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ni med pas so //
analyzed: dbyug pa ma bzung bar dbyug pa can 'dzin pa rigs pa dang ldan pa ni med pas so //
translated: Because it is illogical to apprehend someone as having a stick without apprehending the stick.

original: gang mig gsum pas bshad pa /
analyzed: gang mig gsum pas bshad pa /
translated: This is explained by the one with three eyes.

original: mig ma bzung bar yang mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i don rtogs pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa ma gtogs na yang don shes zin pa 'thad do zhes pa de ni mi legs te /
analyzed: mig ma bzung bar yang mig gis gzung bar bya ba'i don rtogs pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa ma gtogs na yang don shes zin pa 'thad do zhes pa de ni mi legs te /
translated: Just as the object of eye consciousness is not apprehended without the eye, so too, it is not tenable that the object is known without consciousness.

original: skabs su ma bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs su ma bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not good, because it is not the right occasion.

original: gang gi phyir mig ni gzugs kyi khyad par ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig ni gzugs kyi khyad par ma yin la /
translated: Because the eye is not a particular of form.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is eye consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang dag par rig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang dag par rig pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if consciousness is not the knower,üîΩhow does it cause the knowledge of form?

original: ji ltar gzugs shes par byed ces pas rtsod pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs shes par byed ces pas rtsod pa nyams pa med do //
translated: Thus, the opponent‚Äôs argument is not refuted.

original: gang yang shes pa lkog gyur nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du bhattas smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang shes pa lkog gyur nyid du bsgrub pa'i ched du bhattas smras pa /
translated: Also, Bha·π≠·π≠a says that in order to prove that consciousness is hidden:

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa gsal pa rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas dbang po grub pa de bzhin du shes pa yang grub po zhes so //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa gsal pa rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas dbang po grub pa de bzhin du shes pa yang grub po zhes so //
translated: Just as the clarity of form and so on is established because it is not tenable in any other way, so too consciousness is established.

original: de bzhin du de'i bshad pa //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i bshad pa //
translated: Thus his commentary says:

original: don 'ga' zhig shes pa zin pa med na ni blo dmigs pa med la //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig shes pa zin pa med na ni blo dmigs pa med la //
translated: If the knowledge of some object is not apprehended, the mind has no object.

original: shes zin na ni rjes su dpag pa las @344a * //üîΩrtogs so zhes so //
analyzed: shes zin na ni rjes su dpag pa las @344a * // rtogs so zhes so //
translated: If it is already known, then it is understood from inference.

original: de'i rnam par 'grel pa yang //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'grel pa yang //
translated: And the commentary on that says:

original: shes pa ni shes zin pa nyid kyi dbang las so zhes so //
analyzed: shes pa ni shes zin pa nyid kyi dbang las so zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness is from the power of what is already known.‚Äù

original: shes zin pa nyid kyang yul gsal bar brjod do //
analyzed: shes zin pa nyid kyang yul gsal bar brjod do //
translated: And what is already known is said to be the object‚Äôs clarity.

original: de ni shin tu mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni shin tu mi rigs te /
translated: That is very unreasonable.

original: yul gsal ba nyid kyang shes pa las tha dad pa nyid na ni /
analyzed: yul gsal ba nyid kyang shes pa las tha dad pa nyid na ni /
translated: If the object‚Äôs clarity is different from consciousness,

original: yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin na gsal bar bems po'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo nyid yin na gsal bar bems po'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: if it is the nature of the object, then it is clarity, the nature of the inert.

original: bems bo la yang rab tu gsal ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems bo la yang rab tu gsal ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unreasonable for the inert to be very clear.

original: yul las don gzhan pa nyid de'i rang nyid las rab tu gsal ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul las don gzhan pa nyid de'i rang nyid las rab tu gsal ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is different from the object, then it is unreasonable for it to be clear by itself.

original: gsal ba gzhan gyis gsal bar byed na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyis gsal bar byed na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is clarified by another clarity, there would be an infinite regress.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid na ni gsal ba nyid kyang lkog gyur du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid na ni gsal ba nyid kyang lkog gyur du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the nature of consciousness, then it follows that clarity would be hidden.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar shes pa rang rig pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar shes pa rang rig pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one must certainly say that consciousness is reflexive awareness.üîΩSince reflexive awareness is established by experience, how can it be denied?

original: rang rig pa ni nyams su myong bas grub pa yang yin na ji ltar bsnyon 'debs par byed de gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni nyams su myong bas grub pa yang yin na ji ltar bsnyon 'debs par byed de gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin na //
translated: If the object is not directly perceived,

original: don mthong rab tu grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don mthong rab tu grub mi 'gyur //
translated: The perception of the object will not be established.

original: zhes so // rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The Ornament of the Middle Way also says:

original: gal te shes de lkog gyur na //
analyzed: gal te shes de lkog gyur na //
translated: If that consciousness were hidden,

original: shes pa zhes nyid de gang las //üîΩklog tu gyur de'i rang gi ni //
analyzed: shes pa zhes nyid de gang las // klog tu gyur de'i rang gi ni //
translated: How could it be called consciousness?üîΩThat which is hidden cannot

original: ngo bo su yis mtshon par nus //
analyzed: ngo bo su yis mtshon par nus //
translated: Demonstrate its own entity.

original: zhes so // 'o na shes pa thams cad kyi rang rig pas mngon sum nyid na /
analyzed: zhes so // 'o na shes pa thams cad kyi rang rig pas mngon sum nyid na /
translated: If all consciousnesses are reflexive awareness and direct perception,

original: 'di bum pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i shes pa med pa nyid dang / dung ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa ma 'khrul pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di bum pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i shes pa med pa nyid dang / dung ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa ma 'khrul pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then there would be no consciousness that understands, ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù and so on, and there would be no nonerroneous consciousnesses that perceive a yellow conch and so on.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na ste //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yang rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na ste //
translated: The conceptual consciousness also does not conceive its own nature.

original: 'di bum pa'o zhes pa 'dis ni phyi rol kho na la rtogs par byed kyi bdag nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di bum pa'o zhes pa 'dis ni phyi rol kho na la rtogs par byed kyi bdag nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: This ‚Äúthis is a pot‚Äù conceives only the external object, not itself.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: shes gang gang la sgra don 'dzin //
analyzed: shes gang gang la sgra don 'dzin //
translated: The consciousness that apprehends the meaning of a word

original: de ni de la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de la rtog pa'o //
translated: is the conception of that.

original: rang gi ngo bo sgra don min //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo sgra don min //
translated: Its own nature is not the meaning of a word;

original: de phyir de la kun mngon sum //
analyzed: de phyir de la kun mngon sum //
translated: therefore it is directly perceived by everyone.

original: zhes so // 'khul pa yang bdag nyid la ma 'khrul pa se /
analyzed: zhes so // 'khul pa yang bdag nyid la ma 'khrul pa se /
translated: Also, error is not error with respect to itself.

original: rang nyid rang tu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba'i phyir la //
analyzed: rang nyid rang tu gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba'i phyir la //
translated: It is said to be error because it appears to itself to be the nature of clarity.

original: yul med pa nyid las 'khrul par brjod do //
analyzed: yul med pa nyid las 'khrul par brjod do //
translated: It is said to be error because of the nonexistence of the object.

original: gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said:

original: rang ngo bo la kun ma 'khrul //
analyzed: rang ngo bo la kun ma 'khrul //
translated: It is not erroneous with respect to its own nature;

original: gzhan ngo bo la phyin ci log / ces so //
analyzed: gzhan ngo bo la phyin ci log / ces so //
translated: it is erroneous with respect to the nature of another.

original: de'i phyir rnam par gzhan du rab tu gsal ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gzhan du rab tu gsal ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because the appearance as something else is not established,

original: gal te 'di rnams rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin na de'i tshe rang gi @344b rgyu kho na las rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin du skyes par 'gyur ba rnams kyis /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin na de'i tshe rang gi @344b rgyu kho na las rab tu gsal ba'i rang bzhin du skyes par 'gyur ba rnams kyis /
translated: If these are illuminators, then at that time, they would be born with the nature of illumination from their own causes alone.

original: rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It should be accepted that they are illuminators.

original: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa las skyes pa rnam 'byor ba'i shes pa yang ngo zhes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa las skyes pa rnam 'byor ba'i shes pa yang ngo zhes te /
translated: The cognition of a yogi is also born from the culmination of the meditation on the correct meaning.

original: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab bo //
translated: Yoga is meditative stabilization and wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Meditative stabilization has the characteristic of a one-pointed mind.

original: dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni shes rab po //
analyzed: dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni shes rab po //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of the suchness of all things.

original: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na rnal 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na rnal 'byor ba'o //
translated: One who has yoga is a yogi.

original: gang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gang rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The cognition of a yogi is direct perception.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: It is born from the culmination of the meditation on the correct meaning.

original: yang dag pa'i don ni tshad mas 'thad pa'i don no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ni tshad mas 'thad pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning of reality is the meaning that is established by valid cognition.

original: bsgom pa ni yang dang yang sems las yang dag par bskrun pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni yang dang yang sems las yang dag par bskrun pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the repeated generation of the mind.

original: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de rtog pa dang / bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de rtog pa dang / bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'o //
translated: The knowledge that arises from the culmination of the cultivation of the meaning of reality is free from conceptual thought and is non-erroneous.

original: yang dag pa'i don ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: The meaning of reality is the four noble truths,

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa lam gyi ming can no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa lam gyi ming can no //
translated: which are called suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin skad cig pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rang bzhin skad cig pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of the five aggregates is to be realized as momentary, empty, selfless, suffering, and so forth.

original: gang yod pa de skad cig pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas tshad mas 'thad par khong du chud par bya ba'i zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod pa de skad cig pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas tshad mas 'thad par khong du chud par bya ba'i zhes pa'o //
translated: It is to be understood as established by valid cognition through inference, such as ‚ÄúWhatever exists is momentary.‚Äù

original: 'o na sgom ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na sgom ni rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: Well then, cultivation is conceptual thought,üîΩand conceptual thought is not reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po min pa'i yul can yin na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po min pa'i yul can yin na /
translated: If conceptual thought has a non-entity for its object,

original: de la dngos po gsal bar gyur par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la dngos po gsal bar gyur par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can an entity become manifest in it?

original: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par rtog pa med par ji ltar 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam par rtog pa med par ji ltar 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: And how can conceptual thought become non-conceptual?

original: sems skad cig pa yang rtse gcig par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: sems skad cig pa yang rtse gcig par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: And how can a momentary mind be concentrated?

original: khyad par yang ci zhig gis ci yis bya //
analyzed: khyad par yang ci zhig gis ci yis bya //
translated: And what is the difference between them?üîΩAnd how can one be liberated from attachment, etc. ,

original: lus can yang dag chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba las grol ba'o zhes pa thams cad mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: lus can yang dag chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba las grol ba'o zhes pa thams cad mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: if one is not liberated from the body?

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rnam par rtog pa dngos po ma yin pa'i yul can yin yang dngos po la lhag par zhen par byed pas bsgom pa las dngos po kho nar 'dir bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dngos po ma yin pa'i yul can yin yang dngos po la lhag par zhen par byed pas bsgom pa las dngos po kho nar 'dir bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though conceptual thought has a non-entity for its object, it causes attachment to entities. Therefore, in meditation, the entity is eliminated.

original: rnam par rtog pa kho na rnam par rtog pa med pa ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang rnam par rtog pa las rnam par mi @345a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa kho na rnam par rtog pa med pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa las rnam par mi @345a * //
translated: It is not that conceptual thought itself is non-conceptual.

original: rtog pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa skye ba yin no //
translated: But non-conceptual thought arises from conceptual thought.

original: sgom pa po rnams kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i snang ba 'di ni nyams su myong bas kyang grub po //
analyzed: sgom pa po rnams kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i snang ba 'di ni nyams su myong bas kyang grub po //
translated: The meditators establish this non-conceptual appearance by experience.

original: mthong ba la mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: mthong ba la mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni ci yang med do //
translated: There is no such thing as an invalid cognition.

original: sems skad cig pa yin kyang rigs mthun pa'i skad cig rnams las rgyun du 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rtse gcig par brjod do //
analyzed: sems skad cig pa yin kyang rigs mthun pa'i skad cig rnams las rgyun du 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rtse gcig par brjod do //
translated: Even though the mind is momentary, it is said to be one-pointed because it is the cause of the continuity of moments of the same type.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis na khyad par yang 'thad pa'i phyir gyi rtag pa nyid na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis na khyad par yang 'thad pa'i phyir gyi rtag pa nyid na ni ma yin te /
translated: And because of momentariness, it is also tenable that there is a difference, but not if it is permanent.

original: rtag pa ni khyad par brten par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni khyad par brten par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because the permanent cannot be the basis of a difference.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin 'jig med pa //
translated: That which is essentially indestructible

original: de ni rtag par mkhas rnams smra //
analyzed: de ni rtag par mkhas rnams smra //
translated: The wise say that is permanent.

original: de yi nus pa'am nus med pa //
analyzed: de yi nus pa'am nus med pa //
translated: Whether it has the ability or not,

original: gang yin rang bzhin gyis gnas pa //
analyzed: gang yin rang bzhin gyis gnas pa //
translated: it remains by its very nature.

original: rtag phyir gso bya ma yin na //
analyzed: rtag phyir gso bya ma yin na //
translated: If it is permanent, it cannot be cured.

original: de zad bya min nus pa ci //
analyzed: de zad bya min nus pa ci //
translated: What is the use of destroying it?

original: zhes so // gang lus can nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag yod pa'i phyir lus can chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba las grol ba'o zhes pa yang mi 'thad par brjod pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes so // gang lus can nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa las bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag yod pa'i phyir lus can chags pa la sogs pa dang bral ba las grol ba'o zhes pa yang mi 'thad par brjod pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not tenable to say that the body is the cause of attachment, etc., because pleasure and pain exist in relation to embodied beings, and because liberation is from attachment, etc., in embodied beings.

original: lus ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi //
analyzed: lus ni chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi //
translated: The body is not the cause of attachment, etc.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa ste /
translated: but rather ignorance.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa'o zhes dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba zhes dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bzhes phyin ci log bzhi'i rang bzhin brdzun pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa'o zhes dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba zhes dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bzhes phyin ci log bzhi'i rang bzhin brdzun pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is a false perception of the impermanent as permanent, of the selfless as having a self, of the painful as pleasurable, and of the impure as pure.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang yul la bde bar sred par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang yul la bde bar sred par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one craves for pleasure in objects.

original: bdag rtag par mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: bdag rtag par mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: One sees only the self as permanent.

original: bde ba mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yang bdag gi byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yang bdag gi byar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of the desire for pleasure, etc. is the self.

original: 'di rnam la kun du chags pa ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'di rnam la kun du chags pa ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment is the attachment to those.

original: de dang brel pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dang brel pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: and the opposite of that is hatred and so on.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa kho na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yin gyi lus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa kho na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yin gyi lus ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, ignorance alone is the root of attachment and so on, not the body.

original: lus yod na yang gal te ma rig pa med na ci zhig las 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur //
analyzed: lus yod na yang gal te ma rig pa med na ci zhig las 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur //
translated: For even if the body exists, if there is no ignorance, from what would attachment and so on arise?

original: de'i phyir 'tsho ba'i lus yod pa na yang ma rig pa dang bral ba las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'tsho ba'i lus yod pa na yang ma rig pa dang bral ba las /
translated: Therefore, even when the living body exists, from the absence of ignorance,

original: chags pa dang bral ba rnams kyi grol ba kun du chags pa thams cad dang bral ba 'byung ba las skyon ci yang 'bab pa med do zhes pa thams cad legs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba rnams kyi grol ba kun du chags pa thams cad dang bral ba 'byung ba las skyon ci yang 'bab pa med do zhes pa thams cad legs par gnas pa'o //
translated: the liberation of those free from attachment, free from all attachment, occurs. No fault whatsoever befalls this position.

original: de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yul ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Its object is the particular.

original: mngon sum rnam pa bzhi po de'i yul rang @345b gi mtshan nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum rnam pa bzhi po de'i yul rang @345b gi mtshan nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The object of those four types of direct perception should be understood as the particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ces pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ces pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa'o //
translated: The particular is the uncommon nature of things, ascertained in terms of place, time, and aspect.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: bum pa la sogs pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin par nus pa yul dang dus dang rnam par des pa /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa chu la sogs pa 'dzin par nus pa yul dang dus dang rnam par des pa /
translated: A pot, for example, is able to hold water, and so on, and is limited in terms of place, time, and type.

original: mdun na gsal ba bzhin pa /
analyzed: mdun na gsal ba bzhin pa /
translated: It is like something manifest in front of you.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan du ma brten pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan du ma brten pa /
translated: It is not dependent on other phenomena, such as impermanence.

original: 'jug pa'i yul rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The object of engagement is the opposite of that which is of a similar type or a dissimilar type. This is the meaning of ‚Äúown characteristic.‚Äù

original: 'o na gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mngon sum gyi yul yin gyi spyi ma yin na de'i tshe du ba dang me'i spyi dag gi khyab pa ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mngon sum gyi yul yin gyi spyi ma yin na de'i tshe du ba dang me'i spyi dag gi khyab pa ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: If the object of direct perception is only the particular and not the universal, then how is the pervasion between the universal of smoke and the universal of fire apprehended by direct perception?

original: 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
translated: This is not a problem.

original: gang gi phyir mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa khyad par du bya bas rang gi mtshan nyid de'i yul kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa khyad par du bya bas rang gi mtshan nyid de'i yul kho na'o //
translated: Because the particular is the object of the exclusion of the non-endowed, which is the object of engagement.

original: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de'i yul zhes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de'i yul zhes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the particular is the object of the exclusion of the other, which is the object of engagement.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: spyi yang de'i yul lo //
analyzed: spyi yang de'i yul lo //
translated: The universal is also its object.

original: de ltar ni tshad ma'i yul rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar ni tshad ma'i yul rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, the object of valid cognition is twofold:

original: gzung bar bya ba dang zhen par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba dang zhen par bya ba'o //
translated: that which is apprehended and that which is conceived.

original: de la mngon sum gyi gzung bya ni snang bzhin pa'i skad cig gcig go //
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi gzung bya ni snang bzhin pa'i skad cig gcig go //
translated: The object of direct perception is the single moment that is presently appearing.

original: mngon sum gyi rjes su skyes pa'i tog pas zhen par bya ba ni spyi kho na'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes su skyes pa'i tog pas zhen par bya ba ni spyi kho na'o //
translated: The object conceived by the cognition that arises after direct perception is a universal alone.

original: spyi de yang rnam pa gnyis te gong ma nyid kyi mtshan nyid can dang / thad ka ba'o //
analyzed: spyi de yang rnam pa gnyis te gong ma nyid kyi mtshan nyid can dang / thad ka ba'o //
translated: That universal is also twofold: that which has the characteristic of the former and that which is horizontal.

original: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa gcig kho na la skad cig ma du ma tshogs pa'i spyi ni sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi yul lo //
analyzed: de la bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa gcig kho na la skad cig ma du ma tshogs pa'i spyi ni sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi yul lo //
translated: The universal of the collection of many moments in a single entity, such as a pot, which is of the same type or of different types, is the object of the direct perception that establishes it.

original: rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba du ma rnams ni thad ka ba'i spyi ste /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba du ma rnams ni thad ka ba'i spyi ste /
translated: Many entities of different types, etc., are the horizontal universal.

original: khyab pa 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi yul lo //
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi yul lo //
translated: It is the object of the direct perception that apprehends the pervasion.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i gzung ra bya ba ni spyi'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i gzung ra bya ba ni spyi'o //
translated: The object of inference is a universal.

original: zhen par bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: zhen par bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: The object of attachment is a particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum gyi yul du bsgrub pas //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum gyi yul du bsgrub pas //
translated: Since a particular is established as the object of perception,

original: gzhan gyis brjod pa'i tshig gi don drug rnams yul ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod pa'i tshig gi don drug rnams yul ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: the six categories of the other schools are not objects.üîΩThey are: a whole substance, qualities, actions, universals,

original: 'di lta ste yan lag can gyi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang 'du ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste yan lag can gyi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang 'du ba zhes pa'o //
translated: particulars, and inherence.

original: 'di rnams mngon sum gyi shes pa la snang ba yang yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di rnams mngon sum gyi shes pa la snang ba yang yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: These do not appear in a perceptual consciousness,

original: mi snang ba yang yul du rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩha @346a * //
analyzed: mi snang ba yang yul du rigs pa ma yin te / ha @346a * //
translated: and it is not reasonable that what does not appear is an object,

original: cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: de ltar ni bum pa la sogs pa yongs su snang du rung ba la //
analyzed: de ltar ni bum pa la sogs pa yongs su snang du rung ba la //
translated: Thus, a pot, etc., is suitable to appear,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa'i cha ma gtogs par gzhan chung zad yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig tu nye bar dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa'i cha ma gtogs par gzhan chung zad yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig tu nye bar dmigs pa med do //
translated: but apart from the parts of the pot, etc., such as the base, the mouth, and so on, and the parts of the base, etc., such as the front, back, and so on, and the parts of the front, etc., such as the right and left sides, and so on, and the parts of the right side, etc., such as the front, back, and so on, and the parts of the front of the right side, etc., such as the upper and lower parts, and so on, and the parts of the upper part, etc., such as the right and left sides, and so on, and the parts of the right side, etc., such as the front, back, and so on, and the parts of the front of the right side, etc., such as the upper and lower parts, and so on, and the parts of the upper part, etc., such as the right and left sides, and so on, and the parts of the right side, etc., such as the front, back, and so on, and the parts of the front of the right side, etc., such as the upper and lower parts, and so on, and the parts of the upper part, etc., such as the right and left sides, and so on, and the parts of the right side, etc., such as the front, back, and so on, and the parts of the front of the right side, etc., such as the upper and lower parts, and so on, and the parts of the upper part, etc., such as the right and left sides, and so on, and the parts of the right side, etc., such as the front, back, and so on, and the parts of the front of the right side, etc., such as the upper and lower parts, and so on, and the parts of the upper part, etc., such as the right and left sides, and

original: rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pas gang gsungs pa ;üîΩcha rnams yang dag nges gnas nyid //
analyzed: rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pas gang gsungs pa ; cha rnams yang dag nges gnas nyid //
translated: The supreme lord of reasoning has said:üîΩThe very ascertainment of the aspects

original: de lta de ltar snang bar byed //
analyzed: de lta de ltar snang bar byed //
translated: is the appearance of just that.üîΩThe one who possesses that, even a little,

original: de dang ldan pa cha 'ga' zhig / slar yang rtog pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa cha 'ga' zhig / slar yang rtog pa med pa nyid //
translated: is again without conceptualization.

original: ces so // de bzhin du yon tan dang las la sogs pa sun dbyung ba yang rtogs par bya'o /üîΩ// /'o na 'jal bar bya ba'i ngo bo 'bras bur gyur pa 'grub par byed pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma'i zhes grub na /
analyzed: ces so // de bzhin du yon tan dang las la sogs pa sun dbyung ba yang rtogs par bya'o / // /'o na 'jal bar bya ba'i ngo bo 'bras bur gyur pa 'grub par byed pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma'i zhes grub na /
translated: In the same way, one should understand the refutation of qualities, actions, and so forth.üîΩWell, if the nature of the object of comprehension, which is the effect, is established by the pramƒÅ·πáa, then what is the pramƒÅ·πáa that establishes it?

original: de la gang 'grub par byed pa tshad ma'i shes pa yin pa /
analyzed: de la gang 'grub par byed pa tshad ma'i shes pa yin pa /
translated: What is the pramƒÅ·πáa that establishes it?

original: 'jal ba 'di ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jal ba 'di ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is this comprehension?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: 'dir sngon po la sogs pa'i don las shes pa tshul gnyis pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'dir sngon po la sogs pa'i don las shes pa tshul gnyis pa skye ste /
translated: Here, from an object such as blue, a consciousness with two modes of apprehension arises.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa dang sngon po'i rtogs pa'i rang gi tshul lo //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa dang sngon po'i rtogs pa'i rang gi tshul lo //
translated: It is the mode of apprehension of the aspect of blue and the mode of apprehension of the realization of blue.

original: de la sngon po'i rnam pa ma yin pa las ldog pas sngon po'i rnam pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de la sngon po'i rnam pa ma yin pa las ldog pas sngon po'i rnam pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: Among them, the consciousness that is the aspect of blue is a pramƒÅ·πáa because it is distinguished from that which is not the aspect of blue.

original: sngon po rtogs pa ma yin pa las ldog pas /
analyzed: sngon po rtogs pa ma yin pa las ldog pas /
translated: Since it is the opposite of the non-realization of blue,

original: sngon po rtogs pa rang gi tshul ni 'jal ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po rtogs pa rang gi tshul ni 'jal ba ste /
translated: the realization of blue is the mode of the cognition itself.

original: de kho na 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de kho na 'bras bu'o //
translated: That is the result of valid knowledge.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: don dang 'dra ba ni 'di'i tshad ma yin la ;
analyzed: don dang 'dra ba ni 'di'i tshad ma yin la ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe similarity to the object is the valid knowledge;

original: don rtogs pa ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o zhes so //
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o zhes so //
translated: the realization of the object is the result of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'di yang rnam par rtog pas tha rtogs pas tha dad du rnam par gzhag gi don dam par ni tha dad pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam par rtog pas tha rtogs pas tha dad du rnam par gzhag gi don dam par ni tha dad pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, this is posited as different through conceptual thought; ultimately, there is no difference at all.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: mngon sum gyi shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o zhes so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pa de nyid tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very direct perception is the result of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: gal te yang shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te yang shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par mi 'dod na /
translated: If, moreover, one does not accept that consciousness has aspects,

original: de'i tshe rnam par med pa nyid kyis yul thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par med pa nyid kyis yul thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: then, because of being without aspects, all objects would be the same.

original: rnam par phye nas yul rnam par 'jog pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rnam par phye nas yul rnam par 'jog pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the positing of objects through differentiation would not be established.

original: gang yang 'ga' zhig shes pa snga ma tshad ma dang / shes pa phyi ma tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'ga' zhig shes pa snga ma tshad ma dang / shes pa phyi ma tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o zhes smra ba ste /
translated: Some say: The former consciousness is a valid cognition and the latter consciousness is the result of valid cognition.

original: mi rigs te /üîΩde ltar na re zhig skad cig dang por 'byung ba'i shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rigs te / de ltar na re zhig skad cig dang por 'byung ba'i shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pa gnyis pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pa gnyis pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were the case, then the consciousness that arises in the first instant is not a valid cognition because the second consciousness that is its result does not arise.

original: 'bras bur gyur ba'i shes pa gnyis pa skye ba na yang snga ma skad cig ma nyid kyis zhig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur ba'i shes pa gnyis pa skye ba na yang snga ma skad cig ma nyid kyis zhig pa'i phyir /
translated: When the second consciousness that is its result arises, the former consciousness is destroyed by momentariness.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i yul shes pa'i tshad mar @346b 'gyur ;üîΩdus mtshungs par byung ba'i shes pa yang 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa'i yul shes pa'i tshad mar @346b 'gyur ; dus mtshungs par byung ba'i shes pa yang 'bras bur rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: How could it be a valid cognition that knows objects such as a pot?üîΩIt is also illogical for a consciousness that arises at the same time to be its result because they do not have the relationship of being that which is helped and helper, like the right and left horns of an ox.

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi ba lang gi rva dag bzhin no zhes pa rtog ge'i skad du mngon sum yongs su bcad pa'o /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi ba lang gi rva dag bzhin no zhes pa rtog ge'i skad du mngon sum yongs su bcad pa'o /
translated: This is the definition of direct perception in the language of logicians.

original: // / rjes su dpag pa rnams kyis te rang don dang gzhan don no //
analyzed: // / rjes su dpag pa rnams kyis te rang don dang gzhan don no //
translated: The inferences are for one's own purpose and for the purpose of others.

original: rang gi ched du gang yin pa de rang don to //
analyzed: rang gi ched du gang yin pa de rang don to //
translated: That which is for one's own sake is one's own purpose.

original: rang don rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rang don rjes su dpag pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The inference for one's own sake has the nature of knowledge.

original: la la sogs pa du ba la sogs pa mthong nas rtogs pa po gang gi me'i shes pa skye ba ni de kho na shes pa des lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs par byed kyi gzhan ma yin no zhes pas rang gi don te de rjes su dpagüîΩpar brjod do //
analyzed: la la sogs pa du ba la sogs pa mthong nas rtogs pa po gang gi me'i shes pa skye ba ni de kho na shes pa des lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs par byed kyi gzhan ma yin no zhes pas rang gi don te de rjes su dpag par brjod do //
translated: When someone sees smoke and so on and infers fire and so on, the knowledge of fire that arises for the inferring person is that very knowledge that comprehends the hidden object, not anything else. Thus, it is for one's own sake. That is called inference.

original: gzhan gyi ched du gang yin pa de gzhan don no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ched du gang yin pa de gzhan don no //
translated: That which is for the sake of others is the purpose of others.

original: gzhan don rjes su dpag pa tshig gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan don rjes su dpag pa tshig gi bdag nyid de /
translated: The inference for the purpose of others has the nature of words.

original: tshul gsum pa rtogs par byed du 'jug pa'i tshig ni pha rol po rtogs par byed du 'jug shes par byed du 'jug ces byas nas tshig kyang nye bar btags pa la rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa rtogs par byed du 'jug pa'i tshig ni pha rol po rtogs par byed du 'jug shes par byed du 'jug ces byas nas tshig kyang nye bar btags pa la rjes su dpag pa'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The words that cause the understanding of the trimodal [reason] are the words that cause the understanding of others, that cause the knowledge of others. Thus, the words are figuratively called inference.

original: de la rang don ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las gang rjes su dpag par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang don ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las gang rjes su dpag par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the ‚Äúown purpose‚Äù is that which is to be inferred from the triply characterized reason.

original: tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags ni rjes su dpag par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la rtogs pa po'i gang shes pa skye ba de rang don rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i rtags ni rjes su dpag par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la rtogs pa po'i gang shes pa skye ba de rang don rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äútriply characterized reason‚Äù is the knowledge that arises in the cognizer with regard to the hidden object to be inferred. That is the inference for one‚Äôs own purpose.

original: de yang chos can gyi khyad par 'brel pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang / med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de yang chos can gyi khyad par 'brel pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang / med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that this is ascertained by the relation of the specific property of the subject and the invariable relation.

original: mer lhag par zhen pa'o zhes gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: mer lhag par zhen pa'o zhes gzhan rnams so //
translated: Others say that it is the ascertainment of the existence of the reason in the subject.

original: da ni rtags kyi tshul gsum po bshad par bya ba ste /üîΩrjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kho nar nges pa'o //üîΩrjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos can la rtags yod pa nyid du nges pa gang de ni tshul gcig ste /
analyzed: da ni rtags kyi tshul gsum po bshad par bya ba ste / rjes su dpag par bya ba la yod pa nyid kho nar nges pa'o // rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos can la rtags yod pa nyid du nges pa gang de ni tshul gcig ste /
translated: Now, the triply characterized reason will be explained.üîΩIt is ascertained that the reason exists only in the similar class.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid kyi ming can no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid kyi ming can no //
translated: The ascertainment that the reason exists in the subject and so on is the first mode, which is called the property of the subject.

original: 'dir yod pa smos pas ma grub pa bsal te /
analyzed: 'dir yod pa smos pas ma grub pa bsal te /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù excludes the unestablished reason.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ste /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is perceptible by the eye.‚Äù

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung bya nyid de //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung bya nyid de //
translated: ‚ÄúPerceptible by the eye‚Äù means perceptible by the eye-consciousness.

original: de chos can sgra la med do //
analyzed: de chos can sgra la med do //
translated: That does not exist in sound, the subject.

original: kho na'i sgras phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub ste /
analyzed: kho na'i sgras phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes the unestablished reason in one part of the subject.

original: dper na phyogs kyi gos can pa'i sbyor ba /
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi gos can pa'i sbyor ba /
translated: For example, the argument of the PƒÅ≈õupatas:

original: shing rnams sems pa can yin te /üîΩnyal ba'i @347a * //
analyzed: shing rnams sems pa can yin te / nyal ba'i @347a * //
translated: ‚ÄúTrees are sentient,üîΩbecause they grow backüîΩwhen cut down.

original: phyir ro ; / lo ma zum pa'i mtshan nyid can ni nyal ba ste /
analyzed: phyir ro ; / lo ma zum pa'i mtshan nyid can ni nyal ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTo grow back‚Äù means to grow back with leaves.

original: de yang shing thams cad la ma grub po //
analyzed: de yang shing thams cad la ma grub po //
translated: That is not established in all trees.

original: nges pa smos pas the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa smos pas the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúcertainly‚Äù excludes the unestablished reason that is doubtful.

original: 'di na me yod de rlangs pa la sogs par the tshom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di na me yod de rlangs pa la sogs par the tshom za ba'i 'byung ba 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is fire, because there is smoke,‚Äù where there is doubt about the elements that constitute smoke.

original: yod pa'i sgra las phyis kho na'i sgras thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa'i sgra las phyis kho na'i sgras thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù after the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù excludes the unestablished reason that is unaccepted by either party.

original: sgra mi rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Sound is impermanent, because it is audible.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la yod pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la yod pa'o //
translated: It is restricted to the similar position.

original: nges pa'o zhes 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'o zhes 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is certain. This is the second mode.

original: phyogs dang mtshungs pa ni phyogs dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang mtshungs pa ni phyogs dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The similar position is the position that is similar to the position.

original: phyogs dang lhan cig 'dra ba'i dpe'i chos can no zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: phyogs dang lhan cig 'dra ba'i dpe'i chos can no zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that it is the example property-possessor that is similar to the position.

original: / phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la yod par nges pa zhes pa rjes su 'gro ba'i ming can tshul gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: / phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la yod par nges pa zhes pa rjes su 'gro ba'i ming can tshul gnyis pa'o //
translated: It is certain that it exists only in the similar position. This is the second mode, which is called positive pervasion.

original: 'dir yod pa smos pas 'gal ba bsal te /
analyzed: 'dir yod pa smos pas 'gal ba bsal te /
translated: Here, the word only excludes contradiction.

original: sgra rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sgra rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro zhes pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, Sound is permanent, because it is produced.

original: byas pa nyid kyi rtag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa can no zhes pas 'gal bar brjod do //
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyi rtag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa can no zhes pas 'gal bar brjod do //
translated: It is said to be contradictory because produced is pervaded by its opposite, impermanence, of permanence.

original: kho na'i yi ges thun mong gi bsal te /
analyzed: kho na'i yi ges thun mong gi bsal te /
translated: The word only excludes common pervasion.

original: sgra rtag ste gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra rtag ste gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Sound is permanent, because it is an object of comprehension.

original: gzhal bya nyid rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa nyid ni /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa nyid ni /
translated: The object of apprehension is the object of conceptualization.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la yang yod do zhes pa thun mong bar brjod do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la yang yod do zhes pa thun mong bar brjod do //
translated: It is said to be common because it exists in the similar class, space, and in the dissimilar class, a pot.

original: yod pa'i sgra las sngon du kho na'i yi ges ni phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa ma yin yang rtsol ba las byung ba gtan tshigs nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: yod pa'i sgra las sngon du kho na'i yi ges ni phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa ma yin yang rtsol ba las byung ba gtan tshigs nyid du bshad de /
translated: The word only, which comes after the word existent, indicates that although it does not pervade all similar classes, it is still a reason that arises from effort.

original: sgra mi rtag ste brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi bum pa bzhin dang glog bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi bum pa bzhin dang glog bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Sound is impermanent because it arises from effort, like a pot and like lightning.

original: nges par smos pa rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba bsal te ;
analyzed: nges par smos pa rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba bsal te ;
translated: The word only eliminates doubt about the pervasion.

original: 'di thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te smra ba po nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin zhes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin te smra ba po nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i skyes bu bzhin zhes pa lta bu ste /
translated: This is not omniscient because of being a speaker, like a human being who is a desirer.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa 'dod pa'i skyes bu la /
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa 'dod pa'i skyes bu la /
translated: The similar class of a human being who is a desirer is a human being who is a desirer.

original: smra ba po nyid thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa'am /
analyzed: smra ba po nyid thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid kyis khyab pa'am /
translated: The pervasion is that being a speaker is necessarily not omniscient.

original: ma khyab pa mi shes pas so //üîΩmi mthun phyogs la med pa kho nar nges pa'o //
analyzed: ma khyab pa mi shes pas so // mi mthun phyogs la med pa kho nar nges pa'o //
translated: Or, it is not known that there is no pervasion.üîΩThe third mode is ascertained to be the absence of the property of the subject in the dissimilar class.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ni mi mthun phyogs te de la med pa nyid kho nar nges pa gang de ni ldog pa'i ming can tshul gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ni mi mthun phyogs te de la med pa nyid kho nar nges pa gang de ni ldog pa'i ming can tshul gsum pa'o //
translated: The dissimilar class is the opposite of the similar class. The third mode is ascertained to be the absence of the property of the subject in the dissimilar class.

original: 'dir yang med pa gzung bas 'gal ba bsal lo //
analyzed: 'dir yang med pa gzung bas 'gal ba bsal lo //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to eliminate the fallacy of overpervasion.

original: kho na'i yi ges thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: kho na'i yi ges thun mong ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates that the property of the subject is shared.

original: nges pa smos pas mi mthun phyogs la ldog pa the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: nges pa smos pas mi mthun phyogs la ldog pa the tshom za ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúascertained‚Äù indicates that there is doubt about the absence of the property of the subject in the dissimilar class.

original: @347b dper na skyes bu 'di 'dod chags bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: @347b dper na skyes bu 'di 'dod chags bral ba ma yin te /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThis person is not free from attachment,

original: smra ba'i phyir shing rta zhon pa'i skyes bu bzhin zhes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: smra ba'i phyir shing rta zhon pa'i skyes bu bzhin zhes pa lta bu ste /
translated: because he speaks, like a person riding in a chariot.‚Äù

original: gang du 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid med pa der smra ba po nyid kyang ste /
analyzed: gang du 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa nyid med pa der smra ba po nyid kyang ste /
translated: Where there is no absence of freedom from attachment, there is also no presence of being a speaker.

original: rdo ba'i dum bu bzhin /
analyzed: rdo ba'i dum bu bzhin /
translated: It is like a piece of stone.

original: rdo'i dum bu las gnyi ga log tu zin mod /
analyzed: rdo'i dum bu las gnyi ga log tu zin mod /
translated: Although both are absent in a piece of stone,

original: de lta na yang ci /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci /
translated: But what is the point of this?

original: rdo'i dum bu las chags bral ma yin pa nyid log pa na smra ba po nyid log gam 'on te rang nyid kho na las zhes mi shes so //
analyzed: rdo'i dum bu las chags bral ma yin pa nyid log pa na smra ba po nyid log gam 'on te rang nyid kho na las zhes mi shes so //
translated: When the absence of detachment from a piece of stone is refuted, is the speaker refuted or is only itself refuted?

original: de'i phyir 'di ldog ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ldog ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is an uncertain reason because there is doubt about the negation.

original: med pa smos pa las phyis kho na'i yi ge'i mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: med pa smos pa las phyis kho na'i yi ge'i mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i thun mong ba ste /
translated: The word non-existent is a common reason that applies to only one part of the class of non-similar instances after the word only.

original: dper na sgra ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin te mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba yin te mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, sound is produced by effort because it is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni mi mthun phyogs nam mkha' las ldog cing glog las ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni mi mthun phyogs nam mkha' las ldog cing glog las ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Impermanence is the opposite of the dissimilar instance space, but it is not the opposite of lightning. Therefore, this is a common reason that applies to only one part of the class of non-similar instances.

original: 'o na phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: 'o na phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes brjod pa na /
translated: But when it is said that it exists only in similar instances,

original: shugs kho na las phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa la med pa nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: shugs kho na las phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa la med pa nyid rtogs te /
translated: then its non-existence in dissimilar instances is understood only by implication.

original: de'i phyir ci'i don du gnyi ga dag nye bar bzung zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci'i don du gnyi ga dag nye bar bzung zhe na /
translated: Therefore, for what purpose are both of them accepted?

original: sngon gyi rgan po rnams ni mi mthun phyogs nges pa'i don du'o zhe'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgan po rnams ni mi mthun phyogs nges pa'i don du'o zhe'o //
translated: The elders of old say that the purpose is to ascertain the counter-pervasion.

original: de rnams kyang mi mthun phyogs rnam pa gsum kho nar 'gyur ro zhes sems te ;
analyzed: de rnams kyang mi mthun phyogs rnam pa gsum kho nar 'gyur ro zhes sems te ;
translated: And they think that the counter-pervasion is of three kinds only:

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam dang / bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan pa dang / bsgrub bya dang lhan cig 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam dang / bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan pa dang / bsgrub bya dang lhan cig 'gal ba'o //
translated: mere non-establishment of the probandum, other than the probandum, and contradictory with the probandum.

original: sbyor ba nges pa'i don du'o zhes kha cig ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba nges pa'i don du'o zhes kha cig ste /
