translated: Some say that the purpose is to ascertain the proof.

original: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sbyor ba'am ldog pa can gyi sbyor ba nges pa dang ldan pa gcig sbyar bar bya'i gnyis dag ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi sbyor ba'am ldog pa can gyi sbyor ba nges pa dang ldan pa gcig sbyar bar bya'i gnyis dag ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: They think that one should employ either a proof that is a positive concomitance or a proof that is a negative concomitance, but not both.üîΩSome say that the purpose is to clarify the proof that has a similar property and the proof that has a dissimilar property.

original: chos mthun pa dang ldan pa dang / chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba gsal bar bya ba'i don du zhes kha cig go / tshul gsum pa can gyi rtags gsum kho na rnams so //
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang ldan pa dang / chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba gsal bar bya ba'i don du zhes kha cig go / tshul gsum pa can gyi rtags gsum kho na rnams so //
translated: The three kinds of reason are only those that have the three modes.

original: gang rnams kyi tshul gsum yin pa de rnams tshul gsum pa can gyi rtags te gsum kho na'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi tshul gsum yin pa de rnams tshul gsum pa can gyi rtags te gsum kho na'o //
translated: Those which are the three modes are the reason having the three modes. There are only three.

original: 'bras bu tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang rang bzhin tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang / mi dmigs pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang rang bzhin tshul gsum pa'i rtags dang / mi dmigs pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags so //
translated: The reason having the effect as the three modes, the reason having the nature as the three modes, and the reason having non-observation as the three modes.

original: sgrub par byed pa dang shes pa byed pa dang gtan tshigs dang khyab par bya ba zhes pa rtags kyi ming gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dang shes pa byed pa dang gtan tshigs dang khyab par bya ba zhes pa rtags kyi ming gzhan rnams so //
translated: The other names for the reason are: proof, cognition, reason, and pervasion.

original: de la 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu ni /
translated: Regarding that, the effect is as follows.

original: dper na gang na du ba yod pa de na me ste /üîΩdper na tshang @348a * //
analyzed: dper na gang na du ba yod pa de na me ste / dper na tshang @348a * //
translated: For example, where there is smoke there is fire,

original: bang bzhin / 'di na yang du ba'o zhes pa bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi khyab pa dang phyogs chos nyid kyi ming can sgrub byed kyi ngag yan lag gnyis pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bang bzhin / 'di na yang du ba'o zhes pa bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi khyab pa dang phyogs chos nyid kyi ming can sgrub byed kyi ngag yan lag gnyis pa kho na'o //
translated: for example, in a kitchen. Here there is smoke. This is the two-membered statement of proof of the Sugatas, which has the name pervasion and property of the subject.

original: gzhan rnams ni dam bca' dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba zhes pa yan lag lnga bsgrub pa'i ngag tu smra'o //üîΩnye bar dgod pa yang /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni dam bca' dang gtan tshigs dang dpe dang nye bar sbyar ba dang mjug bsdu ba zhes pa yan lag lnga bsgrub pa'i ngag tu smra'o // nye bar dgod pa yang /
translated: The others say that it is a five-membered statement: thesis, reason, example, application, and conclusion.

original: 'di lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu ste /
translated: The statement of the thesis is as follows:

original: 'di na me yod de /
analyzed: 'di na me yod de /
translated: Here there is fire.

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is smoke.

original: gang na du ba yod pa de na me ste dper na tshang bang bzhin /
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de na me ste dper na tshang bang bzhin /
translated: Where there is smoke there is fire, as in a kitchen.

original: de lta bu yang 'di'o //
analyzed: de lta bu yang 'di'o //
translated: And that is so here.

original: de'i phyir me yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir me yod do //
translated: Therefore, there is fire.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is not right,

original: 'brel ba dang bral ba'i dam bca' ba'i tshig tsam las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba dang bral ba'i dam bca' ba'i tshig tsam las bsgrub par bya ba rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not right to understand the probandum from the mere words of the thesis, which are not related to it.

original: 'brel ba med par ni sgra dang don dag gis 'brel ba sun dbyung bar bsgrub zin pa'i phyir slar mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'brel ba med par ni sgra dang don dag gis 'brel ba sun dbyung bar bsgrub zin pa'i phyir slar mi brjod do //
translated: Since it has been refuted that there is a relation between words and their referents, we will not repeat ourselves.

original: dam bca' ba med pa lnga'i mtha' can gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba mi rigs la /
analyzed: dam bca' ba med pa lnga'i mtha' can gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba mi rigs la /
translated: It is not right to use a reason that ends in the five-membered statement without a thesis.

original: gtan tshigs med par nye bar sbyar ba dang / dpe dag mi rigs shing /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med par nye bar sbyar ba dang / dpe dag mi rigs shing /
translated: The application of a reason is not correct without a reason, and an example is not correct.

original: gang na dam bca' nyid med pa der dam bca' slar yang brjod pa mjug bsdu ba ci las 'byung bar 'gyur zhes te /
analyzed: gang na dam bca' nyid med pa der dam bca' slar yang brjod pa mjug bsdu ba ci las 'byung bar 'gyur zhes te /
translated: And where there is no thesis, how could the restatement of the thesis, the conclusion, occur?

original: thams cad kun du bcad zin pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kun du bcad zin pa gcod pa'o //
translated: It is the cutting of what has already been completely cut.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'di yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'di yang yul gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This result reason is also threefold by way of the division of objects.

original: me la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la du ba la sogs pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyi nges par bya ba dang / mig la sogs bsgrub par bya ba la shes pa res 'ga' 'bras bu skye ba las shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: me la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la du ba la sogs pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyi nges par bya ba dang / mig la sogs bsgrub par bya ba la shes pa res 'ga' 'bras bu skye ba las shes par bya ba dang /
translated: In the proof of fire and so on, it is ascertained by the three types of direct perception and nonobservation of smoke and so on. In the proof of eye and so on, it is understood from the arising of consciousness that is the result of the eye.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la ro la sogs pa tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis nges par bya ba dper na ma du lung ga sogs pa'i 'bras bu la gzugs las ro rjes su dpog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la ro la sogs pa tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis nges par bya ba dper na ma du lung ga sogs pa'i 'bras bu la gzugs las ro rjes su dpog pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the proof of form and so on, it is ascertained by the dependence on the same collection of the taste and so on. For example, the taste is inferred from the form in the result of a mango and so on.

original: 'dir gzugs bskyed par bya ba la gzugs snga ma nye bar len pa dang ro lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs bskyed par bya ba la gzugs snga ma nye bar len pa dang ro lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Here, the prior form is the substantial cause upadanahetu of the form that is generated.

original: phung po snga ma las phung po phyi ma skye ba la rigs pa 'di'o //
analyzed: phung po snga ma las phung po phyi ma skye ba la rigs pa 'di'o //
translated: This principle applies to the generation of subsequent aggregates from prior aggregates.

original: 'o na nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su sgrub pa 'bras bu'i ngor mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar len pa dang lhan cig byed pa dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su sgrub pa 'bras bu'i ngor mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If substantial cause and cooperative cause are similar in terms of establishing concomitance and reversal, what is the difference between them?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gang rnam par 'gyur bas rgyun cig la gang 'grub pa ste 'bras bu'i ngor snga ma nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par 'gyur bas rgyun cig la gang 'grub pa ste 'bras bu'i ngor snga ma nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The prior substantial cause of an effect is that which is established in a single continuum by the transformation of the prior.

original: gang rgyun gzhan la khyad par bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan de lhan @348b cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang rgyun gzhan la khyad par bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan de lhan @348b cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cooperative cause is the reason that generates a difference in a different continuum.

original: dper na sh'a li'i myu gu bskyed par bya ba la sh'a li'i sa bon nye bar len pa dang zhing sa dang chu la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sh'a li'i myu gu bskyed par bya ba la sh'a li'i sa bon nye bar len pa dang zhing sa dang chu la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a rice seed is the substantial cause of the generation of a rice sprout, and the field, water, and so on are the cooperative causes.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de las byung ba'i 'brel pa las rtogs par byed pa'o zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs de las byung ba'i 'brel pa las rtogs par byed pa'o zhes gnas so //
translated: Thus, the relation that arises from that reason of effect is to be understood.

original: rang bzhin ni rang yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gtan tshigs so //
translated: The nature is the reason for the property to be established that arises from the mere existence of itself.

original: gtan tshigs yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gang gtan tshigs su brjod par bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gang gtan tshigs su brjod par bya ba de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos de'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: That which is to be stated as the reason for the property to be established that arises from the mere existence of the reason should be understood as the nature of that property to be established.

original: dper na 'di ni shing gi tha snyad du byar rung ste /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni shing gi tha snyad du byar rung ste /
translated: For example, this is suitable to be designated as a tree.

original: shing sha ba'i tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing sha ba'i tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because of being suitable to be designated as a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: 'di ni zhes pa mdun na yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i tshig gi don te chos can no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa mdun na yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i tshig gi don te chos can no //
translated: This refers to the object of the word that is fully seen in front, which is the subject.

original: shing sha ba'i tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shing sha ba'i tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Because of being suitable to be designated as a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree is the proof.

original: shing sha pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: shing sha pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is suitable to be designated as a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree‚Äù?

original: lo ma dang 'dab ma dang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par gyi tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: lo ma dang 'dab ma dang kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par gyi tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúbecause it is suitable to be designated as having the features of leaves, branches, color, and shape.‚Äù

original: shing gi tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shing gi tha snyad du byar rung ba nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The suitability of being designated as a tree is the probandum.

original: 'o na gcig nyid la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'o na gcig nyid la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not logical for something to be both the probandum and the proof.

original: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because the meaning of the thesis is just one part.

original: ma yin te tha dad pa med na med /
analyzed: ma yin te tha dad pa med na med /
translated: This is not so. If there is no difference, there is no proof.

original: yang rtogs pa po 'ga' zhig shing sha ba'i tha snyad byas nas de la shing gi tha snyad sngar byas kyang /
analyzed: yang rtogs pa po 'ga' zhig shing sha ba'i tha snyad byas nas de la shing gi tha snyad sngar byas kyang /
translated: Moreover, some person who has been designated as a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree may have previously been designated as a tree.

original: rmongs pas cung zad sgro btags nas slar mi byed pa de la da gzod rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs pas cung zad sgro btags nas slar mi byed pa de la da gzod rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: But because of confusion, he does not do so again after a little fabrication. For him, the term ‚Äúnatural reasoning‚Äù is used for the first time.

original: de'i phyir de dag don dam par gcig pa nyid la yang rnam par rtog pa'i blo tha snyad la grub pa ldog pa la brten nas skyes pa la tha dad par snang ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa nyid ni mi 'gal lo zhes
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag don dam par gcig pa nyid la yang rnam par rtog pa'i blo tha snyad la grub pa ldog pa la brten nas skyes pa la tha dad par snang ba'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa nyid ni mi 'gal lo zhes
translated: Therefore, because they appear to be different to the conceptual mind that arises in dependence on the reversal of the conventional in the case of ultimate identity, the probandum and the proof are not contradictory.

original: pa'o // mi dmigs pa ni dper na phyogs 'di na bum pa med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa'o // mi dmigs pa ni dper na phyogs 'di na bum pa med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is like, for example, ‚ÄúThere is no pot here because the perceptible is not apprehended,‚Äù and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes pa'i snang du rung ba'i zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes pa'i snang du rung ba'i zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe perceptible‚Äù means ‚Äúthe visible.‚Äù

original: 'o na med pa ji ltar snang rung nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na med pa ji ltar snang rung nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Well, how can a non-existent be visible?

original: dbang po'i shes pa gcig gis gzung bar bya bas phyogs la sogs pa dmigs par bya ba bzhin pa ni gal te bum pa yod na bltar rung ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes @349a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa gcig gis gzung bar bya bas phyogs la sogs pa dmigs par bya ba bzhin pa ni gal te bum pa yod na bltar rung ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes @349a * //
translated: If the pot existed, it would be visible, like the place, etc. that is apprehended by a single sense consciousness.

original: bas dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba'i phyir snang rung nyid du srid pa ste /
analyzed: bas dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshang ba'i phyir snang rung nyid du srid pa ste /
translated: because the other conditions, the objective condition, are complete.

original: de snang du rung ba kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de snang du rung ba kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: It is possible that it could appear, but it does not appear.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is: because it is not perceived.

original: de yang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i tshig gi don las sam shes pa gcig ma 'dres pa'i tshig gi don dmigs pa las nges par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i tshig gi don las sam shes pa gcig ma 'dres pa'i tshig gi don dmigs pa las nges par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be ascertained from the meaning of the words that it is not mixed with a single cognition, or that it is perceived from the meaning of the words of a single unmixed cognition.

original: de gnyi ga las dang byed pa po'i dngos por ma yin pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis mi dmigs pa brjod kyi /
analyzed: de gnyi ga las dang byed pa po'i dngos por ma yin pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis mi dmigs pa brjod kyi /
translated: Both of those are stated as non-perceptions in the manner of a negation of the nature of action and agent.

original: med pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa log pa tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa log pa tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not merely the reversal of perception in the manner of an absolute negation.

original: de lta ni rang nyid ci yang ma yin pas ji ltar sgrub byed du 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ni rang nyid ci yang ma yin pas ji ltar sgrub byed du 'gyur /
translated: Because that is itself nothing whatsoever, how could it be a proof?

original: dgag bya la gzhan pa'i shes pa tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag bya la gzhan pa'i shes pa tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not merely a cognition of something other than the object of negation,

original: gzugs dmigs pa las kyang n'a ga rang ga la ro dgag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dmigs pa las kyang n'a ga rang ga la ro dgag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the perception of form would negate the perception of taste.

original: de'i phyir dgag bya las khyad par can kho na'i dngos po gnyis po sa phyogs sam sa phyogs kyi shes pa ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag bya las khyad par can kho na'i dngos po gnyis po sa phyogs sam sa phyogs kyi shes pa ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThe two things, the place and the cognition of the place, are not apprehended as qualified by the object of negation‚Äù is correct.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, nonexistence is not to be established.

original: de bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs 'dzin pa'i mngon sum kho na grub pa nyid kyi phyir rol //
analyzed: de bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs 'dzin pa'i mngon sum kho na grub pa nyid kyi phyir rol //
translated: For the direct perception that apprehends the place devoid of pot is established.

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni rmongs pa'i ngor mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni rmongs pa'i ngor mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: The convention of nonexistence is established by nonapprehension for the confused.

original: de ltar ni rmongs pa 'ga' zhig rdul la sogs pa grang can la grags pa'i yon tan rnams la mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad zhugs kyang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' goms pa las slar yang thams cad du thams cad yod do zhes dang //
analyzed: de ltar ni rmongs pa 'ga' zhig rdul la sogs pa grang can la grags pa'i yon tan rnams la mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad zhugs kyang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' goms pa las slar yang thams cad du thams cad yod do zhes dang //
translated: For example, some confused person, having engaged in the convention of nonexistence by way of nonapprehension of the qualities of earth and so on that are renowned to the Vaise~ika, again, due to being habituated to his own tenets, says, ‚ÄúEverything exists in everything.‚Äù

original: sa phyogs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu yung bum pa la mi dmigs pa yod na yang med pa'i tha snyad mi byed ces pas na mi dmigs pa tha sad rnam pa gsum bya ste /
analyzed: sa phyogs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu yung bum pa la mi dmigs pa yod na yang med pa'i tha snyad mi byed ces pas na mi dmigs pa tha sad rnam pa gsum bya ste /
translated: Therefore, nonobservation is said to be of three kinds:

original: de la dgos pa med par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can lus kyi tha snyad dang 'di ni bum pa med do zhes pa ngag gi dang 'di lta bu kho na nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa can yid kyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dgos pa med par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can lus kyi tha snyad dang 'di ni bum pa med do zhes pa ngag gi dang 'di lta bu kho na nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa can yid kyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The convention of the body is characterized by going and coming without purpose. The convention of speech is ‚ÄúThis is a non-existent pot.‚Äù The convention of mind is the aspect of internal expression, such as ‚ÄúIt is just like this.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa ni las kyi chos kyi phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'brel bar rtogs par bya zhing byed pa po'i chos kyi phyogs la ni de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni las kyi chos kyi phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'brel bar rtogs par bya zhing byed pa po'i chos kyi phyogs la ni de las byung ba ste /
translated: Nonobservation is to be understood as a relation that is the nature of the object of affirmation and the means of affirmation in the case of the property of the object of action. In the case of the property of the agent, it is the arising from that.

original: de ltar ni bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs sam sa phyogs kyi shes pa ni mi dmigs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar ni bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs sam sa phyogs kyi shes pa ni mi dmigs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In that case, a place devoid of a pot or the consciousness of a place is said to be nonobservation.

original: med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid dang de'i rang bzhin te shes pa ni sa phyogs kyi 'bras bu'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid dang de'i rang bzhin te shes pa ni sa phyogs kyi 'bras bu'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The nature of that, i.e., the cognition, is the effect of the locus.

original: 'o na gal te mi dmigs pa la yang de'i @349b bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag kho na'i 'brel ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mi dmigs pa la yang de'i @349b bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag kho na'i 'brel ba yin na /
translated: Now, if non-apprehension also has the relation of identity and causality,

original: de lta na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag las mi dmigs pa ji ltar tha snyad ce na /
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag las mi dmigs pa ji ltar tha snyad ce na /
translated: then how is non-apprehension different from effect and nature?

original: dgag pa sgrub par byed pa la tha dad pa ste dngos por na ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa sgrub par byed pa la tha dad pa ste dngos por na ma yin no //
translated: It is different in the proof of negation, not in the case of an entity.

original: slob dpon gyis ji skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ji skad gsungs pa /
translated: As the Acarya has said:

original: 'di la gnyis ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la gnyis ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: Here, two are the proofs of an entity,

original: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes so //
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes so //
translated: and one is the reason of negation.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i khyad par gyis yul gyis bskal ba ri rab la sogs pa dang / dus kyis bskal ba 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i dus la sogs pa dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal ba sha za la sogs pa la ma dmigs pa tsam yod par gyur na yang med pa'i tha snyad ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i khyad par gyis yul gyis bskal ba ri rab la sogs pa dang / dus kyis bskal ba 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i dus la sogs pa dang / rang bzhin gyis bskal ba sha za la sogs pa la ma dmigs pa tsam yod par gyur na yang med pa'i tha snyad ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case that a mountain, Meru, and so on, is called nonexistent because it is not perceived due to the difference in the characteristics of the object. It is not the case that the time of a universal monarch who will appear in the future is called nonexistent because it is not perceived due to the difference in time. It is not the case that a flesh-eating rƒÅk·π£asa is called nonexistent because it is not perceived due to the difference in nature.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di yang da ltar ba'i dus la tshad ma yin zhing khyad par dran pa yod par gyur na 'das pa'i dus la yang ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di yang da ltar ba'i dus la tshad ma yin zhing khyad par dran pa yod par gyur na 'das pa'i dus la yang ste /
translated: This nonapprehension is a valid cognition in regard to the present time. If the memory of a specific object exists, it is also a valid cognition in regard to the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ni mi dmigs pa rang nyid kyang the tshom za ba'i ngo bo yin pas /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ni mi dmigs pa rang nyid kyang the tshom za ba'i ngo bo yin pas /
translated: But in regard to the future, nonapprehension itself is a state of doubt.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not a valid cognition.

original: rigs pa smra bas gsungs pa /
analyzed: rigs pa smra bas gsungs pa /
translated: The logicians say:

original: dran pa'i 'du byed ma nyams pa'i 'das pa dang da ltar gyi rtogs pa po'i mngon sum ldog pa ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa'i 'du byed ma nyams pa'i 'das pa dang da ltar gyi rtogs pa po'i mngon sum ldog pa ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The opposite of the direct perception of the cognizer who has unimpaired memory of the past and present is nonapprehension.

original: med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa'o zhes so ;
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa'o zhes so ;
translated: and the non-existence of the object is established by the non-apprehension of the perceptible.

original: / de la gang gi tshe ring ba nyid kyi phyir dgag par bya ba rung du yul ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe snang rung mi dmigs pa dngos su rab tu brjod par mi nus so zhes 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams rab tuüîΩsbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de la gang gi tshe ring ba nyid kyi phyir dgag par bya ba rung du yul ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe snang rung mi dmigs pa dngos su rab tu brjod par mi nus so zhes 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: When the object to be refuted is not a perceptible object because it is too remote, then non-apprehension of the perceptible cannot be directly stated; so one should apply the non-apprehension of effect, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bcu drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: For this very reason, it has sixteen varieties by the difference of application.

original: de la rang bzhin mi rigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin mi rigs pa ni dper na /
translated: Among them, the non-apprehension of the nature is, for example,

original: 'di na du ba med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na du ba med de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here there is no smoke, because the object to be perceived is not apprehended.

original: dgag par bya ba du ba'i gang rang bzhin de 'di mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba du ba'i gang rang bzhin de 'di mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the object to be refuted, smoke, is not apprehended here.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: The non-apprehension of the effect is, for example,

original: 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here there are no unobstructed causes of smoke, because there is no smoke.

original: dgag par bya ba du ba'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu du ba ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba du ba'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu du ba ste /
translated: The effect of the causes of smoke, which is to be refuted, is smoke.

original: de 'dir mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is not observed here.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: Nonobservation of a cause is, for example,

original: 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na du ba med de me med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere there is no smoke because there is no fire.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba du ba'i rgyu med ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba du ba'i rgyu med ste /
translated: The absence of the cause of smoke, which is to be refuted, is not here.

original: de 'dir mi dmigs pa'o /üîΩ@350a * // pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir mi dmigs pa'o / @350a * // pa'o //
translated: That is not observed here.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: Nonobservation of a pervader is, for example,

original: 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere there is no tree since there is no ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba shing sha ba'i khyab par byed pa shing sta de 'dir mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba shing sha ba'i khyab par byed pa shing sta de 'dir mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervader of the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree, which is to be refuted, is a tree. That is not observed here.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: Observation of what is contradictory to the essence is, for example,

original: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because there is fire.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba grang ba'i reg pa'i rang bzhin ni gang grang ba ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba grang ba'i reg pa'i rang bzhin ni gang grang ba ste /
translated: The essence of cold touch, which is to be refuted, is cold.

original: de dang 'gal ba me yin zhing de yang 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba me yin zhing de yang 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is contradictory to fire, and that is observed here.

original: 'bras bu dang 'gal ba mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'gal ba mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: Nonobservation of what is contradictory to the effect is, for example,

original: 'di na grang ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de /
analyzed: 'di na grang ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de /
translated: Here, the causes of cold are not unobstructedly active,

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: because fire is present.

original: tha ma'i skabs su gyur pa kho na'i rgyu 'bras bu skyed par byed kyi rgyu thams cad ma yin te /
analyzed: tha ma'i skabs su gyur pa kho na'i rgyu 'bras bu skyed par byed kyi rgyu thams cad ma yin te /
translated: Only the causes that have come to the final stage produce the effect, not all causes.

original: de'i phyir khyad par nye bar bzung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par nye bar bzung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the specific [cause] is taken as the object.

original: dgag par bya ba grang ba'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu grang ba ste de dang 'gal ba yin zhing //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba grang ba'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu grang ba ste de dang 'gal ba yin zhing //
translated: The effect of the causes of cold, which are to be refuted, is cold, and that is incompatible with fire.

original: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is what is observed here.

original: rgyu dang 'gal ba mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'gal ba mi dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: Non-observation of what is incompatible with the cause is, for example,

original: 'di la spu long la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams med de /
analyzed: 'di la spu long la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams med de /
translated: Here, there are no specific features such as horripilation,

original: sreg par byed pa khyad par nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sreg par byed pa khyad par nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the specific cause of burning is present.

original: dgag par bya ba spu long la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyi rgyu grang ba ste //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba spu long la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyi rgyu grang ba ste //
translated: The cause of the specific features such as horripilation, which are to be refuted, is cold.

original: de dang 'gal ba sreg par byed pa khyad par ba yin zhing //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba sreg par byed pa khyad par ba yin zhing //
translated: That is incompatible with the specific cause of burning.

original: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is what is observed here.

original: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: Observation of what is incompatible with the pervader is, for example,üîΩHere, there is no absence of smoke,üîΩbecause fire is present.

original: 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: There is no contact of cold here because fire exists.

original: dgag par bya ba ba mo'i reg pa khyab par byed pa grang ba ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba ba mo'i reg pa khyab par byed pa grang ba ste /
translated: The contact of cold, which is the object of negation, is pervaded by heat.

original: de dang 'gal ba me khyad par ma yin la /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba me khyad par ma yin la /
translated: Fire, which is incompatible with that, is not the qualifier.

original: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is what is observed here.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: The observation of an effect that is incompatible with the essence is like the following example.

original: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contact of cold here because smoke exists.üîΩThe essence of the contact of cold, which is the object of negation, is pervaded by heat.

original: dgag par bya ba grang reg gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i 'gal ba me ste de'i 'bras bu du ba yin zhing de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba grang reg gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de'i 'gal ba me ste de'i 'bras bu du ba yin zhing de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: Smoke is the effect of that. That is observed here.

original: 'bras bu dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: The observation of an effect that is incompatible with the effect is like the following example.

original: 'di na grang ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na grang ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: There are no unobstructedly present causes of cold here because smoke exists.

original: dgag bya grang ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi 'bras bu grang ba ste /
analyzed: dgag bya grang ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi 'bras bu grang ba ste /
translated: The effect of the reason of cold, which is the object of negation, is cold.

original: de dang 'gal ba me yin zhing /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba me yin zhing /
translated: Fire is incompatible with that.

original: de'i 'bras bu du ba ste 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu du ba ste 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: Smoke is its effect. That is observed here.

original: rgyu dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: The observation of an effect that is incompatible with the cause is, for example,

original: sa phyogs 'di ni spu long la sogs @350b pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i grang ba dang ldan pa ma yin te du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di ni spu long la sogs @350b pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i grang ba dang ldan pa ma yin te du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This place is not endowed with the cold that has the attributes of goose bumps, and so on, because smoke exists.

original: dgag par bya ba spu long la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyi rgyu grang ba ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba spu long la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyi rgyu grang ba ste /
translated: The cause of the objects of negation, the attributes of goose bumps, and so on, is cold.

original: de dang 'gal ba me yin la /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba me yin la /
translated: That which is incompatible with it is fire.

original: de'i 'bras bu du ba yin zhing de dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu du ba yin zhing de dmigs pa'o //
translated: Its effect is smoke, and that is observed.üîΩThe observation of an effect that is incompatible with the pervader is, for example,

original: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ni dper na 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Here there is no contact with cold because smoke exists.

original: dgag par bya ba ba mo'i reg pa'i khyab par byed pa grang ba ste /üîΩde dang 'gal ba me yin la /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba ba mo'i reg pa'i khyab par byed pa grang ba ste / de dang 'gal ba me yin la /
translated: The pervader of the object of negation, the contact with cold, is cold.üîΩThat which is incompatible with it is fire.

original: de'i 'bras bu du ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu du ba yin zhing /
translated: Its effect is smoke.

original: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: That is observed here.

original: rang bzhin 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: The observation of a pervasion by a contradictory nature is, for example,

original: 'di na me med de ba mo'i reg pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di na me med de ba mo'i reg pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here there is no fire because there is the contact of cold.

original: dgag par bya ba me'i rang bzhin de dang 'gal ba grang ba ste des khyab pa mo'i reg pa yin la de 'dir dmigs pa'o //üîΩ'bras bu 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba me'i rang bzhin de dang 'gal ba grang ba ste des khyab pa mo'i reg pa yin la de 'dir dmigs pa'o // 'bras bu 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa /
translated: The object of negation is the nature of fire, and that is pervaded by its opposite, cold, and that is pervaded by the contact of snow.

original: dper na 'di na me'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de //
analyzed: dper na 'di na me'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa rnams med de //
translated: The observation of the pervasion by a contradictory effect is like, for example, saying, ‚ÄúHere the causes of fire, which are unobstructed and potent, do not exist

original: ba mo'i reg pa yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ba mo'i reg pa yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because the contact of snow exists.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba me'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu me yin la de dang 'gal ba grang ba dang / des khyab pa po ba mo'i reg pa ste de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba me'i rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu me yin la de dang 'gal ba grang ba dang / des khyab pa po ba mo'i reg pa ste de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of negation is the effect of the causes of fire, which is fire, and that is pervaded by its opposite, cold, and that is pervaded by the contact of snow.

original: rgyu dang 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ni dper na 'di na du ba med de ba mo'i reg pa yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ni dper na 'di na du ba med de ba mo'i reg pa yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: The observation of the pervasion by a contradictory cause is like, for example, saying, ‚ÄúHere smoke does not exist because the contact of snow exists.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba du ba'i rgyu me yin la de dang 'gal ba grang ba ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba du ba'i rgyu me yin la de dang 'gal ba grang ba ste /
translated: The object of negation is the cause of smoke, which is fire, and that is pervaded by its opposite, cold,

original: des khyab pa ba mo'i reg pa yin zhing de dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: des khyab pa ba mo'i reg pa yin zhing de dmigs pa'o //
translated: and that is pervaded by the contact of snow.

original: khyab byed dang 'gal bas dmigs pa ni dper na /
analyzed: khyab byed dang 'gal bas dmigs pa ni dper na /
translated: The observation of the pervasion by the opposite of the pervader is like, for example, saying, ‚ÄúHere a pot does not exist because a pillar exists.‚Äù

original: 'di rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not permanent,

original: res 'ga' 'bras bu byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'bras bu byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes it does produce an effect.

original: dgag par bya brtag pa'i khyab par byed pa khyad par du 'gyur ba med pa yin la /üîΩde dang 'gal ba khyad par du 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid de des khyab par res 'ga' 'bras bu byed pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: dgag par bya brtag pa'i khyab par byed pa khyad par du 'gyur ba med pa yin la / de dang 'gal ba khyad par du 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid de des khyab par res 'ga' 'bras bu byed pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: The pervasion of the object of negation is invariable.üîΩThat which is contradictory with it has a variable pervasion.

original: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir dmigs pa'o //
translated: That pervasion is sometimes the production of an effect, and that is what is observed here.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bco lnga po 'di rnams kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba bco lnga po 'di rnams kyang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: These fifteen syllogisms, such as the non-observation of an effect, should be understood as being of the nature of the non-observation of the essential nature.

original: sbyor ba'i dbye ba gzhan phye ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbye ba gzhan phye ba'o //
translated: The divisions of syllogisms are distinguished in other ways.

original: de la rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du du rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya'i /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du du rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya'i /
translated: In that regard, by the non-observation of the essential nature, the suitability of the convention of non-existence should be established.

original: dngos po med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa ni ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma yin par dgag pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa zhes brjod cing /
translated: Non-existence is said to be observed by the mode of an implicative negation.

original: de yang @351a * //
analyzed: de yang @351a * //
translated: And that is

original: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established by perception itself.

original: gzhan rnams thams cad kyi dngos po med pa dang dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan rnams thams cad kyi dngos po med pa dang dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: The non-existence and the convention of non-existence of all other things are also to be established.üîΩBecause they are not the objects of perception, since they are subjects whose objects are hidden.

original: de rnams ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rtog ge'i skad du rang don rjes su dpag pa yongs su bcad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de rnams ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa nyid kyi mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rtog ge'i skad du rang don rjes su dpag pa yongs su bcad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the section on inference for oneself in the language of logicians.

original: // / tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjod par byed pa ni gzhan don rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: // / tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjod par byed pa ni gzhan don rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The expression of a reason that has the three modes is inference for others.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang phyogs chos kyi ming can tshul gsum pa rnams tshig gang gis brjod par byed pa'i tshig de ni nye bar btags pa las rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang phyogs chos kyi ming can tshul gsum pa rnams tshig gang gis brjod par byed pa'i tshig de ni nye bar btags pa las rjes su dpag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The expression of an inference is a statement that expresses the three modes, which are called ‚Äúpositive concomitance,‚Äù ‚Äúnegative concomitance,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe property of the subject,‚Äù by means of some words.

original: de rnam pa gnyis te chos mthun pa dang ldan pa dang chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa gnyis te chos mthun pa dang ldan pa dang chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is of two types: one that possesses a similar property and one that possesses a dissimilar property.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can dag gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi rnam par mi mtshungs pa nyid ni chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can dag gtan tshigs yod pa nyid kyi rnam par mi mtshungs pa nyid ni chos mthun pa ste /
translated: The subject of the probandum and the subject of the example are not similar in the mode of being of the existent reason.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag go //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag go //
translated: That which has that is a syllogism that possesses a dissimilar subject.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can dag gtan tshig yod pa nyid kyi rnam par mi mtshungs pa chos mi mthun pa ste de gang la yod pa de chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag go / de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can dag gtan tshig yod pa nyid kyi rnam par mi mtshungs pa chos mi mthun pa ste de gang la yod pa de chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag go / de la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs
translated: The subject of the probandum and the subject of the example are not similar in the mode of being of the existent reason. That which has that is a syllogism that possesses a dissimilar subject.üîΩIn order to demonstrate the syllogism that possesses a similar subject of a natural reason,

original: kyi chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i ched du mdo sde pa'i lugs la brten nas /
analyzed: kyi chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i ched du mdo sde pa'i lugs la brten nas /
translated: based on the SautrƒÅntika system,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa /
translated: the Bhagavat said,

original: 'dus bya thams cad skad cig pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'dus bya thams cad skad cig pa'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll that is compounded is momentary.‚Äù

original: de gtan la dbab par bya ste /
analyzed: de gtan la dbab par bya ste /
translated: That should be ascertained.

original: 'dus shing tshogs nas rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas shing dngos po skyes pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dus shing tshogs nas rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis byas shing dngos po skyes pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: That which is produced by causes and conditions, having come together and assembled, is a conditioned thing.

original: skad cig pa'o zhes pa skye ba'i skad cig kho na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig pa'o zhes pa skye ba'i skad cig kho na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is momentary, because it exists only at the instant of its production.

original: re zhig bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad tho ba la sogs pa nye ba na 'jig par 'gyur bar snang zhing /
analyzed: re zhig bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad tho ba la sogs pa nye ba na 'jig par 'gyur bar snang zhing /
translated: All things, such as a pot, are seen to perish when they come in contact with a hammer, etc.

original: de la ngo bo gang gis mtha'i gnas skabs su bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa'i ngo bo de dang 'di skyes pa tsam la yod de /
analyzed: de la ngo bo gang gis mtha'i gnas skabs su bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa'i ngo bo de dang 'di skyes pa tsam la yod de /
translated: The nature by which a pot, etc. perishes at the end of its existence, that nature exists in the mere production of it.

original: de'i tshe skyes ma thag pa'i kho nar des gzhig par bya'o zhes pas 'di gsal bar byed pa skad cig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes ma thag pa'i kho nar des gzhig par bya'o zhes pas 'di gsal bar byed pa skad cig pa nyid do //
translated: At that time, it is to be destroyed by that, immediately after its production. Thus, its manifestation is momentary.

original: ci ste 'di 'dra ba kho na rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'di 'dra ba kho na rang bzhin te /
translated: If it is just this nature,

original: rang gi rgyu las de skyes shing gang dus cung zad cig gnas nas zhig go zhes pa de lta na de'i tshe tho ba la sogs pa nye ba na yang 'di kho na'i de'i rang bzhin no zhes pas slar @351b yang 'di dus de srid kho nar gnas
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las de skyes shing gang dus cung zad cig gnas nas zhig go zhes pa de lta na de'i tshe tho ba la sogs pa nye ba na yang 'di kho na'i de'i rang bzhin no zhes pas slar @351b yang 'di dus de srid kho nar gnas
translated: If it is said that it arises from its own cause, it endures for a short while, and then disintegrates, then even when a hammer and so on approaches, it would be just that nature of the vase. Therefore it would not disintegrate again.

original: par bya ba la slar yang de bzhin no zhes pas mi 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par bya ba la slar yang de bzhin no zhes pas mi 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that it endures for just that long, then it would not disintegrate.

original: de'i skad cig gnyis gnas pa'i ngang can nyid du yang skyes na /
analyzed: de'i skad cig gnyis gnas pa'i ngang can nyid du yang skyes na /
translated: If it is said that it arises with the nature of enduring for two moments,üîΩthen like the first moment, it would endure for two moments in the second moment as well, because it has the nature of enduring for two moments.

original: skad cig dang 'dra bar skad cig gnyis pa na yang skad cig gnyis gnas pa'i ngang can nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma gzhan pa gnyis su gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skad cig dang 'dra bar skad cig gnyis pa na yang skad cig gnyis gnas pa'i ngang can nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma gzhan pa gnyis su gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore it would endure for two other moments.üîΩAnd likewise, it would not disintegrate in the third moment as well, because it has that nature.

original: de bzhin du skad cig gsum pa na yang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mi 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes 'di ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig gsum pa na yang de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mi 'jig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes 'di ni 'gyur te /
translated: This is the argument.

original: de'i dngos po ni brtan pa kho nar rang gi rgyu las skyes shing /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni brtan pa kho nar rang gi rgyu las skyes shing /
translated: Its nature is stable, arising from its own cause.

original: stobs kyi 'gog byed tho ba la sogs pas gzhig par bya ba 'ba' zhig go zhe na /
analyzed: stobs kyi 'gog byed tho ba la sogs pas gzhig par bya ba 'ba' zhig go zhe na /
translated: It is only to be destroyed by a hammer or some other force that causes cessation.

original: de yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: slar yang 'di ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: slar yang 'di ji ltar rigs /
translated: How could it be logical?

original: brtan pa nyid kyi phyir de 'jig pa yang ma yin zhing //
analyzed: brtan pa nyid kyi phyir de 'jig pa yang ma yin zhing //
translated: It is not destroyed because it is stable.

original: 'gog byed kyi stobs kyis de gzhig par bya ba yang yin pa 'di ni mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gog byed kyi stobs kyis de gzhig par bya ba yang yin pa 'di ni mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not possible that it is to be destroyed by the force of a cause of cessation,

original: lha sbyin 'tsho ba yang yin la 'di 'chi bar yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin 'tsho ba yang yin la 'di 'chi bar yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: just as it is impossible to say that Devadatta is alive and also that he dies.

original: 'on te 'jig pa yin na de'i tshe ji ltar mi 'jig pa'i ngang can du de'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las skyes /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa yin na de'i tshe ji ltar mi 'jig pa'i ngang can du de'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las skyes /
translated: But if it is destroyed, then how could it arise from its own cause as a thing that is not subject to destruction?

original: 'chi ba yang yin la mi 'chi ba'i chos can yang yin no zhes smra bar mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'chi ba yang yin la mi 'chi ba'i chos can yang yin no zhes smra bar mi rigs pas so //
translated: It is illogical to say that it is subject to death and also that it is not subject to death.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pa nyid ni nam yang 'jig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir dang 'jig par mthong ba'i yang phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pa nyid ni nam yang 'jig pa mi rigs pa'i phyir dang 'jig par mthong ba'i yang phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is illogical for something that is not subject to destruction to ever be destroyed, and because it is seen to be destroyed,

original: 'jig pa'i dang can kho nar de'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las nye bar skyes so zhes khas blangs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dang can kho nar de'i dngos po rang gi rgyu las nye bar skyes so zhes khas blangs so //
translated: You have accepted that the entity of that which is perishable arises from its own cause.

original: de'i phyir skyes pa tsam kho na 'jig ching de ltar gyur na skad cig gis 'jig par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes pa tsam kho na 'jig ching de ltar gyur na skad cig gis 'jig par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just by arising, it is perishable. In that case, it is established that it is momentary.

original: sbyor ba yang sngar ltar bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang sngar ltar bya ste /
translated: The syllogism is to be formulated as before.

original: gang dang gang 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo nge dang de ni de ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i ngang can yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo nge dang de ni de ma thag tu mi gnas pa'i ngang can yin te /
translated: Whatever is perishable by nature is not stable for a second moment,

original: dper na skad cig ma tha mar zhugs pa'i bum pa'i ngo bo bzhin /
analyzed: dper na skad cig ma tha mar zhugs pa'i bum pa'i ngo bo bzhin /
translated: like the entity of a pot that has entered the final moment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus na yang 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus na yang 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The entity of form, etc., at the time of its arising is perishable by nature. This is a reason of nature.

original: gal te dngos po rnams skad cig gis nyams pa'i ngang can yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams skad cig gis nyams pa'i ngang can yin na /
translated: If things are perishable by nature,

original: 'o na de kho na 'di'o zhes ngo shes ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de kho na 'di'o zhes ngo shes ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can it be said that this is the very same thing?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: 'dra ba'i bar ma chad pa gzhan dang gzhan byung ba las dang / ma rig pa bcings pa las so //üîΩskad cig snga ma 'jig pa'i dus kho na de dang 'dra @352a * //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i bar ma chad pa gzhan dang gzhan byung ba las dang / ma rig pa bcings pa las so // skad cig snga ma 'jig pa'i dus kho na de dang 'dra @352a * //
translated: and the other moments that arise in an uninterrupted similar sequence, and from the bondage of ignorance.

original: ba'i skad cig gzhan skye ste /
analyzed: ba'i skad cig gzhan skye ste /
translated: At the very moment the previous moment ceases, another moment arises that is similar to it.

original: des na rnam pa mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir dang dngos po med pas kyang bar du ma chod pa'i phyir tha dad na yang de kho na 'di'o zhes tha mi dad par lhag par zhen pa'i rtog pa so so skye bo rnams la rab tu skye ste
analyzed: des na rnam pa mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir dang dngos po med pas kyang bar du ma chod pa'i phyir tha dad na yang de kho na 'di'o zhes tha mi dad par lhag par zhen pa'i rtog pa so so skye bo rnams la rab tu skye ste
translated: Since there is no difference in aspect, and since there is no interval of nonexistence, the thought that is the conception of nondifference, ‚ÄúThat very thing is this,‚Äù arises in ordinary beings, even though there is difference.

original: / shin tu tha dad pa bcad nas slar skyes pa'i ku sha dang k'a sha dang skra la sogs pa rnams la yang de kho na'i 'di'o zhes pa'i rtog pa mthong ba nyid de /
analyzed: / shin tu tha dad pa bcad nas slar skyes pa'i ku sha dang k'a sha dang skra la sogs pa rnams la yang de kho na'i 'di'o zhes pa'i rtog pa mthong ba nyid de /
translated: And the thought ‚ÄúThat very thing is this‚Äù arises even in regard to things that are clearly different, such as the blades of grass and the cloth that are produced from the cut grass and cloth, and the hair that is produced from the cut hair.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang ci'i phyir mi srid //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang ci'i phyir mi srid //
translated: Why should it not be possible in this case?

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa'o zhes pa 'di grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa'o zhes pa 'di grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all conditioned things are momentary.

original: khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba 'di yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba 'di yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the application of the reason of nature without distinction.

original: de bzhin du khyad par med pa'i sbyor ba gzhan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par med pa'i sbyor ba gzhan te /
translated: Similarly, there is another application without distinction:

original: gang yod pa de thams cad de mi rtag pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin /
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad de mi rtag pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin /
translated: Whatever exists is all impermanent, like a pot.

original: tshad mas rtogs pa'i dngos po'i 'di thams cad kyang yod pa rnams so //
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs pa'i dngos po'i 'di thams cad kyang yod pa rnams so //
translated: And all these things that are cognized by valid cognition exist.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang rig byed skyes bus byas pa nyid du grub pa'i ched du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang rig byed skyes bus byas pa nyid du grub pa'i ched du rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te /
translated: Similarly, there is another reason of nature for the purpose of establishing that the Veda is the work of a person:

original: gang dang gang dag yin pa de dang de skyes byus byas pa ste dper na shing rta bzhin pa'i skyes bu'i ngag bzhin mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg bya'o zhes pa 'di yag ngag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang dag yin pa de dang de skyes byus byas pa ste dper na shing rta bzhin pa'i skyes bu'i ngag bzhin mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg bya'o zhes pa 'di yag ngag go zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Whatever is a statement is the work of a person, like a chariot, and the statement ‚ÄúOne who desires heaven should offer the Agnihotra‚Äù is a statement.

original: khyad par bcas pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na /
analyzed: khyad par bcas pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na /
translated: The application with distinction is, for example:

original: gang skye ba dang ldan pa de thams cad mi rtag pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang skye ba dang ldan pa de thams cad mi rtag pa ste dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is produced is all impermanent, like a pot.

original: sgra yang skye ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra yang skye ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Sound also possesses arising.

original: ma skyes pa'i rnams las log pa'i dngos po ni skyes par mdzad cing /üîΩgang gi tshe ldog pa de kho na ldog pa gzhan rnam par gcod pas dngos po'i skyes ba zhes tha dad par brjod cing de'i tshe /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i rnams las log pa'i dngos po ni skyes par mdzad cing / gang gi tshe ldog pa de kho na ldog pa gzhan rnam par gcod pas dngos po'i skyes ba zhes tha dad par brjod cing de'i tshe /
translated: The thing that is the opposite of that which has not arisen is made arisen.üîΩWhen it is reversed, it is called the arising of a thing by the exclusion of another reversal.

original: btags pas tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: btags pas tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: At that time, it is a reason of nature that is distinguished by a property that becomes a different nature due to being different by designation.

original: de bzhin du khyad par tha dad pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par tha dad pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: Similarly, the application of a different distinction is:

original: gang byas pa de mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang byas pa de mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is produced is impermanent, like a pot.

original: sgra yang byas so //
analyzed: sgra yang byas so //
translated: Sound is also produced.

original: 'o na ba lang khro bo zhes pa khyad par tha dad pa'i sbyor ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na ba lang khro bo zhes pa khyad par tha dad pa'i sbyor ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't a multicolored cow an application of a different distinction?

original: ji ltar khra bo'i sgra khyad par tha dad pa rjod par byed pa yod pa de bzhin du byas pa'i sgra la khyad par tha dad par rjod par byed cing yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar khra bo'i sgra khyad par tha dad pa rjod par byed pa yod pa de bzhin du byas pa'i sgra la khyad par tha dad par rjod par byed cing yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Just as the word multicolored expresses a different distinction, in the same way, isn't the word produced also an expression of a different distinction?

original: de ji ltar khyad par tha dad pa'i dper brjod pa yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar khyad par tha dad pa'i dper brjod pa yin zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: How is this an example of a different type of distinction?

original: rang gi ngo bo 'grub pa na gzhan gyi bya ba la ltos pa'i dngos po @352b ni byas pa zhes brjod par bya la /üîΩde'i phyir byas pa'i sgra gzhan gyi bya ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin dang kho nas rjod par byed pa ni khyad par tha dad pa kho nar gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'grub pa na gzhan gyi bya ba la ltos pa'i dngos po @352b ni byas pa zhes brjod par bya la / de'i phyir byas pa'i sgra gzhan gyi bya ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin dang kho nas rjod par byed pa ni khyad par tha dad pa kho nar gsungs so //
translated: We reply: When something is established by its own nature, it is called ‚Äúproduced‚Äù in dependence on the activity of another.üîΩTherefore, the word ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is said to express a different type of distinction, namely, that it has a nature that depends on the activity of another.

original: khyad par rab tu sbyar ba'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par rab tu sbyar ba'i rang bzhin gyi sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the word ‚Äúproduced‚Äù to sound is as follows:

original: gang rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i ngang can de byas pa de du ba bzhin //
analyzed: gang rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i ngang can de byas pa de du ba bzhin //
translated: That which has a nature that is different due to the difference of conditions is produced, like smoke.

original: sgra yang rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i ngang can no //
analyzed: sgra yang rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa'i ngang can no //
translated: Sound has a nature that is different due to the difference of conditions.

original: rkyen ni rgyu ste de'i bye brag des tha dad pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de rkyen gyi khyad par gyis tha da pa'i ngang can te /
analyzed: rkyen ni rgyu ste de'i bye brag des tha dad pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de rkyen gyi khyad par gyis tha da pa'i ngang can te /
translated: Conditions are causes. That which has a nature that is different due to the difference of those is different due to the difference of conditions.

original: gang rgyu chen po nyid kyis chen po nyid dang rgyu chung ngu nyid ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang rgyu chen po nyid kyis chen po nyid dang rgyu chung ngu nyid ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúgreat‚Äù and ‚Äúsmall‚Äù is in terms of the cause.

original: rkyen gyi khyad par gyi sgra tha dad pa'i khyad par rjod par byed pa 'dir rab tu sbyar ba nyid kyi phyir 'di ni tha dad pa'i khyad par rab tu sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi khyad par gyi sgra tha dad pa'i khyad par rjod par byed pa 'dir rab tu sbyar ba nyid kyi phyir 'di ni tha dad pa'i khyad par rab tu sbyar ba'o //
translated: This is the application of the distinction of difference, because the sound of the distinction of condition is applied here to express the distinction of difference.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rab tu dbye ba sna tshogs bstan pa yang rnam par rmongs pa log pa'i ched du ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rab tu dbye ba sna tshogs bstan pa yang rnam par rmongs pa log pa'i ched du ste /
translated: The various divisions of natural inference are taught for the purpose of countering the confusion of the ignorant.

original: chos kyi bye brag brtags pas kyang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho nar rab tu sbyar bar bya'o zhes rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bye brag brtags pas kyang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kho nar rab tu sbyar bar bya'o zhes rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du'o //
translated: It is also for the purpose of establishing that even when the specific properties of phenomena are examined, only natural inference should be applied.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na gang dang gang de ma thag tu mi gnas par mi 'gyur ba de dang de 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi rang gi ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na gang dang gang de ma thag tu mi gnas par mi 'gyur ba de dang de 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi rang gi ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: As for the application of natural inference with a dissimilar example, it is like this: Whatever does not immediately cease does not have the nature of destruction,

original: nam mkha' bzhin /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin /
translated: like space.

original: gzugs la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus na yang 'jig pa'i ngang can no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skyes pa'i dus na yang 'jig pa'i ngang can no //
translated: Even when form, etc. are produced, they have the nature of destruction.

original: ldog pa'i sbyor ba la sgrub par byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa la khyab pa med pa nyid kyi phyir sgrub par byed pa yod na nges par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sbyor ba la sgrub par byed pa med pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa la khyab pa med pa nyid kyi phyir sgrub par byed pa yod na nges par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the case of a negative application, since there is no proof, there is no pervasion of the absence of the probandum, and therefore it should be understood that when the proof exists, there is certainty.

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba gzhan yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba gzhan yang ste /
translated: Similarly, there are other applications that have dissimilar properties.

original: gang dang gang na skad cig ma nyid med pa de dang de na yod pa nyid kyang ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang na skad cig ma nyid med pa de dang de na yod pa nyid kyang ste /
translated: Wherever there is no momentariness, there is also no existence.

original: nam mkha'i padma la bzhin sgra yod pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma la bzhin sgra yod pa'o //
translated: Like a sky-lotus, sound exists.

original: de bzhin du gang na'ang mi rtag pa nyid log pa de na skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang na'ang mi rtag pa nyid log pa de na skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyang ste /
translated: Similarly, wherever impermanence is negated, there is also the absence of the property of arising.

original: rus sbal gyi spu la bzhin /
analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu la bzhin /
translated: Like the hair of a tortoise.

original: sgra ni skye ba dang ldan pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sgra ni skye ba dang ldan pa la yang ngo //
translated: Sound has the property of arising.

original: gang du mi rtag pa nyid log pa der byas pa nyid kyang ste /
analyzed: gang du mi rtag pa nyid log pa der byas pa nyid kyang ste /
translated: Wherever impermanence is negated, there is also the absence of being produced.

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin //
translated: Like the horn of a rabbit.

original: sgra ni byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni byas pa yin no //
translated: Sound is produced.

original: gang du byas pa nyid med pa der rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: gang du byas pa nyid med pa der rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa nyid kyang med de /
translated: Where there is no action, there is no difference due to the difference of conditions.

original: nam mkha' la bzhin /
analyzed: nam mkha' la bzhin /
translated: Like space.

original: sgra ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa yang ngo zhes pa'o //üîΩ'bras bu'i gtan @353a * //
analyzed: sgra ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa yang ngo zhes pa'o // 'bras bu'i gtan @353a * //
translated: Sound is different due to the difference of conditions.üîΩThe syllogism of effect is like the following: ‚ÄúWhere there is smoke, there is fire, as in a kitchen; and here there is smoke.üîΩ‚Äù

original: tshigs kyi chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na gang dang gang na du ba yod pa de dang de na me ste /
analyzed: tshigs kyi chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na gang dang gang na du ba yod pa de dang de na me ste /
translated: The syllogism of effect is applied to the proof of the cause when the existence of the causal relation is established by perception and non-apprehension.üîΩThe syllogism of non-apprehension is like the following: ‚ÄúHere there is no pot, because there is no apprehension of a pot, as in the case of a cloth.

original: tshang bang bzhin 'di na yang du ba'o //üîΩ'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa yod na /
analyzed: tshang bang bzhin 'di na yang du ba'o // 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa yod na /
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩThe syllogism of non-apprehension is applied to the proof of the absence of an object when the existence of the object-possessor is established by perception and non-apprehension.üîΩThe syllogism of the property of the object is like the following: ‚ÄúSound is impermanent, because it is produced, like a pot.üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the proof of a property when the existence of the property of the object is established by perception and non-apprehension.üîΩThe syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the proof of the absence of an object when the existence of the object-possessor is established by perception and non-apprehension.

original: rgyu bsgrub par bya ba la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu bsgrub par bya ba la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the proof of the absence of an object when the existence of the object-possessor is established by perception and non-apprehension.üîΩThe syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the proof of the absence of an object when the existence of the object-possessor is established by perception and non-apprehension.üîΩThe syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the proof of the absence of an object when the existence of the object-possessor is established by perception and non-apprehension.üîΩThe syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the proof of the absence of an object when the existence of the object-possessor is established by perception and non-apprehension.üîΩThe syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the proof of the absence of an object when the existence of the object-possessor is established by perception and non-apprehension.

original: chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na /üîΩme med na du bar mi 'gyur te chu klung chen po bzhin 'di na du ba yod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na /üîΩme med na du bar mi 'gyur te chu klung chen po bzhin 'di na du ba yod do zhes pa'o //
translated: The syllogism of the property of the object is applied to the

original: mi dmigs pa'i chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni yan lag can dgag pa'i ched du dper na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni yan lag can dgag pa'i ched du dper na /
translated: For example,

original: gang gang na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar yod pa ma dmigs pa de dang de na yod pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ste /
analyzed: gang gang na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar yod pa ma dmigs pa de dang de na yod pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ste /
translated: wherever there is the non-observation of an object that would be observed if it existed, it is suitable to make the conventional statement that it does not exist there.

original: mi'i mgo la rva bzhin bum pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i snod rnams la pha rol gyis mngon par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: mi'i mgo la rva bzhin bum pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i snod rnams la pha rol gyis mngon par 'dod pa na /
translated: When the opponent asserts that the words of the statement ‚Äúa pot is a basis of the term pot‚Äù refer to a pot,

original: lag can yang 'dir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs so //
analyzed: lag can yang 'dir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs so //
translated: the whole is not observed as an object that would be observed if it existed.

original: mi dmigs pa'i chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba ni dper na /
translated: The syllogism having a property-possessor that is dissimilar to the non-observation of a manifest object is for example,

original: gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par yod pa de dmigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par yod pa de dmigs pa kho na ste /
translated: wherever there is the observation of an object that would be observed if it existed, it is observed.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par mngon sum nyid du mngon par 'dod bzhin phyogs kyi khyad par 'di na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par yod pa'i bum pa dmigs pa med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par mngon sum nyid du mngon par 'dod bzhin phyogs kyi khyad par 'di na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par yod pa'i bum pa dmigs pa med do zhes pa'o //
translated: While you admit that the particularities of blue, etc. are directly perceived, you say that the pot, which is the object of perception of the particularity of place, is not perceived.

original: thams cad du chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag la sgrub byed la khyab par bya zhing /üîΩchos dang mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag la ni sgrub par byed pa med pas bsgrub bya med pa la khyab pa'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag la sgrub byed la khyab par bya zhing / chos dang mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag la ni sgrub par byed pa med pas bsgrub bya med pa la khyab pa'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the case of a proof statement that has a property in common, the probandum is pervaded by the proof.üîΩIn the case of a proof statement that does not have a property in common, the absence of the probandum is pervaded by the absence of the proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa nyid du brjod pa dang bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni khyab pa zhes mngon par rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la nges pa nyid du brjod pa dang bsgrub par bya ba med pa ni sgrub par byed pa med pa la nges par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni khyab pa zhes mngon par rjod par byed pa'o //
