translated: The statement that the proof is ascertained in the probandum and that the absence of the probandum is ascertained in the absence of the proof is called ‚Äúpervasion.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir tshad mas khyab pa grub pa yod na 'di ni gang du yang sgrub par byed pa'i chos can der bsgrub par bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i dgos pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad mas khyab pa grub pa yod na 'di ni gang du yang sgrub par byed pa'i chos can der bsgrub par bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i dgos pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if a pervasion is established by a valid cognition, there is no need for the statement, ‚ÄúWherever the probandum is, the proving property is also there.‚Äù

original: gang du tshad mas thams cad nye bar bsdus pa dang ldan pa'i khyab pa ma grub pa der ni dgos pa 'jug pa mi bzlog te /
analyzed: gang du tshad mas thams cad nye bar bsdus pa dang ldan pa'i khyab pa ma grub pa der ni dgos pa 'jug pa mi bzlog te /
translated: Wherever a pervasion is not established by a valid cognition that includes everything, there the need for the statement is not averted.

original: dper na dbang phyug bsgrub pa na 'bras bu nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na dbang phyug bsgrub pa na 'bras bu nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, in the proof of ƒ™≈õvara, the proving property is ‚Äúbeing an effect.‚Äù

original: de ltar na de rnams kyi sgrub byed nye bar dgod pa /
analyzed: de ltar na de rnams kyi sgrub byed nye bar dgod pa /
translated: Thus, the statement of the proof of those is

original: 'dir thams cad @353b mkhyen pa gzhan bcom ldan 'das yod dam med kyang bla ste /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad @353b mkhyen pa gzhan bcom ldan 'das yod dam med kyang bla ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, whether or not there is another omniscient one, the Lord,

original: slar yang dbang phyug thams cad mkhyen pa ni bsgrub par nus so //
analyzed: slar yang dbang phyug thams cad mkhyen pa ni bsgrub par nus so //
translated: it is possible to prove that ƒ™≈õvara is omniscient.

original: de ltar ni 'khor ba na dngos po 'ga' zhig rnams byed pa po nges pa yod de /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'khor ba na dngos po 'ga' zhig rnams byed pa po nges pa yod de /
translated: In that way, in cyclic existence, some things have a definite agent,

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams bzhin /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams bzhin /
translated: like pots and so on.

original: 'ga' zhig rnams byed pa po nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnams byed pa po nges pa med pa ste /
translated: Some things have no definite agent,üîΩlike lightning and so on.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: like space, etc.

original: slar yang gzhan byed pa po la the tshom za ba rnams te sa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: slar yang gzhan byed pa po la the tshom za ba rnams te sa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Again, there are those who doubt the existence of an agent, like earth, etc.

original: 'di rnams las rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams las rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other kind of entity.üîΩAmong them, those that are born while being seen, such as trees, etc.,

original: de la gang mthong bzhin par skye ba ljon shing la sogs pa rnams dang / gang yang skyes nas ring du lon pa sa gzhi la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang mthong bzhin par skye ba ljon shing la sogs pa rnams dang / gang yang skyes nas ring du lon pa sa gzhi la sogs pa ste /
translated: and those that are born and then remain for a long time, such as the earth, etc.,

original: byed pa po la the tshom za ba nyid du rnam par gnas pa de rnams thams cad ni blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa po sngon ma can rnams te /
analyzed: byed pa po la the tshom za ba nyid du rnam par gnas pa de rnams thams cad ni blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa po sngon ma can rnams te /
translated: all of them have an intelligent agent as their prior cause,

original: 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: because they are effects, like pots, etc.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: This reason is not unestablished.

original: 'bras bu nyid ni thams cad kyi tshad mas grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni thams cad kyi tshad mas grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established by valid cognition that all of them are effects.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te mthun pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te mthun pa la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in similar instances.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it indeterminate, because there is a valid cognition that contradicts the opposite of the probandum.

original: de ltar ni 'bras bu re zhig blo dang ldan pa'i rdza mkhan las nye bar skye bar mang du mthong ba'i rgyu can gyi yid dang mngon sum gyis dmigs shing /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'bras bu re zhig blo dang ldan pa'i rdza mkhan las nye bar skye bar mang du mthong ba'i rgyu can gyi yid dang mngon sum gyis dmigs shing /
translated: In this way, the effect is observed to arise from the intelligent potter, and is perceived by the mind and direct perception that is based on that observation.

original: de gal te blo med par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: de gal te blo med par yang 'gyur na /
translated: If it were to arise even without intelligence,

original: da ni blo dang ldan pa'i skabs las nam gyi tshe yang skye bar mi 'gyur zhing rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang 'bras bu skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni blo dang ldan pa'i skabs las nam gyi tshe yang skye bar mi 'gyur zhing rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang 'bras bu skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would never arise from the occasion of an intelligent [potter], and it would be illogical for an effect to arise even once from a non-cause.

original: de'i phyir nam gyi tshe yang 'bras bur yang 'gyur zhing blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di dgos par mi bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam gyi tshe yang 'bras bur yang 'gyur zhing blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di dgos par mi bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not necessary to say that it would never be an effect, and that it would not be based on an intelligent [cause].

original: 'dir 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be stated:

original: sgrub par byed pa ni nges pa thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa gang zag gi khyab par thams cad nye bar sdud pa'i tshad mas grub na bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do zhes pa rgol ba thams cad kyis 'dod pa
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni nges pa thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa gang zag gi khyab par thams cad nye bar sdud pa'i tshad mas grub na bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do zhes pa rgol ba thams cad kyis 'dod pa
translated: The proof is that all disputants accept that when a valid cognition establishes that the probandum and the proof are pervasives of the person, then the probandum is understood.

original: yin zhing / 'dir gal te snang rung gi lus khyad par blo dang ldan pas khyab par gzung bar bya na ni de'i tshe de ltar gyur ba'i bsgrub par bya ba med par yang skye bzhin pa rtsva la sogs pa la 'bras bu nyid mthong ba'i phyir gzhal bya nyid la
analyzed: yin zhing / 'dir gal te snang rung gi lus khyad par blo dang ldan pas khyab par gzung bar bya na ni de'i tshe de ltar gyur ba'i bsgrub par bya ba med par yang skye bzhin pa rtsva la sogs pa la 'bras bu nyid mthong ba'i phyir gzhal bya nyid la
translated: Here, if one were to apprehend the body that is suitable to appear as necessarily being endowed with intelligence, then at that time, even in the absence of the probandum that is so, since the effect is seen in the arising grass and so on, the reason would be inconclusive, like the reason ‚Äúbeing an object of cognition‚Äù and so on.

original: sogs pa ltar gtan tshigs 'di thun mong @354a * //üîΩgi ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa ltar gtan tshigs 'di thun mong @354a * // gi ma nges pa'o //
translated: This is a common reason.

original: rtsva la sogs pa rnams phyogs su byas pa'o zhes kyang smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa rnams phyogs su byas pa'o zhes kyang smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not say that the grass and so on are the subject.

original: 'khrul ba'i yul kho na phyogs su 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i yul kho na phyogs su 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable for the mere object of error to be the subject.

original: the tshom za la rtags brjod phyir //
analyzed: the tshom za la rtags brjod phyir //
translated: Because the reason is stated for one who doubts,

original: bsal ba gtan tshigs brten ma yin //
analyzed: bsal ba gtan tshigs brten ma yin //
translated: The exclusion is not based on a reason.

original: zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: ci ste skyed par mi nus pa na yang /
analyzed: ci ste skyed par mi nus pa na yang /
translated: If it is not able to generate,

original: la la me med par yang du ba mthong ba'i phyir te de ltar du ba yang 'khrul par smra bar bla ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: la la me med par yang du ba mthong ba'i phyir te de ltar du ba yang 'khrul par smra bar bla ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: then it is because sometimes smoke is seen without fire. In that case, it is just foolish to claim that smoke is also mistaken.

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: bskyed par mi nus pa nyid du la la me lta bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par mi nus pa nyid du la la me lta bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not able to generate, it is not able to see fire.

original: de la ni the tshom gyi yul nyid rigs so //
analyzed: de la ni the tshom gyi yul nyid rigs so //
translated: In that case, it is reasonable to have doubt.

original: skabs su bab pa la ni bltar rung ba'i chos khyad par ba blo dang ldan pas khyab par gzung byar bya na ni snang rung mi dmigs pas blo dang ldan pa la gnod par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la ni bltar rung ba'i chos khyad par ba blo dang ldan pas khyab par gzung byar bya na ni snang rung mi dmigs pas blo dang ldan pa la gnod par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: In the present context, if a special visible phenomenon is to be apprehended as pervaded by the intelligent, then the non-observation of the perceptible would contradict the intelligent.

original: 'on te bltar mi rung ba'i lus blo dang ldan pa tsam gyis khyab pa rtogs par bya na /
analyzed: 'on te bltar mi rung ba'i lus blo dang ldan pa tsam gyis khyab pa rtogs par bya na /
translated: But if the body, which is not perceptible, is to be understood as pervaded by mere intelligence,üîΩthen it is not reasonable to have doubt.

original: de'i tshe bltar mi rung ba blo dang ldan pa tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i snang rung mi dmigs pas ldog pa ma grub ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe bltar mi rung ba blo dang ldan pa tsam gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i snang rung mi dmigs pas ldog pa ma grub ste /
translated: At that time, the non-establishment of the contrapositive is due to the non-observation of the suitable to appear, which is to be established by the mere intelligent one who is not suitable to be seen.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni mi mthun phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni mi mthun phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'o //
translated: This reason is doubtful with regard to the contrapositive of the discordant side.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa ma grub pa nyid kyis na khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa med pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa ma grub pa nyid kyis na khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-establishment of the non-existence of the proof that does not have the probandum, there is no pervasion.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'bras bu nyid ni mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa bsal ba'i ched du dbang po las 'das pa byed pa po yang dag par 'byung ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa bsal ba'i ched du dbang po las 'das pa byed pa po yang dag par 'byung ba'o zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is for the purpose of eliminating engagement with the discordant side, the arising of the transcendent agent.‚Äù

original: ldog pa grub pa ma tshang ba'i khyab pa ji ltar grub /
analyzed: ldog pa grub pa ma tshang ba'i khyab pa ji ltar grub /
translated: How is the incomplete pervasion of the established contrapositive established?

original: ci ste ldog pa 'grub pa'i yid kyis bltar mi rung ba'i byed pa po brten par bya ba yin no /
analyzed: ci ste ldog pa 'grub pa'i yid kyis bltar mi rung ba'i byed pa po brten par bya ba yin no /
translated: If the agent who is not suitable to be seen by the mind that establishes the contrapositive is the dependent one,

original: de dang ldan pa la yang de'i rtsva la sogs pa'i zhes pa bsal bar mi mthun phyogs la mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa la yang de'i rtsva la sogs pa'i zhes pa bsal bar mi mthun phyogs la mthong ba'o //
translated: The opposite is seen.

original: gang yang mig gsum pas brjod pa /üîΩji ltar bu ba la sogs pa rnams me la sogs pa rnams dang / lhan cig rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba de ltar 'bras bu nyid blo dang ldan pa dang lhan cig ste /
analyzed: gang yang mig gsum pas brjod pa / ji ltar bu ba la sogs pa rnams me la sogs pa rnams dang / lhan cig rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba de ltar 'bras bu nyid blo dang ldan pa dang lhan cig ste /
translated: Also, the one with three eyes says:üîΩJust as smoke, etc. are related by intrinsic nature with fire, etc.,

original: de'i rdzas dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de'i rdzas dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: so is the effect with the intelligent one, because its substance is not an object of perception.

original: gang du yang 'khrul ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gang du yang 'khrul ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because error is not seen anywhere.

original: de mi rigs te gang gi phyir don gzhan la ltos par bya ba cung zad cig rdzas kyi sgras brjod na /
analyzed: de mi rigs te gang gi phyir don gzhan la ltos par bya ba cung zad cig rdzas kyi sgras brjod na /
translated: That is not correct, because when something that depends on another object is expressed by the word substance,

original: don gzhan pa yang bltar rung bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: don gzhan pa yang bltar rung bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhing /
translated: it is not necessarily the case that the other object is visible.

original: bltar @354b mi rung ba ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin bskal bar yang dag par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bltar @354b mi rung ba ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin bskal bar yang dag par 'byung ngo //
translated: And the invisible occurs in place, time, and nature even after a long time.

original: de'i phyir du ba me dang lhan cig 'brel bar 'gyur bar rdzas nye bar dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba me dang lhan cig 'brel bar 'gyur bar rdzas nye bar dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes pas /
translated: Therefore, the substance of smoke is not observed to be related to fire.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis med pa kho na'o zhes brjod par bya ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis med pa kho na'o zhes brjod par bya ba ji ltar yin /
translated: How can it be said that it is nonexistent merely because it is not seen?

original: gang yang 'khrul ba ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes brjod pa'i sgrub byed de yang the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'khrul ba ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes brjod pa'i sgrub byed de yang the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa ste /
translated: The proof that you have stated, ‚Äúbecause error is not seen,‚Äù is also unestablished because of doubt.

original: rkyen gzhan ma tshang bas de'i 'khrul ba ma mthong na yang thams cad du dgag par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan ma tshang bas de'i 'khrul ba ma mthong na yang thams cad du dgag par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Even though its error is not seen due to the incompleteness of other conditions, it cannot be refuted in all cases.

original: 'di tsam gyis tshad ma can gyi 'jig rten gyi lugs las 'das pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis tshad ma can gyi 'jig rten gyi lugs las 'das pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This much does not go beyond the worldly way of those who have valid knowledge,

original: tshad ma pa rnams kho nas sgrub byed dang gnod byed kyi tshad ma med pa na the tshom byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma pa rnams kho nas sgrub byed dang gnod byed kyi tshad ma med pa na the tshom byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only those who have valid knowledge doubt when there is no valid knowledge that proves or refutes.

original: de ltar the tshom za bas na thams cad la mi 'jug par thal ba la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar the tshom za bas na thams cad la mi 'jug par thal ba la yang ma yin te /
translated: Since there is doubt in that way, it is not the case that it follows that one does not engage in anything at all.

original: tshad ma las dang don la the tshom za ba las kyang rab tu 'jug pa nye bar 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma las dang don la the tshom za ba las kyang rab tu 'jug pa nye bar 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is quite tenable that one engages in action on the basis of doubt about the validity of the object and the means of knowledge.

original: gang yang brjod pa ji ltar gzhan nyid du khyad par med na yang sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi dngos po 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bur 'gyur zhing 'ga' zhig kho na ni rgyur te /
analyzed: gang yang brjod pa ji ltar gzhan nyid du khyad par med na yang sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi dngos po 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bur 'gyur zhing 'ga' zhig kho na ni rgyur te /
translated: And as for what you said, ‚ÄúIf there is no difference in terms of otherness, then for Buddhists, some things would be effects and some would be causes,

original: thams cad ma yin pa de ltar kho bo'i yang gzhan nyid du khyad par med na yang du ba la sogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig kho na rang bzhin pa'i 'brel bas 'brel la thams cad ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: thams cad ma yin pa de ltar kho bo'i yang gzhan nyid du khyad par med na yang du ba la sogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig kho na rang bzhin pa'i 'brel bas 'brel la thams cad ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: but not all, and likewise for me, even though there is no difference in terms of otherness, some things, such as smoke, would be related by intrinsic nature, but not all,‚Äù

original: de mi rigs te /
analyzed: de mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: ji ltar du ba zhes pa'i dngos po me la rag lus pa zhes par tshad mas grub pa de ltar gang gis 'di skad brjod par bya ba rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba yang ci tshad mas grub bam /
analyzed: ji ltar du ba zhes pa'i dngos po me la rag lus pa zhes par tshad mas grub pa de ltar gang gis 'di skad brjod par bya ba rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba yang ci tshad mas grub bam /
translated: Just as the thing called ‚Äúsmoke‚Äù is established by valid knowledge to be dependent on fire, in the same way, by what means is this so-called intrinsic relation established?

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba zhes pa'i don ci zhig / ci rang las gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba zhes pa'i don ci zhig / ci rang las gyur pa'am /
translated: Is it that it arises from itself, orüîΩthat it is causeless?

original: rgyu med pa can zhig ces pa rnam par brtag pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can zhig ces pa rnam par brtag pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three alternatives.

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the case that it arises from itself,

original: rang nyid bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for an action to be done on itself.

original: gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Second, it is not the case that it is causeless,

original: de las byung ba'i 'brel ba khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'brel ba khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that it would be accepted that it arises from that.

original: 'on te rgyu med pa yin na de'i tshe yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med pa yin na de'i tshe yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa med pa'i phyir na /
translated: But if it is causeless, then because there is no restriction of place, time, and nature,

original: rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba smra ba ni shin tu yang mi rigs so //üîΩgzhan yang chos mthun pa dpe tsam yod do zhes pas khyab @355a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin pa'i 'brel ba smra ba ni shin tu yang mi rigs so // gzhan yang chos mthun pa dpe tsam yod do zhes pas khyab @355a * //
translated: it is completely unreasonable to speak of a natural relation.

original: pa grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that pervasion is established by saying that there is just an example that has a similar property.

original: ci dgar yang 'dus pa'i rnga mo phru gu dang bong bu dag gi yang de lta bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci dgar yang 'dus pa'i rnga mo phru gu dang bong bu dag gi yang de lta bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that even a camel and an ass that are assembled together would have such a nature.

original: de'i phyir nges par mthong ba zhes pa ni bzung zin pa brjod pa'i 'brel ba sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dran par byed pa'i sgo nyid nas gtan tshigs la nye bar mkho'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par mthong ba zhes pa ni bzung zin pa brjod pa'i 'brel ba sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dran par byed pa'i sgo nyid nas gtan tshigs la nye bar mkho'i //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbecause of definitely seeing‚Äù is a memory of the valid knowledge that establishes the relation that expresses what has been apprehended. It is only through the door of that memory that the reason is useful.

original: rang nyid nye ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no /
analyzed: rang nyid nye ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no /
translated: It is not just by its own proximity.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: In that case,

original: re zhig nam mkha' la bsgrub par bya ba med pas sgrub par byed pa med pa rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig nam mkha' la bsgrub par bya ba med pas sgrub par byed pa med pa rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: first, because the object of affirmation does not exist in space, the absence of the means of affirmation is not understood.

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha' la ji ltar blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu ldog pa de ltar sems pa med pa'i rgyu yang ldog pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha' la ji ltar blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu ldog pa de ltar sems pa med pa'i rgyu yang ldog pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Because just as the cause of the cognition of space is eliminated, the cause of the cognition of the absence of mind is also eliminated.

original: de'i phyir na gang gis bsgrub par bya ba med pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa'i ldog pa'i 'grub par 'gyur ba ci zhig gis med pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir na gang gis bsgrub par bya ba med pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa'i ldog pa'i 'grub par 'gyur ba ci zhig gis med pa dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, by what is the absence of the means of affirmation that possesses the absence of the object of affirmation established? By what is the absence that possesses the absence of the effect understood?

original: bum pa la 'bras bu nyid blo dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba las /
analyzed: bum pa la 'bras bu nyid blo dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba las /
translated: But you do not see that a pot is the effect of intelligence.

original: nam mkha' la yang blo dang ldan pa med pa kho na las 'bras bu nyid med par smra ba'i rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang blo dang ldan pa med pa kho na las 'bras bu nyid med par smra ba'i rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not right to say that space is not an effect simply because it is not intelligent.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis de'i bdag nyid dam //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis de'i bdag nyid dam //
translated: Because, if they were, then the relation of identity,

original: de las byung ba'am gzhan rang bzhin na la sogs pa'i 'brel pa sngar tshad mas grub pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de las byung ba'am gzhan rang bzhin na la sogs pa'i 'brel pa sngar tshad mas grub pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod do //
translated: causality, or inherence would have been established by a valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: Moreover, mere non-observation does not establish a negative.

original: de ltar ni mi mthun phyogs la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa zhes pa 'di de dmigs par byed pa'i tshad ma ldog pa brjod cing /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi mthun phyogs la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa zhes pa 'di de dmigs par byed pa'i tshad ma ldog pa brjod cing /
translated: In this way, the so-called non-observation of a reason in the discordant class is said to be the preclusion of a valid cognition that would observe it.

original: tshad ma yang zhal bya'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: tshad ma yang zhal bya'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: And a valid cognition is the effect of the object of cognition.

original: rgyu ma yin pa yul ma yin no zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa yul ma yin no zhes pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: It is not the case that it is not the object of a non-cause.

original: rgyu ldog pa na 'bras bu ldog par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ldog pa na 'bras bu ldog par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not right that when the cause is precluded, the effect is precluded.

original: du ba med par yang me dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba med par yang me dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because fire is perceived even without smoke.

original: gal te yang tshad ma yod pa nyid kyis gzhal bya yod pa nyid la khyab par gyur na de'i tshe 'di rigs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang tshad ma yod pa nyid kyis gzhal bya yod pa nyid la khyab par gyur na de'i tshe 'di rigs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: If the existence of the object of valid knowledge were pervaded by the existence of valid knowledge, then this would be logical.

original: khyab pa 'di nyid mi srid pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: khyab pa 'di nyid mi srid pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: But this pervasion is impossible,

original: thams cad ni thams cad mthong ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni thams cad mthong ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would perceive everything.

original: de'i phyir ma mthong ba ji tsam gyis ldog pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma mthong ba ji tsam gyis ldog pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nonperception does not establish a negative pervasion.

original: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: thams cad kyis ma mthong bar yang the tshom za zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyis ma mthong bar yang the tshom za zhing /
translated: Even when all do not see, there is doubt.

original: rang gis ma mthong ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: rang gis ma mthong ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Not seeing something oneself is mistaken,

original: sbyang gi nang du son pa'i sa bon yang yod pa @355b nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: sbyang gi nang du son pa'i sa bon yang yod pa @355b nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: because one sees the seed that is inside the sprout.

original: gang yang ngag gi bdag pos smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang ngag gi bdag pos smras pa /
translated: Also, the master of speech said:

original: khyad par dran pa la ltos pa kho na the tshom du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: khyad par dran pa la ltos pa kho na the tshom du 'gyur zhing /
translated: Doubt occurs only in dependence on remembering a distinction.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba kho na ltar dgos pa 'byung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba kho na ltar dgos pa 'byung ngo zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, the need is just as it is seen.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: rigs pa 'di ni thams cad pa ma yin mod //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di ni thams cad pa ma yin mod //
translated: This reasoning is not universal.

original: de lta na yang khas blangs nas kyang smra ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang khas blangs nas kyang smra ste /
translated: Even so, we speak having accepted it.

original: de ltar ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba bral ba nyid kyi thun mong ba'i chos kyis /
analyzed: de ltar ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba bral ba nyid kyi thun mong ba'i chos kyis /
translated: In this way, the common property of being devoid of the relation of identity and origination

original: gzhal bya nyid dang du ba nyid dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa rnams /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid dang du ba nyid dang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa rnams /
translated: of the object of knowledge, smoke, effect, etc.,

original: khyod kyi lugs kyi rigs pa mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyi rigs pa mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: is not in accord with your system.

original: de la gzhal bya nyid las 'khrul ba mthong ba kho na gzhan du yang dgos pa nye bar 'jug go zhes 'di ni ji ltar mthong ba nyid dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzhal bya nyid las 'khrul ba mthong ba kho na gzhan du yang dgos pa nye bar 'jug go zhes 'di ni ji ltar mthong ba nyid dgos pa'o //
translated: There, the need is just as it is seen, that is, the error from the object of knowledge is seen just in another case.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid ces pa'i rtags kyis skyon de bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid ces pa'i rtags kyis skyon de bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Therefore, the difficulty of countering the reason ‚Äúbecause of doubt about the opposite‚Äù is difficult to overcome.

original: 'di yang skyon yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di yang skyon yod pa kho na'o //
translated: This also has the same difficulty.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid kyis brjod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid kyis brjod pa /
translated: Therefore, this very [passage] is stated:

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fault of the reason.

original: de'i phyir lan gdab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lan gdab par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be answered.

original: 'di nye bar dgod pa yang skyon ma yin pa rjod pa zhes pa tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di nye bar dgod pa yang skyon ma yin pa rjod pa zhes pa tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin no zhe'o //
translated: This is also stated to be a faultless response. This is the locus of defeat called 'stating what is not a fault.'

original: de lta na rang gi 'dod pa kho nas rgol ba 'dis rjes su sbyar bar bya ba ma yin pa rjes su sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can tshar gcad pa'i gnas kyis bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la gnod pa'o zhes pa btang snyoms su bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na rang gi 'dod pa kho nas rgol ba 'dis rjes su sbyar bar bya ba ma yin pa rjes su sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can tshar gcad pa'i gnas kyis bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la gnod pa'o zhes pa btang snyoms su bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, by his own assertion alone, the debater is engaged in what is not to be engaged in. The characteristic of this is the locus of defeat called 'self-refutation.' This should be disregarded.

original: 'di ni lha rnams dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lha rnams dga' ba'o //
translated: This is delightful to the gods.

original: 'o na bltar rung ba'i me dang du ba spyi dag gi bzhin du bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid kho na'i 'bras bu dang rgyu spyi dag nyid kyi khyab pa mngon sum gyis ni dmigs pa las yin na de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems rjes su dpag pa nyams te
analyzed: 'o na bltar rung ba'i me dang du ba spyi dag gi bzhin du bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid kho na'i 'bras bu dang rgyu spyi dag nyid kyi khyab pa mngon sum gyis ni dmigs pa las yin na de'i tshe gzhan gyi sems rjes su dpag pa nyams te
translated: Now, just as the universals of visible fire and smoke are pervaded by the universals of visible effect and cause, respectively, and are apprehended by perception, then at that time the inference of another's mind would be impaired.

original: / gzhan gyi sems ni bltar mi rung ba nyid kyis khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na nang du 'dus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: / gzhan gyi sems ni bltar mi rung ba nyid kyis khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na nang du 'dus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: gang gi phyir rang rig pa ni der khyab pa 'dzin pa po ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang rig pa ni der khyab pa 'dzin pa po ste /
translated: self-awareness is the apprehender of the pervasion there.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud du son pa'i rang rig pa tsam la ltos pas na /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud du son pa'i rang rig pa tsam la ltos pas na /
translated: Since it depends on mere self-awareness that is present in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continua,

original: gzhan gyi sems kyang bltar rung ba tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyang bltar rung ba tsam nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: the other mind is also merely suitable to be seen.

original: yang na bltar rung ba'i lus dang / dbyer med par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi sems kyang bltar rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang na bltar rung ba'i lus dang / dbyer med par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi sems kyang bltar rung ba nyid do //
translated: Or, the other mind is also suitable to be seen because it is engaged inseparably with a body that is suitable to be seen.

original: de ltar tha snyad byed pa ni gang gis 'di yang bltar rung bar @356a * //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad byed pa ni gang gis 'di yang bltar rung bar @356a * //
translated: In that case, it is not reasonable to say that this is also suitable to be seen,

original: 'gyur ba dbang po'i mngon sum tsam gyi blo de ldan pa tsam mam /
analyzed: 'gyur ba dbang po'i mngon sum tsam gyi blo de ldan pa tsam mam /
translated: because it is merely the cognition of mere sense direct perception,

original: dz'a thar tsi tra la sogs pa thun mong ba'i me tsam spyod yul du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dz'a thar tsi tra la sogs pa thun mong ba'i me tsam spyod yul du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: or because it is merely the object field of the common fire of jƒÅ·π≠haracitrakara, and so on.

original: de'i phyir bltar rung pa kho na'i mes du ba la khyab pa grub po zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bltar rung pa kho na'i mes du ba la khyab pa grub po zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that the fire that is visible pervades the smoke that is visible.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la thun mong ba bltar mi rung ba'i sems tsam gyis mngon sum gyis bltar rung ba g-yo ba la sogs pa la khyab pa 'dzin pa mi byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la thun mong ba bltar mi rung ba'i sems tsam gyis mngon sum gyis bltar rung ba g-yo ba la sogs pa la khyab pa 'dzin pa mi byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: But it is not correct to say that the mere mind, which is not visible in the common experience of self and others, can be perceived by direct perception and can be said to pervade the visible movements, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi don gnas pa la ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gnas pa la ni /
translated: The external object is present.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud thun mong pa'i sems tsam ni rang gi ngo bos bltar mi rung ba nyid na yang /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud thun mong pa'i sems tsam ni rang gi ngo bos bltar mi rung ba nyid na yang /
translated: The mere mind, which is common to the experience of self and others, is not visible by its nature.

original: bltar rung ba'i lus dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig pas 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i lus dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig pas 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is related to the visible body by being in the same collection.

original: rnam par dbyer med par 'jug pa'i rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud thun mong ba'i sems tsam ni g-yo ba la sogs pa'i khyad par byed pa rtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par dbyer med par 'jug pa'i rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud thun mong ba'i sems tsam ni g-yo ba la sogs pa'i khyad par byed pa rtogs so //
translated: The mere mind, which is common to the experience of self and others and is not differentiated from them, is perceived as the cause of the differences of movement, etc.

original: de ltar bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dam bltar rung ba dang rnam par dbye ba med par 'jug pa'i dngos po gnyis ni tha snyad pa'i shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum las grub pa dang khyab pa 'dzin pa yang ste /
analyzed: de ltar bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dam bltar rung ba dang rnam par dbye ba med par 'jug pa'i dngos po gnyis ni tha snyad pa'i shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum las grub pa dang khyab pa 'dzin pa yang ste /
translated: Thus, the two things, the nature of which is suitable to be seen, or which are inseparable from what is suitable to be seen, are established by a very clear conventional direct perception, and also apprehend the pervasion.

original: de lta bu nyid med par ma byas pa dang ldan pa mi rung ba dang thun mong ba'i sems tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa rgyud gzhan rjes su dpag par rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid med par ma byas pa dang ldan pa mi rung ba dang thun mong ba'i sems tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes pa rgyud gzhan rjes su dpag par rigs so //
translated: But it is not suitable to be endowed with that which is not suchness, and it is not by a mere mind that is shared with those who have not eliminated that. Thus, it is correct to infer other continuums.

original: de'i phyir gal te mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis khyab pa 'dzin pa de'i tshe bltar rung ba kho nas bltar rung ba la'o zhes pa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis khyab pa 'dzin pa de'i tshe bltar rung ba kho nas bltar rung ba la'o zhes pa rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if direct perception and non-observation apprehend the pervasion, then it is correct to say that it is only what is suitable to be seen that is suitable to be seen.

original: gzhan yang gal te blo dang ldan pa tsam sngon ma can 'di yis bsgrub par bya ba de'i tshe grub pa la bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub byed kyi skyon no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te blo dang ldan pa tsam sngon ma can 'di yis bsgrub par bya ba de'i tshe grub pa la bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub byed kyi skyon no //
translated: Moreover, if this mere possession of intelligence is the probandum, then it is the fault of the proof that the probandum is established.

original: 'on te gcig pu rtag pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i blo dang ldan pa sngon ma can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe 'di lta bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par byas pa'i bsgrub
analyzed: 'on te gcig pu rtag pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i blo dang ldan pa sngon ma can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe 'di lta bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par byas pa'i bsgrub
translated: If you are proving that the omniscient one is a being who possesses a mind that is qualified by such features as being singular, permanent, and so on, then you are proving that he is a being who possesses a mind that is qualified by such features as being singular, permanent, and so on.üîΩ

original: par bya ba dang lhan cig sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni dpe'i chos can la tshad mas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: par bya ba dang lhan cig sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni dpe'i chos can la tshad mas khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: But if the probandum is a person who possesses a mind that is qualified by such features as being omniscient, permanent, and singular, then at that time, the effect that is the proof of that probandum, which is qualified by such features, is not established by valid knowledge in the example subject. Therefore it is not ascertained.

original: ci ste spyi yis khyab pa bzung nas khyad par phyogs chos kyi stobs las grub par brjod do zhe na /üîΩde ni mi rigs te bsgrub par bya bar gtogs pa'i khyad par gang med na /
analyzed: ci ste spyi yis khyab pa bzung nas khyad par phyogs chos kyi stobs las grub par brjod do zhe na / de ni mi rigs te bsgrub par bya bar gtogs pa'i khyad par gang med na /
translated: If you say that having ascertained the pervasion by the general, the property of the subject is established by the power of the reason,

original: gtan tshigs @356b chos can la 'jug pa 'thad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par de phyogs chos kyi stobs las grub pa rigs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs @356b chos can la 'jug pa 'thad pa ma yin pa'i khyad par de phyogs chos kyi stobs las grub pa rigs te /
translated: that is illogical. It is logical that the property of the subject is established by the power of the reason when the reason is not tenable in the subject without the feature that is part of the probandum.

original: dper na du ba la la'i phyogs su 'jug pa nyid kyi me bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba la la'i phyogs su 'jug pa nyid kyi me bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like fire, which is engaged in the direction of smoke.üîΩ

original: rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, fire is inferred from smoke in a mountain pass, but not from the particularities of the smoke, such as its arising from grass.

original: rtsva las byung ba nyid med par yang shing gi lo ma las phyung ba nyid las du ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva las byung ba nyid med par yang shing gi lo ma las phyung ba nyid las du ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For one sees smoke arising from leaves of trees even when there is no grass.

original: de dang 'dra bar blo dang ldan pa yang lus la sogs pa la 'jug pa nyid du gal te grub na grub mod /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar blo dang ldan pa yang lus la sogs pa la 'jug pa nyid du gal te grub na grub mod /
translated: In the same way, if the existence of the omniscient one were established by the mere fact of his engaging in the body, etc., it would be established.

original: shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not established by that, because omniscience is very different from that,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid la yang 'bras bu nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid la yang 'bras bu nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the effect is possible even in the absence of omniscience.

original: nye bar len pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa nyid las kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa nyid las kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is omniscience established from the mere fact of his having the superknowledges of magical power, etc.,

original: gcig nyid grub pa na ni 'di 'grub na /
analyzed: gcig nyid grub pa na ni 'di 'grub na /
translated: because if it were established by the establishment of one of them,üîΩthen that one would be established,

original: gcig nyid 'grub pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid 'grub pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: but that is not established.

original: byed pa po dum sngon ma can nyid la yang 'bras bu nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dum sngon ma can nyid la yang 'bras bu nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the effect would be in the prior non-existence of the agent.

original: dper na grog ma du mas bsgrubs pa'i brgya byin gyi spyi bo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grog ma du mas bsgrubs pa'i brgya byin gyi spyi bo bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the head of Indra, which is produced by many ants.

original: ci ste brgya byin gyi spyi bo yang dbang phyug sngon ma can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe bum pa yang dbang phyug sngon ma can nyid du bsgrub pa na dpe med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ste brgya byin gyi spyi bo yang dbang phyug sngon ma can nyid du bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe bum pa yang dbang phyug sngon ma can nyid du bsgrub pa na dpe med pa nyid do //
translated: But if the head of Indra is to be established as having a prior non-existence of Indra, then when a pot is established as having a prior non-existence of Indra, there is no example.

original: 'o na rdza mkhan byed pa po nyid la ji ltar bsnyon zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rdza mkhan byed pa po nyid la ji ltar bsnyon zhe na /
translated: Well, how do you deny that the potter is the agent?

original: grog sbur la sogs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: grog sbur la sogs pa rnams kyang /
translated: Because even ants, etc.,

original: rgyu nyid du mthong ba de yang ji ltar bzlog / mang po rnams byed pa la the tshom srid par mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du mthong ba de yang ji ltar bzlog / mang po rnams byed pa la the tshom srid par mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa yang ma yin no //
translated: are seen as causes. And it is not that the potter is the cause, because it is seen that many are possible in the production.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag thams cad nye bar bsdu ba dang ldan pa'i khyab pa dpe'i chos can la tshad mas gdon mi za bar bstan par bya'o zhes pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag thams cad nye bar bsdu ba dang ldan pa'i khyab pa dpe'i chos can la tshad mas gdon mi za bar bstan par bya'o zhes pa gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the probandum and the probans must be taught by means of a valid cognition in the example-phenomena, which are endowed with the pervasion that includes all the instances.

original: gzhan yang rtag pa gcig pu'i thams cad mkhyen pa blo dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag pa gcig pu'i thams cad mkhyen pa blo dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the omniscience of a permanent, unitary [consciousness] is to be established,

original: 'di ni 'gal ba yang ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba yang ste /
translated: this is contradictory.

original: mi rtag pa gcig pu ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i blo dang ldan pas khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa gcig pu ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i blo dang ldan pas khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the omniscience of a non-permanent, non-unitary [consciousness] is pervaded by the possession of a mind.

original: de ltar ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa las 'dir 'gal bar brjod la /
analyzed: de ltar ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa las 'dir 'gal bar brjod la /
translated: In this way, the contradiction is stated here from the opposite of the probandum.

original: 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa sgrub par byed do zhes pa skabs kyis 'ongs pa dbang phyug sun dbyung ba brjod pa'i 'bad pa ni re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di yang bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa sgrub par byed do zhes pa skabs kyis 'ongs pa dbang phyug sun dbyung ba brjod pa'i 'bad pa ni re zhig gzhag go //
translated: And this also proves the opposite of the probandum. The effort to state the refutation of ƒ™≈õvara, which is relevant to this context, should be set aside for the time being.

original: 'o na chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag la rjes 'gro kho @357a * //üîΩna brjod kyi ldog pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'o na chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag la rjes 'gro kho @357a * // na brjod kyi ldog pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Well, in the case of a proof statement that has a similar instance, the pervasion is stated, but the contrapositive is not.

original: chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa yang ldog pa kho na ste rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa yang ldog pa kho na ste rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no /
translated: In the case of a proof statement that has a dissimilar instance, the contrapositive is stated, but the pervasion is not.

original: des na ji ltar na 'di dag gis tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjod par byed ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar na 'di dag gis tshul gsum pa'i rtags rjod par byed ces bya zhe na /
translated: So how do these statements express a reason that has the three modes?‚Äù

original: 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon ma yin te /
translated: This is not a problem.

original: gang gi phyir chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag nye bar bkod pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub byed kyi ngag nye bar bkod pa na /
translated: This is because when a proof statement that has a similar instance is stated,

original: shugs nyid las ldog pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: shugs nyid las ldog pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: the contrapositive is understood by implication.

original: ldog pa ma bzung na bsgrub par bya ba med pa yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes phyin ci log pa srid par 'gyur zhing de lta na yang rjes su 'gro ba nyid med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldog pa ma bzung na bsgrub par bya ba med pa yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes phyin ci log pa srid par 'gyur zhing de lta na yang rjes su 'gro ba nyid med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the contrapositive were not stated, it would be possible to misunderstand the statement, thinking that if the reason is absent, the property to be proven is also absent. If that were the case, then there would be no pervasion,

original: sgrub par byed pa yod na yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa shugs so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yod na yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa shugs so //
translated: because even if the reason is present, the property to be proven would be absent. This is the implication.

original: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i ngag nye bar bkod pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i ngag nye bar bkod pa na /
translated: Likewise, when a statement that is a proof that possesses a dissimilar property is set forth,

original: shugs nyid las rjes 'gro rtogs te /üîΩrjes 'gro ma bzung na ni sgrub byed 'gyur zhing bsgrub bya ni mi 'gyur ro zhes phyin ci log pa srid par 'gyur la /üîΩde lta na ldog pa nyid mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shugs nyid las rjes 'gro rtogs te / rjes 'gro ma bzung na ni sgrub byed 'gyur zhing bsgrub bya ni mi 'gyur ro zhes phyin ci log pa srid par 'gyur la / de lta na ldog pa nyid mi 'gyur te /
translated: the pervasion is understood by implication.üîΩIf the pervasion is not grasped, then the probandum would become the proof and the probandum would not be established. Thus, the opposite would be possible.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la yang sgrub par byed pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa shugs so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la yang sgrub par byed pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa shugs so //
translated: If that were the case, there would be no contrapositive because even when the probandum is absent, the proof would still exist.üîΩThus, both types of syllogism are statements of a reason that has the three modes.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba gnyis ka dag kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags bsal bar byed pa'o zhes pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba gnyis ka dag kyang tshul gsum pa'i rtags bsal bar byed pa'o zhes pas skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gi khyab pa gang du tshad ma gang gis gzung bar bya ba de gnyi ga bde blag tu rtogs pa'i don du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gi khyab pa gang du tshad ma gang gis gzung bar bya ba de gnyi ga bde blag tu rtogs pa'i don du brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be stated for the sake of easily understanding both the pervasion and the valid knowledge that grasps the pervasion between the probandum and the proof.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni skad cig pa nyid dang lhan cig pa'i khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na la gzung bar bya'o zhes kha cig ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni skad cig pa nyid dang lhan cig pa'i khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can kho na la gzung bar bya'o zhes kha cig ste /
translated: Some say: The existence that is the nature of the reason is to be apprehended only in the subject that is the predicate of the probandum, such as impermanence and simultaneity.

original: de rnams nang gi khyab pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams nang gi khyab pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'o //
translated: They assert that the direction of pervasion is internal.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba dang thal ba las bzlog pa dag gis dpe'i chos can bum pa la sogs pa la khyab pa gzung bar bya'o zhes gzhan rnams te /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba dang thal ba las bzlog pa dag gis dpe'i chos can bum pa la sogs pa la khyab pa gzung bar bya'o zhes gzhan rnams te /
translated: Others say: Pervasion is to be apprehended in the example subject, such as a vase, through the consequence and the reverse of the consequence.

original: de rnams phyi'i khyab pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams phyi'i khyab pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'o //
translated: They assert that the direction of pervasion is external.

original: yod pa nyid las gzhan pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rnams dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs rnams dang mi dmigs pa rnams kyis khyab pa dpe kho na la gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid las gzhan pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rnams dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs rnams dang mi dmigs pa rnams kyis khyab pa dpe kho na la gzung bar bya'o //
translated: With respect to existence, other reasons such as reasons of nature, reasons of effect and reasons of nonobservation, pervasion is to be apprehended only in the example.

original: de la shing sha pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba shing gi tha snyad kyis khyab pa dpe la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la shing sha pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba shing gi tha snyad kyis khyab pa dpe la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In that, the pervasion of the probandum by the tree itself is apprehended in the example by direct perception and non-apprehension.

original: yod @357b pa nyid dang skad cig ma nyid dag gi ni thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thal ba las bzlog pa dag gis sam /
analyzed: yod @357b pa nyid dang skad cig ma nyid dag gi ni thal bar 'gyur ba dang / thal ba las bzlog pa dag gis sam /
translated: In the case of existence and momentariness, it is by the forward and reverse pervasions,

original: bsgrub bya las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma rim dang cig car nyid ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis /
analyzed: bsgrub bya las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma rim dang cig car nyid ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis /
translated: or by the valid cognition that contradicts the opposite of the probandum, which has the characteristic of negating simultaneity and succession.

original: dngos po nyid dang dngos po med pa nyid dag tu the tshom za bzhin pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi chos can la'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid dang dngos po med pa nyid dag tu the tshom za bzhin pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi chos can la'o //
translated: It is in regard to the subject that has the property of the opposite of the probandum, while being doubtful about existence and non-existence.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi du ba la sogs pa la me la sogs pas khyab pa tshang bang la sogs pa dpe'i chos can la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis sam /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi du ba la sogs pa la me la sogs pas khyab pa tshang bang la sogs pa dpe'i chos can la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis sam /
translated: In the case of the reason based on effect, such as smoke, the pervasion by fire, etc. is apprehended in the example subject, such as a kitchen, by the three types of direct perception and non-apprehension,

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa lnga las gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa lnga las gzung bar bya'o //
translated: or by the five types of direct perception and non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa'i ni tha snyad du rung ba nyid dang lhan cig pa'i khyab pa mngon sum kho nas so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ni tha snyad du rung ba nyid dang lhan cig pa'i khyab pa mngon sum kho nas so //
translated: The pervasion of the non-observation by the suitable itself is ascertained by direct perception alone.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi gzhan rnams kyi dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba'i tshad ma blangs na rtogs par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi gzhan rnams kyi dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs 'ga' zhig rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba'i tshad ma blangs na rtogs par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The nature of some of the other reasons of nature and some of the reasons of effect are to be understood by taking a valid cognition in accordance with the nature.

original: khyab pa nges pa med pa gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: khyab pa nges pa med pa gtan tshigs ma nges pa'i skyon no //
translated: The fault of the reason being unascertained is the non-ascertainment of the pervasion.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of three types:

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa dang / thun mong gi ma nges pa dang / mi mthun phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa dang / thun mong gi ma nges pa dang / mi mthun phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba can zhes pa'o //
translated: uncommon non-ascertainment, common non-ascertainment, and doubt about the reversal in the discordant side.

original: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa ni dper na /
analyzed: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa ni dper na /
translated: Uncommon non-ascertainment is, for example,

original: gson pa'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gson pa'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: the body of a living being is endowed with a self

original: srog chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o /
analyzed: srog chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa lta bu'o /
translated: because it is endowed with life and so on.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni gson lus gzhan la bdag gis khyab po zhes nges pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni gson lus gzhan la bdag gis khyab po zhes nges pa ma yin zhing /
translated: This reason is not ascertained as pervading other living bodies.

original: mi mthun phyogs bum pa la yang bdag med pa'i phyir lag go zhes nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs bum pa la yang bdag med pa'i phyir lag go zhes nges pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not ascertained as the opposite of the dissimilar class, a pot, because it does not exist there.

original: chos can gson lus la ni yod do zhes pas thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa brjod do //
analyzed: chos can gson lus la ni yod do zhes pas thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa brjod do //
translated: The uncommon nonascertainment is stated by the phrase ‚Äúit exists in the subject, a living body.‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa gzhan yang dper na /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa gzhan yang dper na /
translated: Another example of uncommon nonascertainment is:

original: sgra mi rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste mnyan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Sound is impermanent because of being audible,

original: bum pa bzhin /
analyzed: bum pa bzhin /
translated: like a pot.

original: nam mkha' bzhin lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin lta bu'o //
translated: Like space.

original: thun mong gi ma nges pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin /
analyzed: thun mong gi ma nges pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste gzhal bya nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin /
translated: Common nonascertainment is, for example: Sound is permanent because of being an object of comprehension,üîΩlike a pot.

original: nam mkha' bzhin lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin lta bu'o //
translated: Like space.

original: mi mthun phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba can ni dper na /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba can ni dper na /
translated: Doubt about the opposite is, for example:

original: der ni sngo bsangs yin te de'i bu nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: der ni sngo bsangs yin te de'i bu nyid kyi phyir /
translated: He is dark because of being his son,

original: yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i bu bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i bu bzhin zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the son who is being seen.

original: gang sngar bshad pa yod pa nyid skad cig ma nyid dang / lhan @358a * //
analyzed: gang sngar bshad pa yod pa nyid skad cig ma nyid dang / lhan @358a * //
translated: The pervasion that was explained earlier is that existence and momentariness are pervaded by simultaneity.üîΩThe pervasion that is to be grasped by the reverse of the reductio is that existence and momentariness are pervaded by simultaneity.

original: cig pa'i khyab pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang thal ba las bzlog pa dang gis gzung bar bya'o zhes pa de la thal bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: cig pa'i khyab pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang thal ba las bzlog pa dang gis gzung bar bya'o zhes pa de la thal bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is a reductio?

original: tshad mas grub pa'i khyab pa can gyi don gyis pha rol pa'i mi 'dod pa 'byung ba'i ched du thal bar byed pa ni thal bar 'gyur pa ste ;
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa'i khyab pa can gyi don gyis pha rol pa'i mi 'dod pa 'byung ba'i ched du thal bar byed pa ni thal bar 'gyur pa ste ;
translated: A reductio is a reductio ad absurdum that is used to show that the opponent‚Äôs thesis entails a contradiction, on the basis of a pervasion that is established by a valid cognition.

original: dper na grub pa la sogs pa rnams 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag na ngo bo gcig pa nyid du khas len pa la /
analyzed: dper na grub pa la sogs pa rnams 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag na ngo bo gcig pa nyid du khas len pa la /
translated: For example, the Samkhyas and so on accept that the past and future exist as entities that are essentially the same as the present.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung ba'i don bya ba byed pa nyid du thal bar byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung ba'i don bya ba byed pa nyid du thal bar byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: The reductio is used to show that it follows, absurdly, that they must accept that the past and future exist as entities that are essentially the same as the present.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: This is because

original: gang zhig gang gi tshe gang bya bar nus pa de ni de'i tshe byed pa kho na ste ;
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi tshe gang bya bar nus pa de ni de'i tshe byed pa kho na ste ;
translated: whatever is able to perform a function at a certain time will do so at that time.

original: dper na rgyu tshogs pa thams cad rang gi 'bras bu bzhin /
analyzed: dper na rgyu tshogs pa thams cad rang gi 'bras bu bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like all the collections of causes in relation to their own effects.üîΩThis pot is able to perform the function of a thing in the past and future times in the present time.

original: bum pa 'di yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi dngos po'i don bya ba da ltar gyi dus su byed par nus pa yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gtan tshigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa 'di yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi dngos po'i don bya ba da ltar gyi dus su byed par nus pa yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gtan tshigs kyi thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the reductio.

original: byed pa yang ma yin no zhes pa bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa yang ma yin no zhes pa bzlog pa'o //
translated: It is not a maker is the reversal.

original: gang zhig gi tshe gang mi byed pa de ni de'i tshe de la nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gi tshe gang mi byed pa de ni de'i tshe de la nus pa ma yin te /
translated: When something does not make something else, at that time it is not able to make it.

original: dper na sh'a li'i myu gu mi byed pa'i kota pas sh'a li'i myu gu la bzhin /
analyzed: dper na sh'a li'i myu gu mi byed pa'i kota pas sh'a li'i myu gu la bzhin /
translated: For example, like a kotarya seed in relation to a rice sprout, which it does not make.üîΩThis pot does not make the function of a thing in the past and future times in the present time.

original: bum pa 'di yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi dngos po'i don bya ba dang da ltar gyi dus su mi byed do zhes pa khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa 'di yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi dngos po'i don bya ba dang da ltar gyi dus su mi byed do zhes pa khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is a nonobservation of a pervader.

original: 'brel ba las nus pa med pa'i skad cig pa ni 'jig go zhes pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang thal ba las bzlog pa'i tshad ma dag gis yod pa yid la skad cig pa nyid kyi khyab pa 'grub po //
analyzed: 'brel ba las nus pa med pa'i skad cig pa ni 'jig go zhes pa thal bar 'gyur ba dang thal ba las bzlog pa'i tshad ma dag gis yod pa yid la skad cig pa nyid kyi khyab pa 'grub po //
translated: The valid cognition that is the reverse of the reductio and the valid cognition that is the reductio prove that existence is necessarily momentary.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa gnod pa can gyi tshad mas sam zhes bshad pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa gnod pa can gyi tshad mas sam zhes bshad pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs argument that the reductio does not prove the opposite of the original premise should be addressed.

original: gang zhig rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa nyid dang rim pa ma yin par 'bras bu byed pa nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de ni don bya ba nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa nyid dang rim pa ma yin par 'bras bu byed pa nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de ni don bya ba nus pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist as the cause of an effect either gradually or suddenly is not a cause,

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma bzhin /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma bzhin /
translated: like, for example, a sky flower.

original: skad cig ma yin par yang rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa nyid dang / rim ma yin par 'bras bu byed pa nyid dag yod pa ma yin no zhes pa khyab byed mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad mas /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin par yang rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa nyid dang / rim ma yin par 'bras bu byed pa nyid dag yod pa ma yin no zhes pa khyab byed mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad mas /
translated: The valid cognition that is the reverse of the reductio, which has the characteristic of the nonobservation of a pervader, proves that a momentary entity does not exist as the cause of an effect either gradually or suddenly.

original: skad cig ma yin pa nyid las khyab byed rim dang cig car ba ldog pas ldog bzhin pa'i /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa nyid las khyab byed rim dang cig car ba ldog pas ldog bzhin pa'i /
translated: Since they are momentary, the encompassing factors of gradual and instantaneous cessation are eliminated.üîΩ

original: don bya ba byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can yod pa nyid ni skad cig pas ngal ba med do //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can yod pa nyid ni skad cig pas ngal ba med do //
translated: Since the momentary is the pervader of the sequential and the instantaneous, the existence that is characterized by the performance of function, which is in the process of being refuted, is momentary without effort.

original: @358b de nas skad cig pa nyid kyis khyab po zhes yod pa nyid la skad cig pa nyid kyis khyab pa 'grub po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: @358b de nas skad cig pa nyid kyis khyab po zhes yod pa nyid la skad cig pa nyid kyis khyab pa 'grub po zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, since it is pervaded by momentariness, the pervasion of existence by momentariness is established.

original: dper na spyi du ma la 'jug pa nyid du khas len pa la du ma nyid du thal ba bzhin yang ste /
analyzed: dper na spyi du ma la 'jug pa nyid du khas len pa la du ma nyid du thal ba bzhin yang ste /
translated: For example, it is like the consequence of multiplicity in the case of the assertion that the universal is engaged in many.

original: de ltar ni gang du ma la 'jug pa de ni du ma ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni gang du ma la 'jug pa de ni du ma ste /
translated: In this way, that which is engaged in many is multiple.

original: dper na snod du mar son pa'i t'a la'i 'bras bu bzhin /
analyzed: dper na snod du mar son pa'i t'a la'i 'bras bu bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like a palm fruit that is in many vessels.

original: spyi yang du ma la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: spyi yang du ma la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The universal is engaged in many.

original: de'i phyir 'dis kyang du mar 'byung bar bya'o zhes pa thal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis kyang du mar 'byung bar bya'o zhes pa thal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this also arises as many. This is the consequence.

original: ci ste du ma nyid du mi 'dod na de'i tshe du ma la 'jug pa nyid kyang khas mi len cig /'o na gal te thal bar 'gyur ba zhes pa 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste du ma nyid du mi 'dod na de'i tshe du ma la 'jug pa nyid kyang khas mi len cig /'o na gal te thal bar 'gyur ba zhes pa 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mar mi 'gyur na /
translated: Well, if this reductio is not a valid cognition that establishes the predicate of the probandum,

original: de ji ltar nyid nye bar 'god ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar nyid nye bar 'god ce na /
translated: then how could it be used as a reductio?

original: khyab pa dran pa'i don du khyab pa'i phyogs gcig brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khyab pa dran pa'i don du khyab pa'i phyogs gcig brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the statement of one part of a pervasion in order to recall the pervasion.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said:

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'o gnyis 'brel phyir //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'o gnyis 'brel phyir //
translated: Because of the relation of the two in a reductio,

original: gcig med na gzhan dgag ched yin //
analyzed: gcig med na gzhan dgag ched yin //
translated: when one is negated, the other is implicitly negated.

original: zhes so // 'di'i don na 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di'i don na 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dag 'brel bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dag 'brel bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the pervaded and the pervader are related,

original: gal te khyab par byed pa mi 'dod na de'i tshe khyab par bya ba yang ma 'dod cig / ci ste khyab par bya ba 'dod na de'i tshe khyab par byed pa yang 'dod par byos shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: gal te khyab par byed pa mi 'dod na de'i tshe khyab par bya ba yang ma 'dod cig / ci ste khyab par bya ba 'dod na de'i tshe khyab par byed pa yang 'dod par byos shig ces pa'o //
translated: then if you do not accept the pervader, at that time do not accept the pervaded. But if you do accept the pervaded, then you must accept the pervader.

original: rgol bas sgrub par byed pa nye bar bkod pa na /
analyzed: rgol bas sgrub par byed pa nye bar bkod pa na /
translated: When the proponent sets forth a proof,

original: phyir rgol bas de la sun 'byin pa smra bar bya'o zhes pa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol bas de la sun 'byin pa smra bar bya'o zhes pa rigs pa'o //
translated: The opponent should state a refutation of that.

original: ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa rnams kyis gang yang rung ba brjod pa ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa rnams kyis gang yang rung ba brjod pa ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: The statement of any of the unestablished, contradictory, or indefinite reasons is a refutation.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said:

original: ma tshang ba sogs brjod sun 'byin rnams //
analyzed: ma tshang ba sogs brjod sun 'byin rnams //
translated: The statements of incompleteness and so on are refutations.

original: zhes so // 'o na 'di rnams brjod pa kho na gal te sun 'byin pa ni yin na //
analyzed: zhes so // 'o na 'di rnams brjod pa kho na gal te sun 'byin pa ni yin na //
translated: If the statement of those is a refutation,

original: de'i tshe don med pa nyid dang nus pa med pa nyid dang ha cang thal ba la sogs pa rnams ci'i nang du 'du zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe don med pa nyid dang nus pa med pa nyid dang ha cang thal ba la sogs pa rnams ci'i nang du 'du zhe na /
translated: then what is the inclusion of the meaningless, the ineffective, and the absurd?

original: gsum po 'di rnams kho nar te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di rnams kho nar te /
translated: They are included in just these three.

original: de la don med pa nyid ni re zhig ma grub pa'i nang du 'du ste /
analyzed: de la don med pa nyid ni re zhig ma grub pa'i nang du 'du ste /
translated: The meaningless is included in the unestablished.

original: gtan tshigs ni bsgrub bya'i chos la the tshom za ba can du brjod la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni bsgrub bya'i chos la the tshom za ba can du brjod la /
translated: A reason is said to be one that creates doubt about the property of the thesis.

original: gang du don med pa nyid nye bar dgong pa der ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bsgrub bya'i chos la the tshom za ba nyid gtan tshigs la mi srid do zhes pa ma grub par brjod do //
analyzed: gang du don med pa nyid nye bar dgong pa der ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bsgrub bya'i chos la the tshom za ba nyid gtan tshigs la mi srid do zhes pa ma grub par brjod do //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúunproven.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: the tshom za la rtags brjod phyir //
analyzed: the tshom za la rtags brjod phyir //
translated: Because the reason is stated with doubt,

original: bsal ba gtan tshigs rten ma yin //üîΩzhes so // nus pa med @359a * //
analyzed: bsal ba gtan tshigs rten ma yin // zhes so // nus pa med @359a * //
translated: the exclusion is not the basis of the reason.

original: pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i nang du 'du'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i nang du 'du'o zhes pa ste /
translated: As for the absence of capacity, it is included in the absence of an established nature.

original: nus pa zhes bya ba rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: What is called ‚Äúcapacity‚Äù is not other than the nature of the reason,

original: gtan tshigs dngos po ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dngos po ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the reason would not be a thing.

original: ha cang thal ba ni ma nges pa'i nang du 'dus te /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i kha don las 'das nas ;
analyzed: ha cang thal ba ni ma nges pa'i nang du 'dus te / bsgrub par bya ba'i kha don las 'das nas ;
translated: As for the absurd consequence, it is included in the uncertain.üîΩBecause it overextends to the discordant side,

original: mi mthun phyogs la thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: passing beyond the meaning of the probandum.

original: chos can gang la bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub par mngon par 'dod pa'i chos can de la tshad mas gnod pa nyid na gzhi ma grub pa rtags kyi skyon no //
analyzed: chos can gang la bsgrub par bya ba bsgrub par mngon par 'dod pa'i chos can de la tshad mas gnod pa nyid na gzhi ma grub pa rtags kyi skyon no //
translated: If the subject is undermined by a valid cognition, then the subject is not established. This is a fault of the reason.

original: dper na bdag nyid ni thams cad du song ba ste /
analyzed: dper na bdag nyid ni thams cad du song ba ste /
translated: For example, the self is all-pervading,

original: thams cad du yon tan nye bar dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro lta bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yon tan nye bar dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro lta bu'o //
translated: because the quality of being perceived everywhere is observed.

original: 'di de 'dir sangs rgyas pa la bdag nyid ma grub na 'di'i phyogs thams cad du dmigs par bya ba'i yon tan nyid 'grub pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'di de 'dir sangs rgyas pa la bdag nyid ma grub na 'di'i phyogs thams cad du dmigs par bya ba'i yon tan nyid 'grub pa lta ci smos /
translated: If the self is not established here, then how could the quality of being perceived everywhere be established for it?

original: de ltar ni mu stegs can rnams nges par 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni mu stegs can rnams nges par 'di skad smra ste /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas certainly say this.

original: lus la sogs pa'i dngos po las gzhan pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i byed pa po dang de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po rtag pa khyab pa'i ngo bo bdag ces bya ba rdzas gzhan pa yod do //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i dngos po las gzhan pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i byed pa po dang de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po rtag pa khyab pa'i ngo bo bdag ces bya ba rdzas gzhan pa yod do //
translated: There is another thing that is different from the things such as the body, the permanent, all-pervading entity that is the creator of virtue and nonvirtue and the experiencer of the results of those. It is called the self. It is a different substance.

original: des kyang thams cad la khyab tu zin kyang /
analyzed: des kyang thams cad la khyab tu zin kyang /
