translated: Even though it pervades everything,

original: de lta na yang gang longs spyod pa'i skye mched nyid du yongs su bzung ba'i gson lus de kho na bdag dang bcas par brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gang longs spyod pa'i skye mched nyid du yongs su bzung ba'i gson lus de kho na bdag dang bcas par brjod do zhe'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the body that is appropriated as the very sense-sphere of enjoyment is said to be the self together with the body.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is not correct.

original: bdag bsgrub pa'i ched du tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag bsgrub pa'i ched du tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition to establish the self.

original: mngon sum gyis bdag rtogs par ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bdag rtogs par ma yin te /
translated: The self is not cognized by direct perception,

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa lnga por nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa lnga por nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the five objects such as form are ascertained as the objects of the eye consciousness and so on.

original: yid las byung ba nga zhes rtogs pa'i yang lus la sogs pa yul yin pa la nyid kyi phyir te /üîΩnga lji'o ; / nga sbom mo //
analyzed: yid las byung ba nga zhes rtogs pa'i yang lus la sogs pa yul yin pa la nyid kyi phyir te / nga lji'o ; / nga sbom mo //
translated: Nor is it cognized by mental consciousness, because the body and so on are its objects.

original: nga 'gro'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas nga zhes rtogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: nga 'gro'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas nga zhes rtogs pa skye'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúI am fat,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am thin,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am going.‚Äù

original: rgyan mdzad pas gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyan mdzad pas gang gsungs pa /
translated: The ƒÄryƒÅ·π£·π≠asƒÅhasrikƒÅ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ says:

original: nga'o zhes pa'i shes gang de 'ang //
analyzed: nga'o zhes pa'i shes gang de 'ang //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the consciousness that thinks ‚ÄòI‚Äô?

original: lus dbang cha shas rig byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus dbang cha shas rig byed pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that cognizes the body, the sense faculties, and their parts.

original: nga ni phra dang bde dang lci //
analyzed: nga ni phra dang bde dang lci //
translated: I am small, I am happy, I am heavy,

original: mtshungs pa'i rten ni rig byed phyir //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rten ni rig byed phyir //
translated: because the similar basis is cognized.‚Äù

original: zhes so // lus las gzhan pa 'di la de'i chos can lci ba nyid dam sbom po nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // lus las gzhan pa 'di la de'i chos can lci ba nyid dam sbom po nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: But heaviness and thickness are not the properties of this body, which is different from the body.

original: khyab bdag gzugs can ma yin pa la lus kyi rdzas kyi rjes su bsgrub pa dang 'gro ba'i bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab bdag gzugs can ma yin pa la lus kyi rdzas kyi rjes su bsgrub pa dang 'gro ba'i bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable that the omnipresent, non-material self should be established by the material body, or that it should have the activity of going.

original: 'di ni bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i brda bzhin du btags par rigs pa yang ma yin @359b te ;
analyzed: 'di ni bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i brda bzhin du btags par rigs pa yang ma yin @359b te ;
translated: And it is not reasonable to impute this to the self, as one might impute the name ‚Äúlion‚Äù to a boy.

original: 'jug pa 'khrul bar thar pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'khrul bar thar pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a mistake to apply it.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it understood by inference,

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no effect or nature evidence.

original: rtag cing lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na yul dang dus dang rnam pa bral ba'i bdag dang lhan cig 'ga' zhig kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag cing lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na yul dang dus dang rnam pa bral ba'i bdag dang lhan cig 'ga' zhig kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the self is permanent and hidden, it is not established that it has the nature of cause and effect, which is the nature of going together and turning away, with anything, in any place, time, or manner.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical that the effect is the evidence.

original: chos can la yod pa nyid kyang ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can la yod pa nyid kyang ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of the subject is not established, it is illogical that the evidence is intrinsic.

original: rtags gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any other evidence.

original: khyed kyis rtags gzhan gyis kyang bsgrub byas khyab par 'byung bar bya ba la de yang rnam pa thams cad du ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar rtags la khyab pa nges par bya /
analyzed: khyed kyis rtags gzhan gyis kyang bsgrub byas khyab par 'byung bar bya ba la de yang rnam pa thams cad du ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar rtags la khyab pa nges par bya /
translated: Because you cannot establish that the evidence pervades the probandum by means of any other evidence, how can you ascertain the pervasion of the evidence?

original: gzhan yang bdag 'di ci rtogs pa'i ngo bo 'am rtogs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhig gal te rtogs pa'i ngo bo dang rtag pa yin na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa 'bras bu dang bral ba nyid du thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag 'di ci rtogs pa'i ngo bo 'am rtogs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhig gal te rtogs pa'i ngo bo dang rtag pa yin na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa 'bras bu dang bral ba nyid du thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Moreover, is this self the nature of an understanding or the nature of a non-understanding? If it is the nature of an understanding and is permanent, then it follows that the eye and so on would be devoid of effect, and it would be difficult to reverse that consequence.

original: 'on te rtogs pa'i ngo bo mi rtag pa zhig yin na de'i tshe shes pa kho na la bdag ces ming du byas pas mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa'i ngo bo mi rtag pa zhig yin na de'i tshe shes pa kho na la bdag ces ming du byas pas mi mthun pa med do //
translated: But if it is the nature of an understanding and is impermanent, then there is no disagreement in calling it consciousness alone.

original: ci ste rtogs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo bltar rung ba zhig yin /
analyzed: ci ste rtogs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo bltar rung ba zhig yin /
translated: But if the nature of the non-apprehension is such that it can be seen,

original: de'i tshe mi dmigs pas 'di'i yod pa nyid bzod pa ma yin no zhes pa bdag med pa sgrub pa ni kha na mtho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi dmigs pas 'di'i yod pa nyid bzod pa ma yin no zhes pa bdag med pa sgrub pa ni kha na mtho ba med pa'o //
translated: then its existence cannot be maintained, since it is not apprehended. Thus, the proof of selflessness is without fault.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all things that are compounded are selfless.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pas kyang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pas kyang ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Also, a reason that is not established with regard to its own nature becomes a fallacious reason.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag ste mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag ste mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent, because it is perceptible by the eye.‚Äù

original: 'o na khyab pa ma grub pa yang sun 'byin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na khyab pa ma grub pa yang sun 'byin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt a reason that is not established with regard to its pervasion also a fallacious reason?

original: des kyang pha rol po'i 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang pha rol po'i 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not establish the object that is intended by the opponent.

original: de mi brjod pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de mi brjod pa ci zhe na /
translated: Why is it not mentioned?

original: ma nges pa sun 'byin pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir logs su ma brjod do //
analyzed: ma nges pa sun 'byin pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir logs su ma brjod do //
translated: Because it is understood by the refutation of the indeterminate.

original: de ltar ni rang gi mtshan nyid dag gis khyab pa gzung bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni rang gi mtshan nyid dag gis khyab pa gzung bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not possible to apprehend pervasion by means of intrinsic identity.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa nyid kyis na gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul dang dus dang rnam par nges pa nyid kyis na gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because intrinsic identity is ascertained by way of place, time, and aspect, it does not follow elsewhere.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa spyi dag kho nas khyab pa gzung bar bya ba yin zhing //üîΩde la yang gal te sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya bas @360a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa spyi dag kho nas khyab pa gzung bar bya ba yin zhing // de la yang gal te sgrub par byed pa bsgrub par bya bas @360a * //
translated: However, pervasion is to be apprehended only by means of the general properties of the probandum and the logical argument.

original: khyab par rtogs pa ma yin na de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: khyab par rtogs pa ma yin na de'i tshe sgrub par byed pa yang 'gyur la /
translated: And in that regard, if the logical argument is not understood to pervade the probandum, then at that time the logical argument is not established,

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pas ma nges pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pas ma nges pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: and the probandum is not established. Thus, it is simply not ascertained.

original: 'o na khyed la ci ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na khyed la ci ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, is it not the case that you have no establishment?

original: de ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa spyi dag las thams cad nye bar sdud pa dang ldan pa'i khyab pa tshad mas gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa spyi dag las thams cad nye bar sdud pa dang ldan pa'i khyab pa tshad mas gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that the pervasion that is associated with the inclusion of everything in the general class of that which is to be established and that which establishes is apprehended by a valid cognition?

original: 'di ni skyon ma yin te gang gi phyir gang 'dra ba'i spyi gzhan rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa de dang 'dra ba tshad mas gnod pas na bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis khas len pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon ma yin te gang gi phyir gang 'dra ba'i spyi gzhan rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa de dang 'dra ba tshad mas gnod pas na bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis khas len pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a fault, because the Sugatas do not accept that which is similar to the universal that is imagined by others, since that is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: tha snyad la grags pa'i spyi gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gzhan las sel ba'i ming can ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad la grags pa'i spyi gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gzhan las sel ba'i ming can ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: However, they do accept the universal that is known in conventional usage, which has the characteristic of being the opposite of other things, and which is called ‚Äúexclusion of other things.‚Äù

original: 'o na sel ba zhes pa 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sel ba zhes pa 'di ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is this so-called exclusion?

original: ji ltar zhen pa bzhin du phyi rol kho na'i bum pa la sogs pa'i don ni sel bzhes mngon par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhen pa bzhin du phyi rol kho na'i bum pa la sogs pa'i don ni sel bzhes mngon par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The object, such as a pot, that exists only externally, just as it is imagined, is to be called ‚Äúexclusion.‚Äù

original: 'di las rigs mi mthun pa gzhan bsal bar bya ba'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: 'di las rigs mi mthun pa gzhan bsal bar bya ba'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: Because it excludes things that are not of its type.

original: ji ltar snang ba'i blo'i rnam pa yang sel ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba'i blo'i rnam pa yang sel ba ste /
translated: The aspect of the awareness that appears as that is also an exclusion.

original: blo'i rnam pa 'dir mi mthun pa sel bar byed tha dad du byed ces byas nas so //
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa 'dir mi mthun pa sel bar byed tha dad du byed ces byas nas so //
translated: It is an exclusion of what is incompatible with this aspect of awareness.

original: ji lta ba'i de kho na nyid ldog pa tsam med par dgag pa'i ngo bo ni sel ba ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba'i de kho na nyid ldog pa tsam med par dgag pa'i ngo bo ni sel ba ste /
translated: The reality of the way things really exist, which is a nonimplicative negation that is a mere exclusion, is an exclusion.

original: sel ba nyid ni sel ba'o zhes byas nas so ;
analyzed: sel ba nyid ni sel ba'o zhes byas nas so ;
translated: It is an exclusion that is an exclusion.

original: /'o na ji ltar zhen pa ni sgrub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: /'o na ji ltar zhen pa ni sgrub pa kho na ste /
translated: Well, if that is so, then the object of apprehension is only an affirmation.

original: de lta na sel ba 'ba' zhig go zhes pa 'ongs so zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na sel ba 'ba' zhig go zhes pa 'ongs so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: In that case, it is established that it is only an exclusion.

original: sgrub pa ni sel ba'i khyab par can du dgongs te /üîΩgang ba lang rtogs pa na /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni sel ba'i khyab par can du dgongs te / gang ba lang rtogs pa na /
translated: The proponents of affirmation assert that an affirmation is a pervader of an exclusion because when a cow is realized,

original: ba men ma yin no //üîΩba men min no zhes shugs kyis sel ba phyis nges par bya'o zhes pa sgrub pa smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ba men ma yin no // ba men min no zhes shugs kyis sel ba phyis nges par bya'o zhes pa sgrub pa smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'o //
translated: it is indirectly understood that it is not a non-cow.

original: gzhan sel ba rtogs pa na yang shugs las sel ba ba lang la sogs pa'i don rtogs so zhes pa ldog pa'i sel ba smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba rtogs pa na yang shugs las sel ba ba lang la sogs pa'i don rtogs so zhes pa ldog pa'i sel ba smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The proponents of exclusion assert that when an exclusion is realized, the object of the exclusion, such as a cow, is also indirectly understood.

original: de mi rigs te tha snyad kyi dus su dang por 'jug pa'i so so'i rim pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir /üîΩbsgrub pa rtogs nas 'ga' zhig gis don gyis go ba las phyis sel ba rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de mi rigs te tha snyad kyi dus su dang por 'jug pa'i so so'i rim pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir / bsgrub pa rtogs nas 'ga' zhig gis don gyis go ba las phyis sel ba rtogs pa'am /
translated: That is not so, because at the time of the convention, the individual stages of the first engagement are not seen.üîΩAfter the proof is understood, some understand the object by implication, and later understand the exclusion.

original: sel ba rtogs nas phyis bsel ba rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sel ba rtogs nas phyis bsel ba rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, after the exclusion is understood, later the object is understood.

original: de'i phyir ba lang rtogs pa kho na gzhan sel ba rtogs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang rtogs pa kho na gzhan sel ba rtogs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that the understanding of the cow itself is the understanding of the exclusion of other.

original: gal te yang yang ba lang gi sgra brjod pa las gzhan sel @360b pa'i sgra la ma reg pa brjod pa de lta na yang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i sel ba rtogs pa med pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te yang yang ba lang gi sgra brjod pa las gzhan sel @360b pa'i sgra la ma reg pa brjod pa de lta na yang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i sel ba rtogs pa med pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Even if the word cow is uttered without touching the word exclusion of other, in that case, the understanding of the exclusion that makes a difference is not nonexistent.

original: ba lang gi sgra ni ba lang ma yin pa bsal bar byas pa kho na'i dngos po la brdar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra ni ba lang ma yin pa bsal bar byas pa kho na'i dngos po la brdar byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the word cow is made to signify only the thing that excludes non-cow.

original: dper na autpala sngon po la brdar byas pa'i ain di wa ra'i sgra las autpala sngon po rtogs pa na de'i dus kho nar sngon po'i yon tan rgyas pa ma bzlog pa de bzhin du ba lang ma yin pa bsal bar byas pa la brdar byas pa'i ba
analyzed: dper na autpala sngon po la brdar byas pa'i ain di wa ra'i sgra las autpala sngon po rtogs pa na de'i dus kho nar sngon po'i yon tan rgyas pa ma bzlog pa de bzhin du ba lang ma yin pa bsal bar byas pa la brdar byas pa'i ba
translated: For example, when the word ‚Äúindigo‚Äù is used to refer to a blue lotus, at that very time the quality of blueness is not excluded.

original: lang gi sgra las kyang ba lang rtogs pa na dus mtshungs pa kho nar sel ba'i khyad par yin pa nyid kyi phyir na /üîΩsel ba rgyas pa kho na ma bzlog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: lang gi sgra las kyang ba lang rtogs pa na dus mtshungs pa kho nar sel ba'i khyad par yin pa nyid kyi phyir na / sel ba rgyas pa kho na ma bzlog pa kho na'o //
translated: In the same way, when the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is used to refer to an animal that is not a non-cow, at that very time the exclusion of the other is not excluded.

original: ji ltar mngon sum med par dgag pa'i ngo bo med par 'dzin pa ni med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par nus pa kho na'i yin gyi de ltar bsgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa rjes su sgrub pa 'byin par
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum med par dgag pa'i ngo bo med par 'dzin pa ni med pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par nus pa kho na'i yin gyi de ltar bsgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa rjes su sgrub pa 'byin par
translated: Just as the apprehension of the nature of an internal negation without a direct perception is able to produce the conception of nonexistence, and the conceptions that establish that are able to produce the establishment of that which is consistent with it,

original: nus pa kho na la med pa 'dzin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa kho na la med pa 'dzin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: it is said that they apprehend nonexistence.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na gal te ba lang gi sgra las don rtogs pa'i dus na pha rol sel ba ma rtogs na de'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na gal te ba lang gi sgra las don rtogs pa'i dus na pha rol sel ba ma rtogs na de'i tshe /
translated: Otherwise, if at the time of understanding the meaning from the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù the exclusion of other is not understood,

original: rtog pa pos gzhan yongs su spangs nas ba lang lam 'jug pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: rtog pa pos gzhan yongs su spangs nas ba lang lam 'jug pa ji ltar yin /
translated: then how could the person who understands the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù engage in the path of the cow, having completely abandoned other things?

original: de las ba lang thogs shig ces bskul ba na /
analyzed: de las ba lang thogs shig ces bskul ba na /
translated: When he is urged, ‚ÄúTake the cow,‚Äù

original: rtal  sogs pa rnams kyang 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtal  sogs pa rnams kyang 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: he would also tie a bull.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gnas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this is the position:

original: phyi rol gyi don ni lhag par zhe na kho na las sgra'i brjod par bya ba rnam par gzhag gi //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni lhag par zhe na kho na las sgra'i brjod par bya ba rnam par gzhag gi //
translated: The object of external things is established as the referent of words only through convention,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su bsal bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su bsal bas ni ma yin te /
translated: not through the exclusion of its own characteristic,

original: mngon sum bzhin du yul dang dus dang / rnam pa dang gnas skabs nges par 'jug pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du yul dang dus dang / rnam pa dang gnas skabs nges par 'jug pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like perception, there is no exclusion of its own characteristic that engages with a definite object, time, aspect, and occasion.

original: rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pas gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pas gang gsungs pa /
translated: The supreme lord of reasoning says:

original: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la //
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba med pa la //
translated: Without the activity of the sense faculties,

original: sgra yi don ni mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: sgra yi don ni mthong ba bzhin //
translated: the referent of the word is seen.

original: blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo la snang ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no appearance to the mind.

original: zhes so // gzhan yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod par bya ba yin na bdag nyid thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes so // gzhan yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po brjod par bya ba yin na bdag nyid thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, if things that are intrinsically identifiable are expressible, then affirmation and negation are not tenable, because the whole nature of things is understood.

original: gang gi phyir de yod par 'gyur na yod do zhes pa don med cing med do zhes pa mi nus la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yod par 'gyur na yod do zhes pa don med cing med do zhes pa mi nus la /
translated: If they exist, it is meaningless to say ‚ÄúThey exist,‚Äù and it is impossible to say ‚ÄúThey do not exist.‚Äù

original: med par 'gyur na ni med do zhes pa don med cing yod ces pa mi nus @361a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //üîΩyod pa la sogs pa'i tshig sbyor ba yang yod do //
analyzed: med par 'gyur na ni med do zhes pa don med cing yod ces pa mi nus @361a * // pa'i phyir ro // yod pa la sogs pa'i tshig sbyor ba yang yod do //
translated: If they do not exist, it is meaningless to say ‚ÄúThey do not exist,‚Äù and it is impossible to say ‚ÄúThey exist.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, things that are intrinsically identifiable are not expressible by words.üîΩThis is the point.

original: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum gyis bum pa'i ngo bo rang gi gzung ba na yang phyis de kho na la skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa nges pa'i don du tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa de ltar shing gi sgra yis shing nyid kyi cha shas rtogs pa
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum gyis bum pa'i ngo bo rang gi gzung ba na yang phyis de kho na la skad cig pa nyid la sogs pa nges pa'i don du tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa de ltar shing gi sgra yis shing nyid kyi cha shas rtogs pa
translated: But, in the same way that when the nature of a pot is directly perceived, later on another valid cognition is applied to ascertain its momentariness, etc.,

original: na yod pa nyid kyi cha shas nges pa'i don du yod do la sogs pa'i tshig rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: na yod pa nyid kyi cha shas nges pa'i don du yod do la sogs pa'i tshig rab tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: in the same way, when a part of a tree is understood through the word tree, another word such as existent is applied to ascertain the part existence.

original: mngon sum ni ma nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir goms par ma byas pa'i ngo bo'i yul la tshad ma gzhan 'jug go zhes pa rigs so //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir goms par ma byas pa'i ngo bo'i yul la tshad ma gzhan 'jug go zhes pa rigs so //
translated: No, it is not the same, because direct perception is by nature nonascertaining, so it is logical that another valid cognition is applied to its object, whose nature has not been familiarized with.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: But conceptual cognition is by nature ascertaining.

original: des bzung zin pa'i rang gi ngo bo la tshad ma gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba gzhan pa ci zhig yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: des bzung zin pa'i rang gi ngo bo la tshad ma gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba gzhan pa ci zhig yod ces pa'o //
translated: So what other object is there for another valid cognition to apprehend, given that its nature has already been apprehended by that?

original: gang 'dra ba'i spyi pha rol po rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa gsal ba du ma la 'phrod pa 'dus pa snang du rung ba gcig pu rtag pa de dang 'dra ba yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang dmigs pa med de
analyzed: gang 'dra ba'i spyi pha rol po rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa gsal ba du ma la 'phrod pa 'dus pa snang du rung ba gcig pu rtag pa de dang 'dra ba yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang dmigs pa med de
translated: There is not the slightest valid cognition that observes a permanent, singular, and unitary entity that is the same as the many manifest entities that are imputed by others.

original: des na yod ces rnam par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yod ces rnam par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not cognized as existent.

original: de lta na ni ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i dus na ;
analyzed: de lta na ni ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i dus na ;
translated: In that case, when the manifest entities such as cows are experienced,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa gzhan rjes su 'gro ba gcig pu mngon sum la snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa gzhan rjes su 'gro ba gcig pu mngon sum la snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: apart from the manifest entities‚Äô own nature, such as their color and shape, a unitary, pervasive entity does not appear to direct perception.

original: de 'dra ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such an entity is not experienced.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba'i de ma thag par rnam pa gcig tu mchog tu zhen pa'i rtog pa yod pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas spyi kun du rtog pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba'i de ma thag par rnam pa gcig tu mchog tu zhen pa'i rtog pa yod pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas spyi kun du rtog pa yang rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the conception that the universal is a single entity is a conception that is immediately preceded by the experience of its own characteristics, it is not tenable that the universal is a different entity from the particulars. Therefore the conception of a universal is not tenable.

original: gsal ba rang gi rgyus nus pa 'byin pa rnams kho na las rtogs pa de brgyud pas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba rang gi rgyus nus pa 'byin pa rnams kho na las rtogs pa de brgyud pas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conception of a universal arises indirectly from the particulars that are the causes of the manifestation of their own effects,

original: tha dad na yang gsal ba 'ga' zhig rnams kho na 'di bskyed pa'i ched du nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad na yang gsal ba 'ga' zhig rnams kho na 'di bskyed pa'i ched du nus pa yin gyi /
translated: even if the universal is different from the particulars, it is impossible to see that some particulars are capable of producing it and others are not.

original: thams cad ni nus pa ma yin no zhes pa 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis mthong ba ni 'da' bar bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni nus pa ma yin no zhes pa 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis mthong ba ni 'da' bar bya bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to transcend the fact that the relation between cause and effect is seen by means of perception and nonapprehension.

original: tha dad pa khyad par med na yung gsal ba 'ga' zhig rnams kho na la nus pa 'di mthong ba yang yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa khyad par med na yung gsal ba 'ga' zhig rnams kho na la nus pa 'di mthong ba yang yin te /
translated: If the universal is not different from the particulars, then it is impossible to see that some particulars are capable of producing it and others are not.

original: dper na rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa @361b la sle tres dang ni ma pa la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rims la sogs pa zhi bar byed pa @361b la sle tres dang ni ma pa la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: seeds of long pepper and neem tree to cure fever.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: tha dad na yang rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: tha dad na yang rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Even though different, they are ascertained

original: nges te dbang po la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: nges te dbang po la sogs bzhin //
translated: by nature, like the senses and so on.üîΩMoreover, if a universal is the opposite of all that is dissimilar, butüîΩthere is no difference in the fact that it is different, then how is it thatüîΩthe universal of cow is that which produces the cognition of a single

original: zhes so // gzhan yang spyi ni rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las log pa yin na yang tha dad par khyad par med pa la ba lang gi gsal ba rnams kho na la 'phrod pa 'dus pa'i de'i spyi ni de kho na la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blo
analyzed: zhes so // gzhan yang spyi ni rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las log pa yin na yang tha dad par khyad par med pa la ba lang gi gsal ba rnams kho na la 'phrod pa 'dus pa'i de'i spyi ni de kho na la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blo
translated: aspect only in regard to the individual cows, but not in regard to otherüîΩthings?

original: skyed par byed pa ji ltar yin zhes dris pa la rang bzhin kho nas so zhes pha rol pos lan 'debs pa de yang tshad ma dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ji ltar yin zhes dris pa la rang bzhin kho nas so zhes pha rol pos lan 'debs pa de yang tshad ma dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response to this question is that it is by nature. ButüîΩthis is not a valid response.üîΩOur response of ‚Äúby nature‚Äù is a valid response because it is established

original: kho bo cag gi rang bzhin gyis zhes lan 'debs pa ni tshad mas grub pa nyid kyi phyir rigs pa dang ldan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi rang bzhin gyis zhes lan 'debs pa ni tshad mas grub pa nyid kyi phyir rigs pa dang ldan pa kho na'o //
translated: by valid cognition. It is only reasonable.

original: de ltar pha rol po'i rigs gzhan sgrub pa'i ched du sgrub par byed pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol po'i rigs gzhan sgrub pa'i ched du sgrub par byed pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the proof that establishes the other type of cognition.

original: gang khyad par du byas pa can gyi shes pa de ni khyad par 'dzin pa med na med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang khyad par du byas pa can gyi shes pa de ni khyad par 'dzin pa med na med pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that is qualified does not exist without the apprehension of the qualifier.

original: dper na dbyug pa can gyi shes pa bzhin 'di ba lang ngo zhes pa'i shes pa yang khyad par can gyi shes pa yin no zhes pa 'di ni don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dper na dbyug pa can gyi shes pa bzhin 'di ba lang ngo zhes pa'i shes pa yang khyad par can gyi shes pa yin no zhes pa 'di ni don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: For example, like the cognition of the man with the stick. The cognition that thinks ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù is a cognition of a qualified object. This is a reason based on effect.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: khyad par can gyi blo tha dad pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa med na med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blo tha dad pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa med na med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin nam /
translated: Is it being proven that the cognition of a qualified object does not exist without the apprehension of the qualifier, which is a different cognition?

original: khyad par can nyams su myong ba med na med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin /
analyzed: khyad par can nyams su myong ba med na med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin /
translated: Or is it being proven that the cognition of a qualified object does not exist without the experience of the qualified object?

original: phyogs dang po la mngon sum gyis gnod pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la mngon sum gyis gnod pa ste /
translated: In the first case, it is undermined by perception,

original: dngos po 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyis mngon sum la gnyis su so sor snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul can gyis mngon sum la gnyis su so sor snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because perception, which has the mode of apprehending things, does not perceive two things separately.

original: khyad par can gyi blo nyid kyang spyi la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blo nyid kyang spyi la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The cognition of the qualified is also uncertain in general,

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa med kyang de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa med kyang de mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen even without the apprehension of a different qualifier.

original: dper na bum pa'i 'di rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i 'di rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa'am /
translated: For example, this pot has its own nature,

original: ba lang nyid spyi bo zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid spyi bo zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: or this cow is the universal cow.

original: gnyis pa'i phyogs la ni grub pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i phyogs la ni grub pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: In the second case, it is an establishment of what is already established,

original: bum pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like saying the pot has its own nature.

original: gong bu ni ba lang nyid kyi rigs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes yongs su brtags pa'i tha snyad par rgyur byas nas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gong bu ni ba lang nyid kyi rigs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes yongs su brtags pa'i tha snyad par rgyur byas nas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The aggregate has the nature of a cow, because the relation of qualifier and qualified is manifested by the conventional designation that is imagined, based on the cause.

original: 'di ba lang ngo zhes pa'i tha snyad ni ba lang ma yin pa nyid las log pa nyams su myang ba las byung ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ba lang ngo zhes pa'i tha snyad ni ba lang ma yin pa nyid las log pa nyams su myang ba las byung ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The convention of saying this is a cow arises from the experience of the cow itself, which is the opposite of non-cow.

original: de lta 'di'i phyir yang sgrub par byed pa las spyi 'grub pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta 'di'i phyir yang sgrub par byed pa las spyi 'grub pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the universal is not established from the proof.

original: de'i phyir de lta pha rol pas kun du btags pa'i spyi ni dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta pha rol pas kun du btags pa'i spyi ni dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, the universal that is imagined by the opponent is not able to withstand analysis.

original: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa las log pa'i @362a * //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ma yin pa las log pa'i @362a * //
translated: Therefore, the mere thing that is the opposite of what is not its nature

original: dngos po tsam kho na sel ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba tha snyad kyi yan lag ji ltar zhen pa bzhin pa spyi yin pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'o zhes gnas so //
analyzed: dngos po tsam kho na sel ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba tha snyad kyi yan lag ji ltar zhen pa bzhin pa spyi yin pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'o zhes gnas so //
translated: is the universal that is the object of the expression of an excluding term, which is a part of the conventional, just as it is conceived.üîΩThis is faultless.

original: spyi dgag pa'i ched du slar yang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba bya ste /
analyzed: spyi dgag pa'i ched du slar yang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba bya ste /
translated: In order to refute the universal, one should again make an argument of this form:

original: gang zhig gang na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa de ni de na med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa de ni de na med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: That which is not observed in the character of being observed in something is the object of the convention of nonexistence in that,

original: dper na rta'i mgo la rva bzhin /
analyzed: dper na rta'i mgo la rva bzhin /
translated: like, for example, a horn on the head of a horse.

original: spyi yang yongs su snang bzhin pa'i gsal ba rnams la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs so zhes pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi yang yongs su snang bzhin pa'i gsal ba rnams la dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs so zhes pa rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The universal is not observed to have the characteristic of being the object of the cognitions that appear to be all-pervasive.

original: ma grub pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible that it is not established.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid can gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs par rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo gnyis pa mkhas pa nges par brtags kyang rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid can gsal ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs par rjes su 'gro ba can gyi ngo bo gnyis pa mkhas pa nges par brtags kyang rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, apart from the nature of the manifestation that has the characteristic of color and shape, a second nature that is pervasive is not seen at all by the wise who investigate.

original: 'di ni mthong ba med na yang shes pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba med na yang shes pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid du brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable to say that it is established by direct perception, like cognition, even though it is not seen.

original: shes pa ni rang rig pa'i tshad mas grub kyis ;
analyzed: shes pa ni rang rig pa'i tshad mas grub kyis ;
translated: Because cognition is established by the valid knowledge of reflexive awareness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gzung bar bya ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gzung bar bya ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: But the object of the eye consciousness is not established by that.

original: 'di ni mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mig gi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba ste /
translated: This is the object of the eye consciousness.

original: don gyi chos yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi chos yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the property of the object.

original: mngon sum du yang pha rol po rnams kyis 'dod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du yang pha rol po rnams kyis 'dod do zhes pa'o //
translated: and also directly, as the opponent himself accepts.

original: de ltar pha rol pos kun du brtags pa'i spyi ni dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir na de'i ngo bo ma yin pa las log pa'i dngos po tsam kho na spyir bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar pha rol pos kun du brtags pa'i spyi ni dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir na de'i ngo bo ma yin pa las log pa'i dngos po tsam kho na spyir bshad do //
translated: Thus, since the universal imagined by the opponent cannot withstand analysis, it is only a mere thing, the negation of the absence of that nature, that is called a universal.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad ni pha rol pos kun brtags pa'i spyi yis stong par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad ni pha rol pos kun brtags pa'i spyi yis stong par gnas so //
translated: Therefore, all conditioned things are empty of the universal imagined by the opponent.

original: blo dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis nye bar bkod pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis nye bar bkod pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are not even posited by some intelligent person.

original: de ltar ni 'gro ba 'di'i byed pa por gyur pa rtag pa 'am mi rtag par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gro ba 'di'i byed pa por gyur pa rtag pa 'am mi rtag par 'gyur grang /
translated: In this way, is the creator of this world permanent or impermanent?

original: de la re zhig rtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not logical that it is permanent.

original: byed pa po dang 'brel ba brtags par gyur na /
analyzed: byed pa po dang 'brel ba brtags par gyur na /
translated: If it were related to a creator,

original: spros pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams nges pa cig car ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams nges pa cig car ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then creation, endurance, and destruction would definitely occur simultaneously.

original: ngo bo gang gis gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gi byed pa po yin pa de'i ngo bo spro ba'i dus na yang nye ba'o zhes pas de'i dus kho na na gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gang gis gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag gi byed pa po yin pa de'i ngo bo spro ba'i dus na yang nye ba'o zhes pas de'i dus kho na na gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of that which is the agent of endurance and destruction is present at the time of creation, so endurance and destruction would occur at that time alone.

original: lhan cig byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not an agent because it is devoid of cooperating conditions,

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: rtag pa yin pas na 'di ni nam yang lhan cig byed pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yin pas na 'di ni nam yang lhan cig byed pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
translated: Since it is permanent, it is never devoid of cooperating conditions,

original: thams cad kyi tshe nye ba @362b nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe nye ba @362b nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is always present.

original: lhan cig byed pa mi rtag pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa mi rtag pa dang bral ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it devoid of impermanent cooperating conditions,

original: lhan cig byed pa mi rtag pa yang de la rag las nas skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa mi rtag pa yang de la rag las nas skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because impermanent cooperating conditions arise in dependence on it.

original: de'i phyir dus gcig tu thams cad byed pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gcig tu thams cad byed pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that everything would be produced at once.

original: dbang phyug ni blo dang ldan pa'i phyir skyon 'di yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni blo dang ldan pa'i phyir skyon 'di yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this fault not present for you because you say that ƒ™≈õvara is intelligent?

original: blo yis stong pa ni rang yod pa nyid tsam gyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu rim pa min pa kho nas byed kyi /
analyzed: blo yis stong pa ni rang yod pa nyid tsam gyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu rim pa min pa kho nas byed kyi /
translated: The emptiness of the mind is the mere existence of the mind itself. It is the cause of the effect that is produced by the mind itself alone.

original: blo dang ldan pa ni bya ba byed par dbang 'byor ba yin yang mi 'dod pa na byed pa ma yin zhes pas /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni bya ba byed par dbang 'byor ba yin yang mi 'dod pa na byed pa ma yin zhes pas /
translated: The intelligent one, who is a master of the performance of actions, does not perform what is not desired.

original: de nye bar dmigs pa ci zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nye bar dmigs pa ci zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: What is the object observed in this case?

original: 'dod pa de rnams kyang rang nyid yod pa nyid tsam gyi rgyu can yin pas cis byed pa ma yin na zhes pas de kho na 'di nye bar dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa de rnams kyang rang nyid yod pa nyid tsam gyi rgyu can yin pas cis byed pa ma yin na zhes pas de kho na 'di nye bar dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that those desired things are caused by the mere existence of the mind itself. If they are not produced by that, then that is the object observed in this case.

original: ci ste rang gi ngo bos nus pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi glo bur ba'i nus pas med par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di kho na de'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rang gi ngo bos nus pa nyid yin na yang lhan cig byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi glo bur ba'i nus pas med par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa 'di kho na de'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that even if it is inherently capable, it is not made incapable by a temporary capability characterized by a cooperating condition, then this alone is its nature.

original: de lta na khyed la mar gyur pa yang de yin la rang bzhin gyis mo gsham yang yin pa'i 'di brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni gang ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na khyed la mar gyur pa yang de yin la rang bzhin gyis mo gsham yang yin pa'i 'di brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di ni gang ci yang ma yin no //
translated: In that case, this [assertion] of yours would be a topic of discussion, namely, that a mother is a barren woman by nature.

original: 'o na 'di kho na 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'o na 'di kho na 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Well then, this is the nature of the effect,

original: nus pa 'ba' zhig pa las skye ba ma yin gyi lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas phyis 'byung ba'o zhe na ;
analyzed: nus pa 'ba' zhig pa las skye ba ma yin gyi lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas phyis 'byung ba'o zhe na ;
translated: but it does not arise from mere potential, but rather later, in dependence on the cooperating conditions.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: nus pa ni 'bras bu la ltos pa la ma reg pa'i stobs kho na las 'bras bu byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa ni 'bras bu la ltos pa la ma reg pa'i stobs kho na las 'bras bu byed par 'gyur te /
translated: because the potential would only produce the effect by the power of not touching the effect that depends on it.

original: gzhan du na nus pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na nus pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it is not a potential at all.

original: rtag par rim gyis 'bras bur byed do zhes pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag par rim gyis 'bras bur byed do zhes pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that it produces the effect gradually and permanently,

original: stos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it would be without dependence.üîΩWhat is well known to the famous one who pervades the entire region,

original: phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par khyab pa'i grags pa can gyis gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par khyab pa'i grags pa can gyis gang gsungs pa /
translated: he said:

original: rtag pa ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrim gyis skyed par byed pa dang / byed dang mi byed dus rtag tu //
analyzed: rtag pa ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro // rim gyis skyed par byed pa dang / byed dang mi byed dus rtag tu //
translated: because a permanent thing is not dependent.

original: 'dra ba'i bdag nyid byed pa 'gal //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i bdag nyid byed pa 'gal //
translated: It is contradictory for a permanent thing to be an agent,üîΩbecause it is contradictory for a permanent thing to be an agent.

original: zhes so // 'dis ni bdag la sogs pa rtag pa rnams dang / skad cig pa yin pa'i bum pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa'ang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // 'dis ni bdag la sogs pa rtag pa rnams dang / skad cig pa yin pa'i bum pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'bras bu byed pa'ang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains that permanent things such as a self and impermanent things such as a pot that arise in sequence are agents.

original: 'di la mngon sum dang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la mngon sum dang 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction with direct perception in this case,

original: mngon sum gyi skad cig pa ma yin pa 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi skad cig pa ma yin pa 'dzin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable for direct perception to apprehend an impermanent thing.

original: mngon sum skad cig pas ni skad @363a * //
analyzed: mngon sum skad cig pas ni skad @363a * //
translated: Direct perception is momentary,

original: cig ma yin pa lta bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cig ma yin pa lta bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: and it is not possible for it to see an impermanent thing.

original: skad cig gcig pa yis bya ba can ma yin pa ni skad cig pa ma yin pa yin zhing /
analyzed: skad cig gcig pa yis bya ba can ma yin pa ni skad cig pa ma yin pa yin zhing /
translated: That which is not an activity of a single moment is not momentary.

original: de ji ltar skad cig gcig par 'byung ba'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin par nus /
analyzed: de ji ltar skad cig gcig par 'byung ba'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin par nus /
translated: How can it be apprehended by direct perception that occurs in a single moment?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs ni da ltar gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs ni da ltar gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: The prior and subsequent states are not clear in the present.

original: de yang da ltar byung ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang da ltar byung ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be present.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag gi mtshams so sor snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pas na /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag gi mtshams so sor snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pas na /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the boundaries of arising and ceasing would appear distinct.

original: mngon sum 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus la khyab pa'i don cung zad gzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum 'di ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus la khyab pa'i don cung zad gzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: This direct perception cannot apprehend the object that is pervaded by the prior and subsequent times.

original: 'dis ni ngo shes pa mngon sum nyid spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo shes pa mngon sum nyid spangs pa yin no //
translated: This refutes the fact that recognition is direct perception.

original: don mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: don mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: A consciousness that perceives an object is direct perception.

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs ni da ltar mngon du bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs ni da ltar mngon du bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The prior state is not something that is perceived at the present time;

original: 'on kyang dran par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dran par bya ba'o //
translated: rather, it is remembered.

original: dran pa'i ngo bo yang mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa'i ngo bo yang mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: The nature of memory is not direct perception.

original: ci ste 'di gal te dran par 'dod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di gal te dran par 'dod par 'gyur na /
translated: If you claim that it is memory,

original: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not the present state that is perceived.

original: de mngon du byed pa'i 'jug pa 'di ni dran pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin //
analyzed: de mngon du byed pa'i 'jug pa 'di ni dran pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin //
translated: How can the engagement that perceives that be called memory?

original: bhaddas gang smras pa /
analyzed: bhaddas gang smras pa /
translated: BhƒÅviveka says:

original: sngon du gzhal zin tsam la ni //
analyzed: sngon du gzhal zin tsam la ni //
translated: It is just like the case of the previously perceived object.

original: de'o zhes dran pa skye bar 'gyur //üîΩde nyid 'di'o zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de'o zhes dran pa skye bar 'gyur // de nyid 'di'o zhes pa ni //
translated: The memory arises, ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: ngo shes pa las tha dad bral //
analyzed: ngo shes pa las tha dad bral //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the very same‚Äù is not different from recognition.

original: zhes so // de'i tshe ngo shes pa ni dran pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i tshe ngo shes pa ni dran pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur gyi /
translated: At that time, recognition is the essence of the memory that apprehends.

original: 'dzin pa'i ngo bo kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i ngo bo kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the essence of apprehension,

original: dran par bya ba la 'dzin pa mi rung zhing gzung bar bya ba la yang dran pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran par bya ba la 'dzin pa mi rung zhing gzung bar bya ba la yang dran pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable to apprehend what is remembered, and it is not suitable to remember what is apprehended.

original: gcig la dran pa dang 'dzin pa dag srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la dran pa dang 'dzin pa dag srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that memory and apprehension are possible in one thing,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually exclusive.

original: ngo bo gang gis dran pa yin pa'i ngo bo des 'dzin pa yin par skyon pa ma yin pas smra bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo gang gis dran pa yin pa'i ngo bo des 'dzin pa yin par skyon pa ma yin pas smra bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say that the essence by which there is memory is the essence by which there is apprehension, because it is not correct.

original: 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gzhan gyis gcig la dran pa dang 'dzin pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gzhan gyis gcig la dran pa dang 'dzin pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case that memory and apprehension are in one thing by means of a different essence of apprehension.

original: yod na yang mngon sum dang mngon sum yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na yang mngon sum dang mngon sum yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, it would be perception and nonperception.

original: dran bzhin ba na mngon sum kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dran bzhin ba na mngon sum kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: When one remembers, it is not just perception,

original: mngon sum du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable to perceive it.

original: de'i phyir ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa ni 'khrul ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa ni 'khrul ba kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of recognition is just mistaken,

original: yul med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the object does not exist.

original: sbyor ba yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The syllogism is as follows:

original: gang zhig ngo shes pas rtogs pa de ni de kho na nyid du na /
analyzed: gang zhig ngo shes pas rtogs pa de ni de kho na nyid du na /
translated: That which is cognized by recognition is not in reality

original: dmigs pa gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: a single observation,

original: dper na bcad pa slar skye ba'i rtsva la sogs pa rnams la @363b bzhin /
analyzed: dper na bcad pa slar skye ba'i rtsva la sogs pa rnams la @363b bzhin /
translated: like, for example, grass, etc., that is cut and then grows again.üîΩThe cognition that this blue, etc. is that blue, etc. is a cognition by recognition.

original: sngon po la sogs pa 'di de kho na yin no zhes pa'i rtogs pa 'di yang ngo shes pas rtogs pa yin no zhes pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa 'di de kho na yin no zhes pa'i rtogs pa 'di yang ngo shes pas rtogs pa yin no zhes pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: Because of the contradiction, the pervasion is observed.

original: gcig nyid dang gcig ma yin pa nyid dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig nyid dang gcig ma yin pa nyid dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because being one and not being one are mutually exclusive,

original: de'i yul can gyi rang rig pa dag kyang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi rang rig pa dag kyang 'gal ba'o //
translated: the two reflexive awarenesses that have them as their objects are also mutually exclusive.

original: des na gcig tu dmigs pa dang 'gal ba gcig ma yin rjes su dpag pa las gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig tu dmigs pa dang 'gal ba gcig ma yin rjes su dpag pa las gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the contradiction with the observation of oneness is the harm from inference.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i rtogs pa la khyab po zhes pas /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i rtogs pa la khyab po zhes pas /
translated: The observation of oneness is the harm from the perception of sound and so on.

original: ngo shes pa ni skad cig pa'i rjes su dpag pa las gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni skad cig pa'i rjes su dpag pa las gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The recognition is the harm from the inference of momentariness.

original: sgra la sogs pa rnams la yang spyi la dmigs pa nyid kyis dmigs pa gcig pa yang ma yin te skra la sogs pa'i gsal ba kho na la ngo shes par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa rnams la yang spyi la dmigs pa nyid kyis dmigs pa gcig pa yang ma yin te skra la sogs pa'i gsal ba kho na la ngo shes par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Also, with respect to sound and so on, there is no observation of oneness by the observation of universals, because it is the recognition of only the individual hairs and so on.

original: spyi la ngo shes pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi la ngo shes pa yin no //
translated: The recognition is of the universal.

original: de nyid skra la sogs pa de kho na 'di yin no zhes par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de nyid skra la sogs pa de kho na 'di yin no zhes par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were that very hair and so on, it would be that very one.

original: de nyid skra la sogs pa 'di yin no zhes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid skra la sogs pa 'di yin no zhes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that very one, the hair and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa dmigs pa gcig pa can nyid yin na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa dmigs pa gcig pa can nyid yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the recognition is one that observes oneness,

original: rim pa dang cig shos dag gis skye ba 'gal ba'i phyir na 'gal ba dang ma nges pa nyid du dogs par bya ba dag ma yin no //
analyzed: rim pa dang cig shos dag gis skye ba 'gal ba'i phyir na 'gal ba dang ma nges pa nyid du dogs par bya ba dag ma yin no //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to be produced by both a sequential and a non-sequential cause.

original: ngo shes pa kho na rnam par 'jog pa po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa kho na rnam par 'jog pa po yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that recognition alone is the positer,

original: de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that itself cannot withstand analysis.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa byed pa po med do zhes pa 'di ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa byed pa po med do zhes pa 'di ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that there is no permanent creator.

original: gal te rtag pa'i byed pa po 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin na 'o na 'di'i rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa'i byed pa po 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin na 'o na 'di'i rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: If a permanent creator is not the cause of the world, what is its cause?

original: sems can rnams kyi rgyu ni dge ba zhes bya ba'i las yin no ;
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rgyu ni dge ba zhes bya ba'i las yin no ;
translated: The cause of sentient beings is the karma called ‚Äúvirtuous.‚Äù

original: / ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: / ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: sems can 'jig rten de nas snod kyi 'jig rten ni //
analyzed: sems can 'jig rten de nas snod kyi 'jig rten ni //
translated: Sentient beings and the world of their container

original: shin tu bkra ba sems nyid kho nas bkod //
analyzed: shin tu bkra ba sems nyid kho nas bkod //
translated: are created by the mind alone.

original: 'gro ba ma lus las las skyes par bshad pa ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus las las skyes par bshad pa ni //
translated: It is taught that all of the world arises from karma,

original: sems ma gtogs par las kyang yod pa min //
analyzed: sems ma gtogs par las kyang yod pa min //
translated: but there is no karma apart from the mind.

original: zhes so // bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs la brten nas slar yang bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs la brten nas slar yang bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: In dependence on the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system, the Bhagavat, the Omniscient One, said:

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
translated: Space and the two cessations

original: 'dus ma byas gsum rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gsum rtag pa'o //
translated: Are the three unconditioned things that are permanent.

original: skad cig pa kun 'dus byas te //
analyzed: skad cig pa kun 'dus byas te //
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.

original: bdag gis stong zhing byed pa med //
analyzed: bdag gis stong zhing byed pa med //
translated: They are empty and without a self.

original: ces so // 'o na thams cad mkhyen pa grub na ni de'i gsungs nges par ston par rigs mod /
analyzed: ces so // 'o na thams cad mkhyen pa grub na ni de'i gsungs nges par ston par rigs mod /
translated: If omniscience is established, then it is correct to teach it.

original: @364a * // thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa'i ched du tshad ma ci yod ce na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: @364a * // thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa'i ched du tshad ma ci yod ce na brjod par bya ste /
translated: But what is the valid knowledge that establishes omniscience?

original: gang dang gang gus pa dang bcas par bar med par dus ring por goms par byas pa'i sems kyi yon tan de thams cad ni gsal bar 'gyur bar rung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang gus pa dang bcas par bar med par dus ring por goms par byas pa'i sems kyi yon tan de thams cad ni gsal bar 'gyur bar rung ba yin te /
translated: It should be said: All mental qualities that are cultivated with respect and without interruption for a long time become clear and suitable to manifest.

original: dper na skyes bu 'dod pa can gyi gzhon nu ma'i rnam pa bzhin 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can gyi rnam pa 'di 'di rnams kyang ji skad bshad pa bzhin goms par byas pa'i sems kyi yon tan yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so
analyzed: dper na skyes bu 'dod pa can gyi gzhon nu ma'i rnam pa bzhin 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can gyi rnam pa 'di 'di rnams kyang ji skad bshad pa bzhin goms par byas pa'i sems kyi yon tan yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so
translated: For example, like the form of a young woman for a lustful man, these aspects of the subject that has the four noble truths as its object are qualities of the mind that are cultivated in the way that has been explained. This is a natural inference.

original: // re zhig rten gyi sgo nas sam gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas ma grub pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: // re zhig rten gyi sgo nas sam gtan tshigs kyi sgo nas ma grub pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible that the subject is not established from the point of view of the basis or from the point of view of the reason.

original: kun du rtog pa la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can gyi rnam pa chos can rnams dang gtan tshigs sems kyi yon tan tsam ni so sor rang gis rig par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can gyi rnam pa chos can rnams dang gtan tshigs sems kyi yon tan tsam ni so sor rang gis rig par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The subject, the aspects of the subject that has the four noble truths as its object, which are based on conceptual thought, and the reason, which is merely a quality of the mind, are to be known by each one individually.

original: 'di ni 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not contradictory.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'i rnam pa la srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs 'dod pa'i rnam pa la srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is possible in the concordant class, in the aspects of desire.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not uncertain.

original: goms pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi yon tan dang gsal bar snang ba dag gi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po dag ni rdza mkhan dang bum bdag gi bzhin du /
analyzed: goms pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi yon tan dang gsal bar snang ba dag gi 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po dag ni rdza mkhan dang bum bdag gi bzhin du /
translated: The relationship of effect to cause between the qualities of the mind that is accompanied by habituation and the clear appearance is like that between the potter and the pot.

original: thams cad nye bar bsdus pas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa las 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po grub pa na /
analyzed: thams cad nye bar bsdus pas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa las 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po grub pa na /
translated: When the relationship of effect to cause is established by direct perception and non-apprehension,

original: sgrub par byed pa goms pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi chos la gsal bar snang bar byar rung bas khyab par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa goms pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi chos la gsal bar snang bar byar rung bas khyab par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is established that the quality of the mind that is accompanied by habituation is pervaded by the clear appearance.

original: de ltar ni khyab pa'i gzhi 'dod pas gzir bar 'jug pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ni khyab pa'i gzhi 'dod pas gzir bar 'jug pa la /
translated: In this way, the proponent of the pervasion is forced to accept

original: gzhon nu ma'i rnam pa la gus pa dang bcas par bar med par dus ring por goms pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi yon tan las sngar gsal bar snang ba ma dmigs shing /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i rnam pa la gus pa dang bcas par bar med par dus ring por goms pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyi yon tan las sngar gsal bar snang ba ma dmigs shing /
translated: that the qualities of the mind that is accompanied by habituation with regard to the image of a young woman, which is accompanied by respect, which is uninterrupted, and which is long-lasting, do not previously have a clear appearance.

original: phyis goms pa yang dag par rig pa las gsal bar snang ba yang dag par rig pa'o zhes pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis gsal bar snang ba dang goms pa'i khyad par gyi sems kyi rnam pa dag 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos poüîΩbsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis goms pa yang dag par rig pa las gsal bar snang ba yang dag par rig pa'o zhes pa mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyis gsal bar snang ba dang goms pa'i khyad par gyi sems kyi rnam pa dag 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The clear appearance and the special mental aspects of familiarity through the three types of direct perception and non-observation are established as the effect and cause.

original: de ltar thams cad nye bar bsdus pa dang ldan pa'i khyab pa grub pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad nye bar bsdus pa dang ldan pa'i khyab pa grub pa de'i phyir na /
translated: Thus, the pervasion that includes everything is established. Therefore,

original: ma nges pa nyid med pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kha na ma thob med pa'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid med pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kha na ma thob med pa'o //
translated: since there is no uncertainty, the reason is without fault.

original: 'o na sgrub par byed pa 'dis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa @364b rnams mngon sum du byed pa las 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon du byed pa po brjod par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub mod /
analyzed: 'o na sgrub par byed pa 'dis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa @364b rnams mngon sum du byed pa las 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon du byed pa po brjod par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub mod /
translated: Well, by this proof, since the aspects of the four noble truths are actualized, the one who actualizes the four noble truths, the omniscient one who is the object of assertion, is established.

original: khyab par du chos thams cad mngon du byed pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir de 'grub pa'i ched du sgrub par byed pa gzhan brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: khyab par du chos thams cad mngon du byed pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir de 'grub pa'i ched du sgrub par byed pa gzhan brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: But it does not make all phenomena manifest, therefore, another proof must be stated in order to establish that.

original: brjod par bya ba ste ;üîΩgang tshad mas mi slu bar nges pa'i don can gyi tshig de ni don de mngon du byed pa'i shes pa dngos sam /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ste ; gang tshad mas mi slu bar nges pa'i don can gyi tshig de ni don de mngon du byed pa'i shes pa dngos sam /
translated: The statement

original: brgyud pas sngon du song ba yin te /
analyzed: brgyud pas sngon du song ba yin te /
translated: is that which has the meaning of being ascertained by valid knowledge to be non-deceptive. That is because that word is the direct or indirect antecedent of the consciousness that makes that object manifest.

original: dper na me sreg par byed do zhes pa'i tshig bzhin /
analyzed: dper na me sreg par byed do zhes pa'i tshig bzhin /
translated: For example, the word ‚Äúfire‚Äù is a reason that is the effect of the object.

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa yin no zhes pa'i tshig 'di yang tshad mas mi slu bar nges pa'i don can yin no zhes pa don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa yin no zhes pa'i tshig 'di yang tshad mas mi slu bar nges pa'i don can yin no zhes pa don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a reason that is the effect of the object.

original: 'di ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not unestablished,

original: chos thams cad skad cig gis 'jig pa sgrub par byed pa las tshig 'di bden pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad skad cig gis 'jig pa sgrub par byed pa las tshig 'di bden pa'i don can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because this word has the meaning of being true, from the proof that all phenomena are momentary.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,üîΩbecause

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in a concordant side.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate,

original: tshig tsam po the tshom dang phyin ci log sngon ma can nyid na yang /
analyzed: tshig tsam po the tshom dang phyin ci log sngon ma can nyid na yang /
translated: because even though mere words are preceded by doubt and error,

original: tshad mas nges pa'i don can ni /
analyzed: tshad mas nges pa'i don can ni /
translated: that which has a meaning ascertained by a valid cognition

original: dngos sam brgyud pas /
analyzed: dngos sam brgyud pas /
translated: is either directly or indirectly

original: de'i don de mngon du byed pa'i shes pa sngon ma can du mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don de mngon du byed pa'i shes pa sngon ma can du mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gi nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: preceded by a consciousness that perceives its object, because of the perception of direct perception and non-apprehension.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na du ba la sogs pa yang rigs pa dor bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na du ba la sogs pa yang rigs pa dor bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that even smoke and such would be abandoned by reasoning.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu ma lus pa rgyun chad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu ma lus pa rgyun chad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow, absurdly, that the entire continuum of cause and effect would be severed.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi srid pa du ma brgyud pa'i mtshan nyid can dus ring pos 'byung bar bya ba kun du rtog pa la gnas pa'i gsal bar snang ba nyid srid pa 'gyur ba srid par brgyud pa 'grub pa'i ched du tshad ma ci yod na
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi srid pa du ma brgyud pa'i mtshan nyid can dus ring pos 'byung bar bya ba kun du rtog pa la gnas pa'i gsal bar snang ba nyid srid pa 'gyur ba srid par brgyud pa 'grub pa'i ched du tshad ma ci yod na
translated: It may be so, but what valid cognition is there to establish the existence of a continuum of lives that is characterized by the passage of many lives and that is to be brought about by a long period of time, a continuum of lives that is based on the conception of I and that appears as a single, clear entity?

original: ce na / brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ce na / brjod par bya ste /
translated: If you ask why, it is because

original: gang sems yin pa de sems phyi ma mtshams sbyor te /
analyzed: gang sems yin pa de sems phyi ma mtshams sbyor te /
translated: whatever is a mind is a mind that connects to a subsequent mind,

original: dper na da ltar gyi sems bzhin /
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi sems bzhin /
translated: just like the present mind.

original: 'chi ba'i dus na 'byung ba yang sems yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so ;
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus na 'byung ba yang sems yin no zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so ;
translated: At the time of death, the mind that arises is also a mind. This is a reason of nature.

original: / dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems kyi 'khrul ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems kyi 'khrul ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The final mind of an arhat is not mistaken,

original: de ni lung tsam las grags pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de ni lung tsam las grags pa nyid kyi phyir ram /
translated: because it is renowned merely from scripture,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems gzhan skyed par byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems gzhan skyed par byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it generates another mind that is free of affliction,

original: gtan tshigs la nyon mongs pa yod na zhes khyad par dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs la nyon mongs pa yod na zhes khyad par dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because the reason is qualified by the phrase ‚Äúif it has affliction.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa grub bo //üîΩ@365a * // 'dir skye ba snga ma'i goms pa las dka' thub dang spyin pa dang klog pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa grub bo // @365a * // 'dir skye ba snga ma'i goms pa las dka' thub dang spyin pa dang klog pa la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus future existence is established.

original: sems can rnams kyi goms pa la 'jug go zhes rab tu smra ste /
