analyzed: sems can rnams kyi goms pa la 'jug go zhes rab tu smra ste /
translated: Here, it is said that the engagement of sentient beings in austerities, generosity, recitation, and so on is due to the imprints of previous lives.

original: des na de sgrub pa'i ched du 'ang tshad ma brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des na de sgrub pa'i ched du 'ang tshad ma brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to establish that, a valid cognition is stated:

original: gang sems yin pa de sems gzhan sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: gang sems yin pa de sems gzhan sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: Whatever is a mind is preceded by another mind,

original: dper na da ltar gyi sems bzhin /
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi sems bzhin /
translated: like the present mind.

original: skye ba'i dus na 'byung ba yang sems yin no zhes pa don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skye ba'i dus na 'byung ba yang sems yin no zhes pa don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: At the time of arising, the element is also mind. This is a reason of effect.

original: 'o na de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa las grol ba yin zhing /
analyzed: 'o na de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa las grol ba yin zhing /
translated: Now, is liberation from the realization of reality,

original: de kho na nyid kyang gcig kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang gcig kho na ma yin nam /
translated: and is reality not just one?

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: stong nyid lta bas grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong nyid lta bas grol bar 'gyur //
translated: Liberation is by seeing emptiness.

original: bsgoms pa lhag ma de don yin //
analyzed: bsgoms pa lhag ma de don yin //
translated: The remaining meditations are for that purpose.

original: zhes so // des na thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gnyis dang / sangs rgyas pa'i dbye ba yang ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // des na thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa gnyis dang / sangs rgyas pa'i dbye ba yang ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that there are two types of omniscience and the division of buddhas?

original: 'di skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skyon ma yin te /
translated: This is not a fault,

original: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad ni yang dag pa'i don la sems rnams gzhug pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad ni yang dag pa'i don la sems rnams gzhug pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: because all of this was taught by the BhagavƒÅn in order to introduce minds to the correct meaning.

original: de ltar ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa /
analyzed: de ltar ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi 'dod pa /
translated: Thus, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert:

original: mkha' dang 'gog pa gnyis dag ste //
analyzed: mkha' dang 'gog pa gnyis dag ste //
translated: Space and the two cessations

original: rtag pa gsum gyis 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: rtag pa gsum gyis 'dus ma byas //
translated: are the three unconditioned things.üîΩAll conditioned things are momentary,

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig dang // bdag med byed pa po nyid med //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig dang // bdag med byed pa po nyid med //
translated: without self, and not creators.

original: dbang skyes blo ni rnam med kyi //
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni rnam med kyi //
translated: The mind arisen from the sense organ

original: rdul phran ba sogs pa dngos su rig / ces so //
analyzed: rdul phran ba sogs pa dngos su rig / ces so //
translated: directly cognizes the atom and so on.

original: mdo sde ba rnams kyi 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: mdo sde ba rnams kyi 'dod pa ni //
translated: The SautrƒÅntikas assert:

original: 'di kun shes pa kho na ste //
analyzed: 'di kun shes pa kho na ste //
translated: All this is cognition only.

original: sdo sogs pa rnam pa so sor snang //
analyzed: sdo sogs pa rnam pa so sor snang //
translated: The appearance of forms and so on is individual cognitions.

original: phyi rol don ni ma yin te //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni ma yin te //
translated: External objects do not exist.

original: bems po rab gsal mi rigs phyir //
analyzed: bems po rab gsal mi rigs phyir //
translated: It is illogical for the insentient to be clear.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa ;
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa ;
translated: As it is said:

original: rang rnam can shes skyed byed pa /
analyzed: rang rnam can shes skyed byed pa /
translated: That which produces a cognition with its aspect

original: dbang po'i spyod yul snad rung min //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul snad rung min //
translated: is not the domain of the sense organs.

original: zhes so // rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The Ornament of the Middle Way also says:

original: gal te sngon po rig bya na /
analyzed: gal te sngon po rig bya na /
translated: If it is the object of awareness of blue,

original: de ni phyi rol ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol ji ltar brjod //
translated: how can it be said to be external?

original: gal te sngon po'i rig bya min //
analyzed: gal te sngon po'i rig bya min //
translated: If it is not the object of awareness of blue,

original: de ni phyi rol ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol ji ltar brjod //
translated: how can it be said to be external?

original: ces so // 'o na gal te rab tu gsal bzhin pa 'di shes pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes pa ci las she na phyi rol gyi don ni ldog pa las 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ces so // 'o na gal te rab tu gsal bzhin pa 'di shes pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes pa ci las she na phyi rol gyi don ni ldog pa las 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If this vivid appearance is consciousness itself, then how do you know that external objects exist?

original: gang phyir thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams rab tu gsal ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: gang phyir thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams rab tu gsal ba ma yin zhing //
translated: External objects are established by exclusion, because the aspects of blue, etc. are not always and everywhere vivid.

original: 'di @365b rang gi nye bar len pa tsam las nges par snang ba nyid du gyur na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di @365b rang gi nye bar len pa tsam las nges par snang ba nyid du gyur na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that this consciousness appears as an object by the power of its own conditions alone,

original: yul nges pa la 'jug pa'i mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nges pa la 'jug pa'i mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unreasonable that it engage with a determined object.

original: de'i phyir 'di rnams la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i rgyu gang gi stobs kyis 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'byung ba yin pa cung zad cig yod do zhes nges par bcad par nus la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rnams la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen tha dad pa'i rgyu gang gi stobs kyis 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'byung ba yin pa cung zad cig yod do zhes nges par bcad par nus la /
translated: Therefore, it is possible to ascertain that these [aspects] arise at some time and in some place by the power of some cause that is a different immediately preceding condition.

original: de kho na phyi rol gyi don yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na phyi rol gyi don yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: That [cause] is precisely the external object.

original: phyi rol gyi don 'di ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don 'di ni /
translated: This external object

original: yan lag can dang yon tan la sogs pa'i chos rdzas la brten pa pha rol pos mngon par 'dod pa rnams dang rdzas rnam pa dgu dang / rdul phran rnams kyang ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can dang yon tan la sogs pa'i chos rdzas la brten pa pha rol pos mngon par 'dod pa rnams dang rdzas rnam pa dgu dang / rdul phran rnams kyang ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The parts, qualities, etc., which are substances, are not the nine kinds of substances, as the opponent maintains.

original: de la re zhig yon tan la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig yon tan la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, they are not qualities, etc.,

original: rdzas bkag pas de rnams kyang khegs pa'i phyir dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rdzas med na 'phrod pa 'du ba yang med do zhes pa de sun dbyung ba la 'dir gus par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas bkag pas de rnams kyang khegs pa'i phyir dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba can gyi rdzas med na 'phrod pa 'du ba yang med do zhes pa de sun dbyung ba la 'dir gus par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: because they are refuted by the refutation of substance, and because if there is no substance that is a collection of the parts, there is no collection of the parts.

original: rdzas kyang sa dang chu dan me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang bdag dang yid ces pa rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyang sa dang chu dan me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang bdag dang yid ces pa rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Substance is of nine kinds: earth, water, fire, air, space, time, direction, self, and mind.

original: de la bdag dgag pa'i ched du 'di yang sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bdag dgag pa'i ched du 'di yang sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, this is also a proof for the refutation of self.

original: gang res 'ga' ba'i shes pa po yin pa de ni res 'ga' ba'i rgyu sngon ma can yin te /
analyzed: gang res 'ga' ba'i shes pa po yin pa de ni res 'ga' ba'i rgyu sngon ma can yin te /
translated: That which is an intermittent cognizer has an intermittent cause that precedes it.

original: dpe na legs par dul ba can gyi shes pa bzhin //
analyzed: dpe na legs par dul ba can gyi shes pa bzhin //
translated: Like the cognition of one who is well-disciplined.

original: nga rgyal gyi shes pa yang res 'ga' ba yin no zhes pa don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi shes pa yang res 'ga' ba yin no zhes pa don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition of pride is also occasional. This is a reason based on effect.

original: 'di ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not unestablished.

original: chos can nga rgyal la shes pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa yid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can nga rgyal la shes pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa yid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of the subject, pride, is established by perception.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid kyi khyad par ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid kyi khyad par ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the qualification ‚Äúoccasional‚Äù unestablished.

original: thams cad kyi tshe'o zhes pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe'o zhes pa'i shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cognition of ‚Äúat all times.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te mthun phyogs la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te mthun phyogs la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there contradiction, because it is seen in the similar instance.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it uncertain.

original: du ba dang med pa bzhin du 'ga'i shes pa dang res 'ga'i rgyu can dag gi mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba dang med pa bzhin du 'ga'i shes pa dang res 'ga'i rgyu can dag gi mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like smoke and non-existence, the pervasion is established by perception and non-apprehension of the cognition of some and the cognition of occasional.

original: ces 'ga' ba'i shes pa yang res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i rgyus skye na res 'ga' ba'i rgyu las mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces 'ga' ba'i shes pa yang res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i rgyus skye na res 'ga' ba'i rgyu las mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the consciousness of the occasional were produced by a cause that is not occasional, it follows that it would not be produced by an occasional cause.

original: nges pa med pa'i rgyu can rnams la yang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i rgyu can rnams la yang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it has a cause that is not definite, it follows that it would be without a cause.

original: de bzhin du 'di ma nges pa nyid na @366a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ma nges pa nyid na @366a * //
translated: In the same way, if it is indefinite,

original: rab tu grags pa'i du ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i du ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: then the reason, such as smoke, that is well known

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is indefinite, because there is no difference.

original: gzhan yang ngar byed pa ni res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i rgyu sngon ma can nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngar byed pa ni res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i rgyu sngon ma can nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the agent has a cause that is not occasional,

original: rtag pa kho nar 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa kho nar 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that it would occur only permanently.

original: rgyu ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because the cause is just the nature of the agent,

original: byed pa ma yin pa yang nye bar brtags pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa dang byed pa ma yin pa dag gcig pa nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa ma yin pa yang nye bar brtags pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa dang byed pa ma yin pa dag gcig pa nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and because the nonagent is just the cause that is imagined, the agent and the nonagent are not the same.

original: yod na yang byed pa yang mi byed pa yin pa 'ongs te /
analyzed: yod na yang byed pa yang mi byed pa yin pa 'ongs te /
translated: If it does exist, then it would not be a non-agent,

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because its nature is that of an agent.

original: gzhan yang ngar byed pa ni res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i rgyu las skye ba na cig car kho nar 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngar byed pa ni res 'ga' ba ma yin pa'i rgyu las skye ba na cig car kho nar 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the self were the agent of the I-maker, then it would follow that the I-maker would arise from a cause that is not intermittent, and it would arise all at once,

original: tshogs pa ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the collection of causes would not be incomplete.

original: 'o na ngar byed pa'i dmigs pa bdag yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ngar byed pa'i dmigs pa bdag yin gyi rgyu ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the self is the object of the I-maker, not its cause.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni dmigs pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni dmigs pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: because it is not logical for that which is not a cause to be an object, and because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be the object of anything.

original: ci ste nam mkha' zhes bya ba dngos por gyur pa cung zad yod dam med ce na /
analyzed: ci ste nam mkha' zhes bya ba dngos por gyur pa cung zad yod dam med ce na /
translated: Now, does the so-called space exist as a thing or not?

original: 'di ni med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ni med pa kho na ste /
translated: It does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir gang du thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas yod pa der nam mkha' go skabs ster ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang du thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas yod pa der nam mkha' go skabs ster ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Because where there is an obstruction by a substantial thing, there is no space to be found.

original: gang du med pa der ni de med pa nyid kyi phyir go skabs grub pa'o zhes pas nam mkha'i ci zhig la go skabs spyin par byed /
analyzed: gang du med pa der ni de med pa nyid kyi phyir go skabs grub pa'o zhes pas nam mkha'i ci zhig la go skabs spyin par byed /
translated: Since it does not exist where it is not, space is established as an opportunity. But what opportunity does space give to what?

original: de'i phyir 'di yod na thams cad kyi tshe rnam pa thams cad la go skabs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yod na thams cad kyi tshe rnam pa thams cad la go skabs su 'gyur te /
translated: If it exists, it would be an opportunity for everything at all times.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not exist.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes kho bo cag gis rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes kho bo cag gis rtogs so //
translated: Therefore we understand that space definitely does not exist.

original: 'di yang bye brag tu smra ba'i 'dod pa la ltos nas sun dbyung ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bye brag tu smra ba'i 'dod pa la ltos nas sun dbyung ba bshad pa'o //
translated: This refutation is explained in terms of the assertions of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: pha rol po rnams kyis ni nam mkha' sgra'i yon tan can 'dod do //
analyzed: pha rol po rnams kyis ni nam mkha' sgra'i yon tan can 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that space is the quality of sound.

original: de yang gcig yin pa'o zhes pas na yul mtshungs pa can nyid kyi phyir sgra thams cad rnam pa tha dad pa can du thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gcig yin pa'o zhes pas na yul mtshungs pa can nyid kyi phyir sgra thams cad rnam pa tha dad pa can du thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is also one, all sounds would not be heard as distinct because they would have the same object.

original: des na shin tu nye ba'i yul bzhin du yul ring por mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra yang thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shin tu nye ba'i yul bzhin du yul ring por mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra yang thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like a very close object, a sound that is a distant object would also be heard.

original: yang na gzhan yang ma yin no zhes pas mtha' gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan yang ma yin no zhes pas mtha' gcig pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is not something else. Thus, it is one-sided.

original: phyogs dang dus dag gi yang gcig nyid kyi phyir shar dang nub la sogs pa rtogs @366b pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyogs dang dus dag gi yang gcig nyid kyi phyir shar dang nub la sogs pa rtogs @366b pa mi 'thad do //
translated: And because space and time are one, it is not tenable that there is an understanding of east and west, etc.

original: 'di ni yid brtag pa yang mi srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid brtag pa yang mi srid pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not possible to examine the mind in this way.

original: de ltar ni cig car shes pa mi skye bas de smra ba rnams kyi yid rjes su dpog par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar ni cig car shes pa mi skye bas de smra ba rnams kyi yid rjes su dpog par byed cing /
translated: Since consciousness does not arise simultaneously, the mind is inferred from speech.

original: gar la lta ba la sogs pa la cig car shes pa mang po rnams nyams su myong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gar la lta ba la sogs pa la cig car shes pa mang po rnams nyams su myong ba kho na'o //
translated: But many consciousnesses are experienced simultaneously in looking at a painting, etc.

original: gal te yang yid 'gyur ba na de'i tshe shes pa 'di rnams mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te yang yid 'gyur ba na de'i tshe shes pa 'di rnams mi rung ste /
translated: If the mind changes, then these consciousnesses are not tenable.

original: de'i phyir yid kyang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyang med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind does not exist.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams lhag mar lus la /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams lhag mar lus la /
translated: Earth, etc., remain as a remainder.

original: de rnams kyang yan lag can dang rdul phra rab kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
analyzed: de rnams kyang yan lag can dang rdul phra rab kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
translated: They are asserted to be of two types, gross and subtle, by way of the difference of whole and part.

original: de la gang yan lag can bum pa la sogs pa rdul phra rab rnams kyis rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas brtsams par rab tu grags pa de la /
analyzed: de la gang yan lag can bum pa la sogs pa rdul phra rab rnams kyis rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas brtsams par rab tu grags pa de la /
translated: In this regard, it is well known that a whole such as a pot is composed of atoms in stages beginning with two atoms.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni gnod par byed pa'o zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni gnod par byed pa'o zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that the non-apprehension of the characteristic of the object is the refutation.

original: gal te yan lag can med na 'o na 'di gcig nyid du snang ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can med na 'o na 'di gcig nyid du snang ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If the whole does not exist, then how is it that it appears as one?

original: tha dad pa thag nye bar gnas pa rnams kyi kho na de lta de ltar snang ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa thag nye bar gnas pa rnams kyi kho na de lta de ltar snang ste /
translated: It appears in that way because of the proximity of the different parts.

original: de dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig kho na slar yang dbye ba med pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig kho na slar yang dbye ba med pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that one who possesses them will again understand that they are not different.

original: 'o na tha dad par snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na tha dad pa'i phyogs dang / yul la khyad par rdul phra rab bsags pa so sor snang ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na tha dad par snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na tha dad pa'i phyogs dang / yul la khyad par rdul phra rab bsags pa so sor snang ba kho na'o //
translated: What is this so-called appearance of difference? It is the appearance of the individual accumulation of atoms in different directions and places.

original: gal te de lta na so sor snang ba'i chos ji ltar rags pa yin zhes chos mchog gi zhabs kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na so sor snang ba'i chos ji ltar rags pa yin zhes chos mchog gi zhabs kyis gsungs so //
translated: The revered DharmapƒÅla has said this.

original: de la yang don ni 'di kho na'o //
analyzed: de la yang don ni 'di kho na'o //
translated: And the meaning is just this.

original: don rang gi ngo bor myong ba ni med de /
analyzed: don rang gi ngo bor myong ba ni med de /
translated: There is no experience of the nature of an object.

original: don myong ba ni brtags par 'gyur //
analyzed: don myong ba ni brtags par 'gyur //
translated: The experience of an object is a conceptual construction.

original: zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: de'i phyir gang 'di sngon po la sogs pa so sor snang ba yul tha dad pa la khyab pa'i nyid nyams su myong ba 'di kho na rags pa'i snang ba'o zhes skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'di sngon po la sogs pa so sor snang ba yul tha dad pa la khyab pa'i nyid nyams su myong ba 'di kho na rags pa'i snang ba'o zhes skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of individual things such as blue, which is the experience of a pervasive object, is just the appearance of a coarse object.

original: gang yang bye brag pa rnams kyi de rtsom par byed pa rdul phra rab de rnams ni /üîΩbye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lta ba la dngos su mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi yin zhing /
analyzed: gang yang bye brag pa rnams kyi de rtsom par byed pa rdul phra rab de rnams ni / bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lta ba la dngos su mngon sum gyi spyod yul gyi yin zhing /
translated: The atoms that are the cause of the visual consciousness of blue, etc.,üîΩare the objects of direct perception in the view of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyi lugs la rang gi rnam pa gtong bar 'jug pa rnams te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyi lugs la rang gi rnam pa gtong bar 'jug pa rnams te /
translated: In the SautrƒÅntika system, they are the objects of inference because they give rise to their own aspects.

original: de rnams kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams kyi lta ba la srid pa ma yin no //üîΩnges par dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab cig grub pa @367a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams kyi lta ba la srid pa ma yin no // nges par dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab cig grub pa @367a * //
translated: But this is not possible in the theory of the YogƒÅcƒÅra.üîΩA central atom is not established in the middle,

original: pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is not tenable that it is in the middle.

original: de'i 'og dang steng dang phyogs bzhi rnams na rdul phra rab gnas pa'i nges pas cha shas drug pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og dang steng dang phyogs bzhi rnams na rdul phra rab gnas pa'i nges pas cha shas drug pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is in the middle, then it must have six parts, because it is certain that an atom is situated in the middle, below, above, and in the four directions.

original: gang 'di'i rang bzhin shar gyi rdul phra rab la nye ba de kho na nub kyi rdul phra rab la nye bar 'thad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'di'i rang bzhin shar gyi rdul phra rab la nye ba de kho na nub kyi rdul phra rab la nye bar 'thad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the nature of the eastern atom is adjacent to the eastern atom and also adjacent to the western atom,

original: de dag yul gcig pa nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yul gcig pa nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the two atoms would occupy the same place.

original: de ltar ni rdul phra rab shar ma dang nye ba'i rang bzhin de rdul phra rab nub ma rtogs pas gal te 'gyur na de yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni rdul phra rab shar ma dang nye ba'i rang bzhin de rdul phra rab nub ma rtogs pas gal te 'gyur na de yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of the eastern atom that is adjacent to the eastern atom were to become the western atom, then it would also become that.

original: nye ba yod pa ma yin na yang mngon du phyogs pa tsam la yang 'jug pa'i mtha' 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: nye ba yod pa ma yin na yang mngon du phyogs pa tsam la yang 'jug pa'i mtha' 'di kho na ste /
translated: Even if it is not adjacent, this is the only conclusion: it would be merely facing.

original: de las kyang gong bu rdul phra rab tsam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang gong bu rdul phra rab tsam nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it follows that the aggregate would be the size of an atom.

original: yang na rnam par dpyad pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang na rnam par dpyad pa 'di yin te /
translated: Or else, this is the analysis:

original: gang 'di so sor snang bzhin pa 'di re zhig gcig tu rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang 'di so sor snang bzhin pa 'di re zhig gcig tu rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This which appears as individual is not, for the moment, reasonable as one,

original: de ma thag tu brjod pa'i rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu brjod pa'i rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the analysis just stated.

original: du ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it many,

original: rdul phra rab kyi shas las rdul phra rab mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi shas las rdul phra rab mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the non-apprehension of atoms as parts of the atom.

original: de ltar na gal te 'di cha shas dang bcas pa yin na ji ltar rdul phra rab yin /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te 'di cha shas dang bcas pa yin na ji ltar rdul phra rab yin /
translated: Thus, if it has parts, how can it be an atom?

original: ci ste cha shas med pa yin na de la sbyar ba'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar ba'i phyir phan tshun yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes pa gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ro //üîΩri bo yang ste /
analyzed: ci ste cha shas med pa yin na de la sbyar ba'i rdul phra rab rnams kyang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'byar ba'i phyir phan tshun yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes pa gong bu thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ro // ri bo yang ste /
translated: But if it is partless, then the atoms which are joined to it, because of their joining with all of themselves, will be without different locations from each other, and thus all aggregates will be the size of an atom.üîΩEven a mountain,

original: sa gzhi yang ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sa gzhi yang ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: and even the earth.

original: de'i gdon mi za ba dag gi rang bzhin tha dad par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gdon mi za ba dag gi rang bzhin tha dad par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, their natures must be accepted as different.

original: ji ltar 'di dag gi yin pa de ltar 'og dang steng dang lho dang byang gi rdul phra rab dang nye ba rnams kyi yang tha dad pa'o zhes pas rdul phra rab cha shas drug pa nyid rigs pa'i stobs las 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag gi yin pa de ltar 'og dang steng dang lho dang byang gi rdul phra rab dang nye ba rnams kyi yang tha dad pa'o zhes pas rdul phra rab cha shas drug pa nyid rigs pa'i stobs las 'ongs pa'o //
translated: Just as they are, so too are the atoms below, above, to the south, and to the north, and those that are near. Thus, the six parts of the atom come about through the power of reasoning.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: drug gis cig car sbyar ba'i phyir //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the simultaneous conjunction of six,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug nyid 'gyur //
translated: the subtle particle would have six parts.

original: drug po rnams ni yul gcig phyir //
analyzed: drug po rnams ni yul gcig phyir //
translated: Because the six would have one location,

original: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
analyzed: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
translated: the aggregate would be the size of an atom.

original: zhes so // gcig ma grub pa na du ma yang ma grub po zhes pas rdul phra rab rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // gcig ma grub pa na du ma yang ma grub po zhes pas rdul phra rab rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the nonestablishment of one is the nonestablishment of many, the subtle particles do not exist.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na yang snang ba 'di ci'i yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na yang snang ba 'di ci'i yul can yin zhe na /
translated: If external objects do not exist, what is the object of this appearance?

original: snang ba 'di ni nges par thog ma med pa'i ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i bag chags @367b las 'jug bzhin pa dmigs pa med pa kho nar mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: snang ba 'di ni nges par thog ma med pa'i ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i bag chags @367b las 'jug bzhin pa dmigs pa med pa kho nar mtshon par bya ste /
translated: This appearance must be indicated as engaging in the absence of an object due to beginningless misapprehension.

original: de ltar ni yul yod na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar ni yul yod na dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: If there were an object, it would have to be observed.

original: des kyang yan lag can nam rdul phra rab bsags par 'byung bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: des kyang yan lag can nam rdul phra rab bsags par 'byung bar bya ba yin na /
translated: And it would have to arise as a whole or as an aggregation of subtle particles.

original: de dang 'di gnyis ka dag kyang de ma thag tu bshad pa'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas bsal ba'i rtsod pa ni nam mkha'i padma las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dang 'di gnyis ka dag kyang de ma thag tu bshad pa'i gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas bsal ba'i rtsod pa ni nam mkha'i padma las mi 'da'o //
translated: But both of those have been refuted by the valid cognition that has been explained immediately above. The argument does not go beyond the lotus in the sky.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: snang ba dmigs pa med pa ste //
analyzed: snang ba dmigs pa med pa ste //
translated: Appearances are without an object.

original: rmi lam nyams su myong ba 'dra //
analyzed: rmi lam nyams su myong ba 'dra //
translated: They are like the experience of a dream.

original: zhes so // rmi lam gyi shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa kho nar rig cing /
analyzed: zhes so // rmi lam gyi shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa kho nar rig cing /
translated: It is known that even the consciousness of a dream is without an object.

original: rmi lam dang sad pa'i nyams su myong ba dag la dbye ba cung zad kyang yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam dang sad pa'i nyams su myong ba dag la dbye ba cung zad kyang yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And there is not the slightest difference between the experience of a dream and the experience of being awake.

original: rnam pa thams cad chos mthun pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad chos mthun pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are seen to be similar in all aspects.

original: dmigs pa med pa la ngo bo'i khyad par thob pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang 'brel par nyams su myong bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa la ngo bo'i khyad par thob pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang 'brel par nyams su myong bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness that has no object and that has not attained a special nature is also not able to experience a connection with an object.

original: gang dmigs pa med pa las khyad par med pa de ni dmigs pa med pa can yin te /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa med pa las khyad par med pa de ni dmigs pa med pa can yin te /
translated: That which is not different from that which has no object has no object.

original: dper na nam mkha' la skra shad mthong ba gcig las nam mkha' la skra shad mthong ba gnyis pa bzhin /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la skra shad mthong ba gcig las nam mkha' la skra shad mthong ba gnyis pa bzhin /
translated: For example, just as a second seeing of floating hairs in the sky is not different from a first seeing of floating hairs in the sky.üîΩThe consciousness of waking that is the basis of the dispute is not different from the dream consciousness that has no object.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sad pa'i shes pa yang dmigs pa dmigs pa med pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa las khyad par med do zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i sad pa'i shes pa yang dmigs pa dmigs pa med pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa las khyad par med do zhes pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na'o na ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na'o na ci yod ce na /
translated: If external objects do not exist, what does exist?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral ba'i spros pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam don dam par yod do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral ba'i spros pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam don dam par yod do //
translated: Consciousness alone, free from the turbidity of subject and object, exists ultimately.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /üîΩgzung dang 'dzin pa las grol ba'i //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / gzung dang 'dzin pa las grol ba'i //
translated: As it is said:üîΩConsciousness, free from subject and object,

original: rnam par shes pa don dam yod //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don dam yod //
translated: exists ultimately.

original: ces so // yang gsungs pa /üîΩblo yis nyams myong bya gzhan med //
analyzed: ces so // yang gsungs pa / blo yis nyams myong bya gzhan med //
translated: And it is also said:üîΩThere is no other experience than that of the mind;

original: de yis myong ba gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de yis myong ba gzhan yod min //
translated: there is no other experience than that of the mind.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is free from subject and object,

original: de nyid rang nyid rab tu gsal //
analyzed: de nyid rang nyid rab tu gsal //
translated: it is itself manifest.

original: zhes so // 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also taught this:

original: ji ltar phyis pas rnam brtags ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar phyis pas rnam brtags ltar //
translated: Just as it is imagined by the mind,

original: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni yod ma yin //
translated: external objects do not exist.

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: The mind, disturbed by latent tendencies,

original: don du snang ba rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: don du snang ba rab tu 'byung //
translated: appears as objects.

original: zhes so // de la 'ga' zhig smra ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de la 'ga' zhig smra ste /
translated: To this, someone might say:

original: lus dang yul thams cad kyi dngos por rab tu grags pa 'di ni rnam par shes pa kho na yin zhing /
analyzed: lus dang yul thams cad kyi dngos por rab tu grags pa 'di ni rnam par shes pa kho na yin zhing /
translated: This thing that is well known as the body and all objects is only consciousness.
And that is self-awareness.

original: yang rang rig pa'o zhes pas na ci zhig gi yang gzung pa 'am 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang rang rig pa'o zhes pas na ci zhig gi yang gzung pa 'am 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the object of any grasping or fixation.

original: brtags pas ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po sgro 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: brtags pas ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po sgro 'dogs par byed do //
translated: But when it is imagined, it is imagined as the thing that is grasped or the grasper.

original: de'i phyir kun du brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bden pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bden pa'o zhes so //
translated: Therefore, consciousness, which is free from the imagined thing that is grasped or the grasper, is the truth.

original: gzhan rnams ni rnam pa'i rnyog pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag dang bral ba shes dag pa lta bu //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni rnam pa'i rnyog pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag dang bral ba shes dag pa lta bu //
translated: Others think that consciousness is pure, like a crystal sphere, free from all the signs of the turbidity of aspects.üîΩIt is a real thing, like the cloudless sky at midday in the autumn.

original: ston ka dri ma med pa'i nyin phyed kyi nam mkha' lta bu dngos po pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes sems par byed de rnam pa 'di rnams ni de bzhin ma yin pa kho nar ma rig pas bstan pa rab tu gsal ba ste /
analyzed: ston ka dri ma med pa'i nyin phyed kyi nam mkha' lta bu dngos po pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes sems par byed de rnam pa 'di rnams ni de bzhin ma yin pa kho nar ma rig pas bstan pa rab tu gsal ba ste /
translated: But these aspects are clearly taught by ignorance to be something that is not so.

original: de'i phyir gzung ba zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the so-called object does not exist at all.

original: rnam pa thams cad du de med pa'i phyir de la ltos pas gang rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa po de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du de med pa'i phyir de la ltos pas gang rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa po de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it does not exist in any way, the consciousness that depends on it, the apprehender, also does not exist.

original: dbu ma pa rnams kyi lta ba la ni shes pa de yang don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams kyi lta ba la ni shes pa de yang don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For the MƒÅdhyamikas, that consciousness does not exist ultimately,

original: rnam par dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad mi bzod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot withstand analysis.

original: rang bzhin gyis rigs pa ni don dam pa pa'o zhes 'jig rten na brjod cing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rigs pa ni don dam pa pa'o zhes 'jig rten na brjod cing /
translated: That which is reasonable by nature is said to be ultimate in the world.

original: 'di la rnam par dpyad pa na rang bzhin 'ga' zhig 'thad pa yan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par dpyad pa na rang bzhin 'ga' zhig 'thad pa yan ma yin te /
translated: When analyzed, no nature whatsoever is tenable in this [world],

original: gcig pa'am du ma rnam par dpyad pa sngar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa'am du ma rnam par dpyad pa sngar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been explained earlier that it cannot be analyzed as being the same or different.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said:

original: rnam par shes pa don dam pa //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don dam pa //
translated: The ultimate consciousness

original: de yang mkhas rnams mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang mkhas rnams mi 'dod do //
translated: is not accepted by the learned.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral phyir na mkha'i chu skyes bzhin //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang // bral phyir na mkha'i chu skyes bzhin //
translated: Because it is devoid of the nature of being one or many, like a sky-flower.

original: zhes so // grags pa'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // grags pa'i zhabs kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The glorious Candrakƒ´rti also says:

original: gang gis dngos po rnams dpyad na //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po rnams dpyad na //
translated: When one analyzes things,

original: de nyid du ni de dngos med //
analyzed: de nyid du ni de dngos med //
translated: they are not things in reality.

original: gang gi phyir na de rnams na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na de rnams na //
translated: Because they do not have

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med //
translated: the nature of being one or many.

original: ces so // de bzhin du rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // de bzhin du rgyan mdzad pas kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the Ornament of the Middle Way says:üîΩWhen there are no conceptual thoughts here

original: gang tshe 'dir ni rnam rtog dang // gzhan gyi 'ang tshad ma nyid med pa //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dir ni rnam rtog dang // gzhan gyi 'ang tshad ma nyid med pa //
translated: and no valid cognitions of others,

original: de tshe gzhigs par gyur pa na 'ang //
analyzed: de tshe gzhigs par gyur pa na 'ang //
translated: then, even when analyzed,

original: kun la dgag par bya ba ci //
analyzed: kun la dgag par bya ba ci //
translated: what is there to be refuted?

original: sang dang rmi lam sogs dbye ba'am //
analyzed: sang dang rmi lam sogs dbye ba'am //
translated: The distinctions of waking and dreaming, etc.,

original: dam pa'i don du yod min nyid //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du yod min nyid //
translated: do not exist in the ultimate.

original: kun la mnyam par mthong rnams la //
analyzed: kun la mnyam par mthong rnams la //
translated: For those who see all things as equal,

original: dbye ba snang ba min pa nyid //
analyzed: dbye ba snang ba min pa nyid //
translated: the distinctions do not appear.

original: ces so // sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste //
analyzed: ces so // sbyor ba ni 'di ltar bya ste //
translated: The syllogism is to be formulated as follows:

original: gang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not have the nature of being one or many does not ultimately exist,

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma @368b bzhin /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma @368b bzhin /
translated: like, for example, a sky flower.

original: rnam par shes pa yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes pa khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes pa khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Consciousness also has no nature of being one or many.

original: re zhig gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished,

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la phyi rol gyi don bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin mi rung ba yongs su gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la phyi rol gyi don bzhin du gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin mi rung ba yongs su gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: because the inappropriateness of a nature of being one or many is very clear in a cognition that has an aspect, just as in an external object.

original: ; gang la 'jig rten las phyi rol gyi don du tha snyad yin pa de kho na rnam pa dang bcas par smra bas shes pas te /
analyzed: ; gang la 'jig rten las phyi rol gyi don du tha snyad yin pa de kho na rnam pa dang bcas par smra bas shes pas te /
translated: The Proponents of Features say that consciousness is endowed with aspects, and that is the convention for an external object in the world.

original: de'i phyir de phyi rol du yod pa la gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de kho na nang du yod pa la yang gnod par byed ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de phyi rol du yod pa la gnod par byed pa gang yin pa de kho na nang du yod pa la yang gnod par byed ba'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever refutes the existence of external objects also refutes the existence of internal objects.

original: gang gi phyir rags pa gcig gam rdul phra rab tu ma'i ngo bo yang 'thad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rags pa gcig gam rdul phra rab tu ma'i ngo bo yang 'thad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not tenable that a coarse object is either one or many.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di yang gal te rags pa gcig gam rdul phra rab tu tha dad pa du ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rnam pa 'di yang gal te rags pa gcig gam rdul phra rab tu tha dad pa du ma yin na /
translated: If this aspect that has become the nature of consciousness is either a single gross object or many different subtle particles,

original: dbu ma rgyan du /
analyzed: dbu ma rgyan du /
translated: in the Ornament of the Middle Way it is said:

original: bdag nyid chen po bo dhi sa+tva yis //üîΩci ste rnam pa'i grangs bzhin du //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po bo dhi sa+tva yis // ci ste rnam pa'i grangs bzhin du //
translated: The great being Bodhisattva

original: rnam par shes pa khas len na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa khas len na //
translated: If you accept consciousness

original: de tshe rdul phran 'drar gyur pa'i //
analyzed: de tshe rdul phran 'drar gyur pa'i //
translated: to be as numerous as the number of aspects,

original: dpyad pa 'di las bzlog par dka' //
analyzed: dpyad pa 'di las bzlog par dka' //
translated: then it is difficult to avoid this analysis

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: that it would be like the subtle particles.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka ltar na yang phyi rol gyi phyogs la 'byung ba'i sun 'byin pa gdon par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka ltar na yang phyi rol gyi phyogs la 'byung ba'i sun 'byin pa gdon par mi nus so //
translated: In both cases, the refutation of the external object cannot be avoided.

original: gang gi phyir gang gis de yod na yod par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa de phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sun 'byin pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis de yod na yod par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa de phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sun 'byin pa can ma yin te /
translated: Because consciousness, which exists when that exists, is not the refutation of the reason for the external thing.

original: gzugs can yi rgyu mtshan can gyi gnod par byed pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes pa yang snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs can yi rgyu mtshan can gyi gnod par byed pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes pa yang snying po med pa ste /
translated: The objection that the cause of form is not a non-form, i.e., not consciousness, is also pointless.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid la rnam par shes pa yang gzugs can nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid la rnam par shes pa yang gzugs can nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: For consciousness itself is form, because it has aspects.

original: yul la rnam par rgyas pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa 'di kho na ni gzugs can ni zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yul la rnam par rgyas pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa 'di kho na ni gzugs can ni zhes pa'o //
translated: This very aspect that is associated with the expansion in the object is called form.

original: dza gatta la'i gtsug lag khang chen po'i mkhas pa chen po dge slong thar pa'i 'byung gnas kyis sbas pas sbyar ba'i rtog ge'i skad du /
analyzed: dza gatta la'i gtsug lag khang chen po'i mkhas pa chen po dge slong thar pa'i 'byung gnas kyis sbas pas sbyar ba'i rtog ge'i skad du /
translated: This is the treatise called ‚ÄúThe Determination of Inference for Others‚Äù composed by the great scholar, the monk Mok·π£ƒÅkaragupta, a resident of the great monastery of Jagaddala.

original: gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa yongs su bcad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa yongs su bcad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The Determination of Inference for Others is complete.

original: // / rtog ge'i skad 'di byas nas ni //
analyzed: // / rtog ge'i skad 'di byas nas ni //
translated: Having composed this treatise on logic,

original: bdag gis bsod nams gang bsags pa //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams gang bsags pa //
translated: whatever merit I have accumulated,

original: bsod nams de yis 'gro ba 'di //
analyzed: bsod nams de yis 'gro ba 'di //
translated: by that merit may this worldüîΩprogress to the state of Buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du lhag bgrod shog / rtog ge'i skad rdzogs so /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du lhag bgrod shog / rtog ge'i skad rdzogs so /
translated: The Treatise on Logic is complete.

original: // / tshul 'di ni gang zag dam pa rnams kyi bka' drin la brten nas nang dang phyi'i gzhung lugs du ma rnams la bro'i snang ba cher rgyas pa sgra bsgyur gyi lo ts'a ba dbang dge @369a * //

translated: This method was greatly expanded by the kindness of holy beings, and the appearance of the taste of many internal and external scriptures was expanded by the translator-monk Wang-ge-s√∂-long-pal-den-d√∂n-drup.

original: slong dpal ldan blo gros brtan pas pandi ta la ma ltos par rang nyid kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: slong dpal ldan blo gros brtan pas pandi ta la ma ltos par rang nyid kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /

analyzed: // /'dis 'gro ba dpag tu med pa la phan par gyur cig /
translated: May this benefit countless beings.
